Cute little breakfast spot. We waited quite a bit to get a table. We were a group of 3 and they have a much easier time seating tables of 2 as many groups behind us went ahead of us. We sat outside on their patio just off the sidewalk. I had the traditional breakfast. It was pretty good but did not look as appetizing as I expected from seeing other places come out.
Great breakfast and brunch options. They have many food options and everything looked awesome :)

The veggie bowl was packed with many kind of vegetables and tasty gravy. I loved adding their hot sauce for a little bit of kicks.

I would love to go back and cannot wait to try something else.

name: Spoons Diner
reviews:
This is my favorite place to go for breakfast. I went on a Tuesday at 10:00 a.m. No line-up today. It's always packed on the weekends because it is so good. Decent prices, excellent quality and funky atmosphere.
The portions are more than average in my opinion. We both brought home half of our meal.
This is a 6 out of 5 stars place. We had the mini-pancakes, the Side-Chick and the Champignon burger. All 3 were delicious. Definitely worth checking out. The decor is cool as well and the staff is nice. Beware that there may be a lineup, but that‚Äôs because it‚Äôs good.
I want to give Spoons a million stars. This is hands-down one of the best breakfast restaurants in Victoria. The weekly specials are always well thought out and absolutely delicious! The Bailey's benny is one of my favourite things on the menus. The decor is funky and vibrant. They have trivia to keep you entertained at the tables, which is super fun. At peak hangover breakfast time this place can get busy, so be prepared for a line-up. TRUST ME THOUGH, it's worth the wait.
Nice central location with ample free parking. The restaurant is painted in bright colors, it is not very specious, the tables are somewhat packed. We ordered Bangkok Benny and waffle with berry and cream. They both were good but the cream on top of waffle was amazing. The servers were polite and professional. Usually there is a long line up during weekends. Nothing wrong about the restaurant but it was too crowded for me so 4 out of 5 for this reason.
Loved the decor, but then I‚Äôm a bit of a comics geek. Regardless, the food was all amazing and not overpriced. Friendly waitstaff, thanks mamapinkiepie! The sweet prusa for us was a stack of massive chocolate chip pancakes with a peanut butter glaze, yummy! We flipped for it and won the toss!

name: The Urban Cup Cafe
reviews:
Never been here before and my husband and I were ignored üôÅ at the cash register for close to 5 minutes. I get that you're busy, but at least
train your staff to acknowledge people within the first 40 seconds of entering your establishment that they'll be right with you. But to be ignored üôÅ?
Our food arrived promptly but wasn't impressed with the eggs Benedict and hashbrowns. Oh well you win some you lose some.
A cozy diner-esque caf√©, tucked just off of Shelbourne on church Ave, this little caf√© serves up full breakfast and lunch meals along with espresso drinks and drip coffee. Upon entering there is a display of fresh, house-baked goods on the counter, right beside the till. I tried the cranberry and almond muffin (which was massive), a latte, and a bagel with cream cheese and smoked salmon added.
The coffee was standard issue, although I could tell the quality of the espresso was good. My latte was nice and smooth, with a good amount of foam. I hate overly sweet baked goods, and the muffin was not that. It was sweetened nicely with lots of almond slivers and cranberries, and was served with butter on the side. Muffins are warmed quickly in the microwave for each customer which is appreciated for that freshly baked feel.
Urban cup uses bagels from a local bagel-maker called mt.royal bagels. They're OK, in my opinion, but the smoked salmon is awesome! For $7.50 (plus $2.50 for the bagel itself), you get a generous side portion of cream cream cheese, a big, thick cut of smoked salmon, topped with red onion and arugula. The whole affair is served so you can build it yourself if you're taking it to stay. The salmon is slightly sweet, with a great Smokey flavour throughout. Being a thicker piece of salmon is appreciated, vs. the usual few paper-thin slices. The whole thing is delicious and I highly recommend trying the salmon and bagel.
Atmosphere is nothing special. The caf√© is in a bright location with indoor and outdoor seating. The caf√© is right beside Shelbourne which is a very busy main thoroughfare without many trees or bushes to deaden the sound for outdoor tables, so individual mileage may vary with the outdoor seating.

Overall, very cozy digs with good coffee, and a great salmon and cream cheese bagel. Try the fresh baked goods of the day. There are bigger breakfast and lunch menu items that I will be trying on later visits. 8.5/10
Breakfast here is delicious. Can‚Äôt go wrong with the Eggs Benedict with potatoes. All the baked goods we have had are also amazing!

Main complaint/ thing I wish they would change is that they use farmed salmon :(
Would love to see them serve WILD salmon & not support the fish farm industry!
One of my favorite stops on this end of town! Anywhere I can get an omelete after work is perfect to me! Staff are really great and they've done a great renovation fairly recently. So glad to support this business. Food is great and so is the coffee and baked goods!!!
Cute little coffee shop to start off the day! Loved their latte‚Äôs, and they have a variety of other great drinks as well. I had the The smoked meat sandwich with a side of hash browns. I enjoy the use of a burger bun instead of regular bread. Breakfast was great along side my latte.

Food is a little pricy and the portions are small compared to other areas.
I really enjoy having a morning cup while I do some work!

Taste: Good
Presentation: Good
Service: Excellent
Uniqueness: Alright
Atmosphere: Good

name: The Hot and Cold Cafe
reviews:
I‚Äôve been here three times for the chicken soup with rice. I really enjoy it and its a great portion for the price.

Cute cafe and it‚Äôs a nice vibe for cozy.
This is the perfect stop for a quick bite while you‚Äôre out running errands or doing homework. I tried the chicken pozole and a slice of the banana bread. The soup was absolutely amazing! I got a cup of the soup and you have an option for a side of bread or rice. I tried the bread and it was so fresh and went great with the soup. The banana bread wasn‚Äôt the best, it was a little tough to bite into, but I did order it in the afternoon. The cafe itself has only a few tables for mostly groups or two, but many seemed to be available when I went. Will definitely be stopping by again!
We weren‚Äôt sure if this is where we wanted to stop for lunch, but we were glad we did! The staff was very helpful and enthusiastic about our menu choices, and gave us a good timeframe for when we‚Äôd get our food.

The curried egg sandwich was fresh and light, made with their house-made bread. The salad was also really nice and very tasty. Glad we stopped in for a bite!
It took me way too long to try some of the sandwiches here, but now I cannot be stopped. The Creamy Almond Veggie and Sweet Chili Chicken sandwiches are so fresh and delicious, it's everything you can ask for in a sandwich. The soup and salads look very yummy as well, so can't wait to try them. You will find me on the outside street patio with my dog on too many days of the week. Watch out around this time of year, the beautiful tree out front, will pelt you in the head with it's little spiky green acorn thingys.
Really cute spot to have a coffee or grab a bite to eat. I had a bowl of the coconut curry soup. I highly recommend it! There were lots of options for GF and vegetarian.

name: Sour Pickle Cafe
reviews:
The waffle serving is smaller than what I thought, generous whipping cream and overall taste great. But I enjoyed the breakfast wrap more. I love the salsa, sour cream and ketchup that was serve on the side. The breakfast wrap portion is huge so it is better if you share it.
Great little hole in the wall spot.
Will not that there is not many tables within the restaurant if you‚Äôre planning dine in.

The decor is what you‚Äôd expect of a name like Sour Pickle cafe.. there are pickles everywhere, it makes it interesting.

The service was quick from our orders being taken to our meal being served. The food was also good quality for a good price, quite tasty.
I highly recommend checking out this spot for a breakfast/brunch area.
The Sour Pickle is quite pleasing to dine at. Do not go there if you have time restraints because everything is made from scratch. We waited 20-25 minutes, but it was worth it.

The Denver breakfast item is only on their special item menu posted outside the establishment, and I really enjoyed it! The sandwich is toasted to perfection and filled with so many healthy goodies. It came with a side of potatoe salad which was the best I have ever had... ever.

The Tortilla Omelet is a HUGE serving with lightly fried potato in the side. If you like garlic, then this is the breakfast item for you. My brother and dad enjoyed it.

The Veggie Omelet is also quite enjoyable here. The cheese ontop the egg is notably flavorful with the basil pesto.
My favourite place to get breakfast with friends! Every time we go here, we are treated to excellent service and good food at a reasonable price. We will definitely continue to have weekend brunch here in the future. My go-to is the egg enchiladas.
This is a very nice small family owned cafe 10 min walk from downtown Victoria.
They have great options for breakfast and lunch. Their omelettes are really good!
I was surprised by the bubble tea as well.
They do not accept credit card. Only cash or debit

name: Rise and Grind Coffee & All Day Breakfast Sandwiches
reviews:
the sandwiches were so good! we got the strawberry banana smoothie as well, which was really good. i got the chicken BLAT, which tasted really good too. i loved the avocado in there. we were able to sit inside, but there‚Äôs also outdoor seating and the atmosphere is nice and clean. restrooms available as well :)
Rise and Grind on Broad Street is easily my favourite go-to casual breakfast, brunch, and coffee destination in downtown Victoria. The food options are diverse and made to order, plus the brewed fresh Discovery Coffee is always a hit. Highly recommended, never disappointed.
Finally after 2 years living downtown I have found a coffee shop that is absolutely wonderful. They have excellent breakfast, amazing/healthy lunch options and more. The staff are nice and welcoming, and not snobby or pretentious like many of the other coffee/breakfast spots downtown Victoria. Excellent location too!! Look forward to coming to Rise and Grind (almost) every morning. Thank you for your great cafe and service!!
Wow amazing breakfast sandwich I had there. Their ingredients were super fresh and of high quality, the recipe and choice of ingredients were a perfect blend of flavor which delivered an harmonious taste experience. The portion was satisfying and the price decent.
I recommend.
Totally awesome little spot. I had an excellent almond milk latte and we had great sandwiches. Awesome selection for under 10 bucks (most have bacon and avo so they aren‚Äôt light!). The crowd was a mix of tourists and locals and the decor & music were tight! Definitely a great choice for fast, filling, tasty, and cheap breakfast.

name: The Ruby on Johnson
reviews:
This just may have been the best breakfast I've ever ordered at a restaurant. We ordered the berry waffles and the poutine benny and my oh my were they delicious. The contrast between the sweet and savory meals was delightful (my wife and I shared our meals). The waffles were honestly the best waffles I have ever eaten. Each bite nearly brought a tear to my eye from being so tasty. The only complaint is that I live about 1000 miles away from The Ruby üòû. This restaurant alone tempts me to uproot my family and move to Victoria just to eat breakfast here every week.

A side note, we were with our 17 month old baby and the staff was sooo kind and accommodating with him.
You definitely gotta try this out!! We knew this diner has a special history which I can tell why locals keep coming back. Mesmerizing decor and menu is extensive; it was hard to decide where to sit and what to order. We tried their delicious breakfast menu. Generous portion and we were so full that we needed to walk it out. The staff was humble and all their recommendations were spot on. Must try !!
Took a while to get food out because they were so busy. But wow worth the wait! Everything was delicious.  The atmosphere was fun. Will  definitely come back if we're going to come visit Victoria again. Thanks!
This place is spectacular. I'm a big breakfast guy and actively seek out good breakfast joints.  This is by far my favorite in Victoria. The service, the food, the atmosphere, and the fact they're open early (early bird here).

I got the brisket hash which was absolutely amazing. I love hash and the two poached eggs over brisket with crispy potato hash was the perfect meal after my morning workout.
The Ruby is connected to the hotel we are staying at next door. Breakfast is not included in the room rate but this is very convenient. The cappuccino is delicious. I had eggs and bacon with hash and toast and everybody else helped me eat the bacon and hash. I am told the quinoa cooked in coconut milk is very tasty. The server was very personable. There was no marmalade for my toast. They did bring Splenda for my cappuccino. Water comes in mason jars not glasses. The menu is huge. They don‚Äôt do dinner.

name: Sandwich Corner Cafe
reviews:
Support local business as I see bigger lineups on Bigger restaurants but trust me this cafe was a perfect stop for me and the quality of the food was surprisingly great. The lady on the counter was so generous and I can‚Äôt really wait to go there again. Highly recommend
Lovely lady helped us with our lunch! Definitely a good spot for a quick meal.
Great place to have breakfast.  Delicious coffee, sandwiches, bacon omelet option and soup of the day. The atmosphere is cozy and friendly.
Best vanilla bean frappe I‚Äôve ever had!! Food is top notch and deserts are generous portions for the price you pay. This is my go-to on a Sunday afternoon. The owners are a ray of sunshine too.
Cute little neighborhood spot run by two very nice people. Sandwiches, coffee (hot and cold), salads, breakfast, baked goods, soups all for sale. Such a cozy little spot during my short day trip to Victoria.

name: Bear & Joey Cafe
reviews:
A cute little spot to have a nice brunch! The decor and vibe of this restaurant is awesome along with great service.the staff was also very accommodating for dietary restrictions.

They also have a small boutique where you can purchase scrubs, stationery, apparel, accessories and candles

We ordered:

-  "The Vacation" pressed juice - perfect if you want a sweet and refreshing drink
- Breakfast burger with truffle fries
- Mushroom toast with cashew cheese
I‚Äôve been in this restaurant twice: once sat outside and once inside.
Pros: food is delicious and healthy,
Service is nice and friendly,
Decor and furniture is modern and relaxing colours,
Outside patio with heater,
Some beautiful and cute merchandise.

Con: there is something wrong with audio insulation of the restaurant that makes it very noisy. So if you need a cosy and quiet place that you can chat easily with friends, it‚Äôs better to sit outside.
Have been meaning to check it out for awhile now. Only a forty minute wait to get a table on late Saturday morning. Great coffee selection. Food came to the table quickly. Both the breakfast sandwich and the tuna salad were delicious. Will definitely go back.
Bear & Joey is one of my favourite brunch restaurants in Victoria! I‚Äôd say the best patio setup with heaters if needed, allows for dogs / has water station, excellent service and professionalism. We had the Avocado Toast and added prosciutto, and the PotatoRosti and added the bacon + avocado. The bacon literally melts in your mouth, it‚Äôs so good. Coffee and Kombucha also a great choice! Highly recommend.
Our friends have been urging us to try this place. But we had a ferry to catch and didn't want to be stuck downtown. However, after Google guided us to a less-than-appealing cafe in Christchurch, we decided that we might as well try Bear and Joey. I was dressed in sensible 'ferry-traveling-and-hiking' garb and we didn't have a reservation, the ma√Ætre d' wasn't thrilled but seated us anyway. One of the original reason I hesitated in coming was the menu. But once we were there, the menu made a lot more sense and we actually had a hard time choosing. My weakness was breakfast sandwich, but at the last minute, I ordered the pork belly sandwich. My partner ordered the fresh toast, of course! We think this place should get a Michelin Star for sure. From ingredients to execution, the food was amazing. I usually only eat salad because it is healthy but actually hating it. But the Bear and Joey kohlrabi and picked cabbage salad was AMAZING, not boring at all. I couldn't stop eating it and finished the salad before attacking the fennel and orange pork belly sandwich. The bread was extra crusty which was quite enjoyable. The pork belly had enough fat to melt in my mouth. Consuming this was a wondering experience. There was a lot of 'mmm' sounds and smiles coming from across the table while my partner enjoyed the french toast. There was a lot more variety of fruit on the french toast that were not mentioned on the menu. If this place was in Vancouver, I imagine it might take us a while to get a reservation. Well done!

name: Floyd's Diner James Bay
reviews:
Always worth the wait to get in! Went for a brunch date, had absolutely fantastic service, delicious coffee, very generous half order of pancakes with toppings, and I added a side of crispy bacon. Was offered a small sample of the optional lemon curd and strawberry coulis üçãüçìüíñ that was a taste sensation. It tasted obviously made from scratch with love. Like a flavour bomb going off! Unreal. More please!
What a wonderful time and experience in Victoria. We were in the area to try and see if we could go to blue Fox Caf√© originally, but there was such a long lineup that we decided to check into our hotel and look around the neighborhood. Our eyes could not avert the beautiful hot pink colour that was this little diner. Floyd's has a great menu with breakfast brunch and lunch items and the staff are so kind. We ordered the chicken and waffles Benny and the BC hash and the portions are very generous and reasonable. Each dish still comes in around 18-20$ but we felt it was worth it. Highly recommend if you're in the area. As an additional note, the washrooms are tiny and I would say accessibility wise it is a little tight. They also have seating outdoors which is quite nice.
Casual local diner in a lovely little neighborhood. The restaurant itself is very eclectic, with a friendly and nostalgic atmosphere ‚Äî magenta exterior, mismatched artwork on the walls, no frills decor and aesthetic. Super friendly service, servers had lots of suggestions for things to do in the city. Good prices and honestly really great breakfast ‚Äî serving up that thicc bacon, they don‚Äôt mess around. Darn good eggs, and what I believe to be house made or locally made sour dough (honestly some of the best sourdough ever). Can‚Äôt wait to go back next time I visit the island
I tried the vegetarian hash... it tasted good. The salsa was really yummy. The potatoes were crispy. The rest of the food : poutine and the lumberjack was tasty too. The food was fresh and the portion was good for 2. They also have bottomless coffee for 4.25..
The staff was friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this diner. They serve all day breakfast and lunch. The wait time for a table was 10 minutes. Street parking available.
The food was delicious. Usually, there is a line at the diner. Luckily none during our visit. Every food we ordered were in huge portion and mouthwatering. Everything on the menu sounds tasty.

The diner was really clean and cute. Customer service was awesome. All crews were friendly and approachable. We went back to our hotel full and happy with the service we experienced.

We will be back here again on our next visit. To taste their yummy food.

name: Shine Cafe
reviews:
Delicious food, but terrible service!
Ive always had a great experience at the downtown location, but this one on Fort was simply horrible.
Arriving on site to 3 dirty tables outside, no biggie.
Our meal was delivered without cutlery and I had to get up to go get my own.
No one asked once how our meal was.
In fact, when my Eggs Benedict arrived, she placed in front of me a half order and said, "Here's one. The second will arrive shortly."
How about just deliver me what I ordered?
I had to ask for more water which didn't even happen after requesting it.
After sitting around for 10 minutes, I finally decided to go inside to pay because no one was coming over to help us.
Just a lame experience overall.
We had Sunday brunch. It was very busy but they did their best in getting us seated and served as quick as possible.  Food was delicious! We had the lemon berry French toast and full breakfast. The Scottish scones were delicious too!
This quaint little breakfast place is the cutest! I loved the decor and the old-timey atmosphere! The food was massive portions for the price, and everything was dont so well, you can taste the love they used to cook your food! The service was friendly and personable. Everyone looked happy to be there!
Their mimosa was really good as a side point, they used pulpy orange juice for mine and I was overjoyed!!
I really hope you think about eating here next time you're in the neighborhood, some of the best food I've had across Canada!
amazing servers and lovely atmosphere - got a chai latte which was delicious and the southern belle eggs benedict with scottish potato scone. I wasn't the biggest fan of the eggs benedict but it was just not the flavour combo for me! would have loved another type for sure
The food was delicious, they served very quick and the waitress was very nice. Although we waited for 30 minutes to get in; was a great time and food.

name: Morning People
reviews:
I‚Äôm giving Morning People 5 Stars because I can‚Äôt give them 10 on here! Everything from the quality of food, flavour and creativity is absolute perfection. I‚Äôve been here many times and the food is always great. The staff are the most friendliest group of people this side of Victoria! Even when they are so busy, they make an effort to chat with the customers and make them feel welcome. They have a huge variety of delicious food, including the two pictured below. Peanut butter bowl, and a side of smash potatoes!
We ordered a sausage party and two peanut butter bowls. The food was excellent and quite enjoyable! This place is a food truck so there is seating available under tents. The reason we are giving this place four stars instead of five was because they don‚Äôt really have a large variety of drink options that you would except from a place that serves breakfast/brunch/lunch options. Other than that, the food was super enjoyable and there‚Äôs a large variety.
Decided to try this breakfast food truck. I had the loaded dish, which was great. My accompanying party had the vegetable sandwich, which was also good, but maybe priced a little high. Service was quick and polite. I'd recommend.
Great little breakfast spot. Pictured here is the smashed hash; potatoes with egg & sauce. Delicious and filling. I‚Äôve eaten through pretty much everything on their menu now and it‚Äôs all superb. Excellent customer service as well.
This food is definitely a reason to be up before 7am! I personally am not a breakfast person but I am now. Their loaded hash puts Denny's famous smothered and covered to shame. Friendly and fast service and amazing food! What else can you ask for? Telling everyone I know about this and will definitely be back! 10/10

name: Cora Breakfast and Lunch
reviews:
We came here for breakfast. The staff really friendly, helpfull and quick respond.
We ordered 3 items which were
-3 meat burger which came with crispy bacon and tasty patty beef. The bun not too dry which was good.
- Adam Waffle Bananas Caramel is recommended because the mix within bandana and waffle with custard really new for me but it perfectly combines.
- the Gargantuan Breakfast just regular breakfast with additional cantaloupe melon, the great thing the pancakse it's soft and has berry in it.
Really salty and sweet in 1 plate.
Quite busy but the staff made sure we got everything we needed despite being short staffed. Food was great but quite a large menu so I would suggest looking at it before coming here. Fruit was nice and fresh. My partners ham was a little overcooked and the coffee was a little watered down but I enjoyed the experience.
Best breakfast in Victoria- you can get anything you want from omelettes to pancakes and French toast, sandwiches, and so much more. The ingredients are so fresh and the fruit they serve is making - melons, berries - even gooseberries- kiwi, banana and more . This is just the side fruit that comes with the meal.  Simple decor , friendly staff - definitely a destination for an amazing breakfast
This restaurant/ server gave us such a weird vibe. The server did all the regular work, but he was grumpy. He wanted us to order quick, eat extremely quick and leave even the restaurant is not busy (weekday 12 to 1pm).

To Owner: thank you for your reply and kind offer. Just hope this is just individual situation.
Large menu with kids menu as well. Food is OK and prices are OK although sides and coffee are a bit pricy. We had 2 coffees ($7) 2 adult meals, 1 kids meal, and 2 sides - total was $58 before tip. Decent place for breakfast if you're craving that.

name: Blue Fox Cafe
reviews:
Amazing breakfast spot in Downtown Victoria. When we go early in the morning already had line up so can see how popular it is. It‚Äôs featured in so many articles about the breakfast you have to try in Victoria. Actually at beginning we are little skeptical but it turns out it‚Äôs very good. The portion is huge and they are generous on putting ingredients the plates are full :). We are super full after eating that we skip the lunch. We highly recommend this to if you want to try traditional breakfast in this beautiful city
Really good dishes! I tried the Fox‚Äôs grill and it was really delicious. We waited 1hour 30min to get in. It was surely worth it. Very good serving, you get full real fast! Great breakfast!
They are usually pretty busy and there was a wait for us to get in, but definitely worth it. The food was very yummy and very large portions for the price, I would definitely recommend. One plate would‚Äôve honestly been enough for both my friend and I. The decor and ambience is also very nice, service is quite attentive. Although a tad slow because of how busy they were. I would definitely come again.
One of those rare times the lineup wasn't very long so we took advantage.  It's a busy spot but the service was efficient and the food came out quickly.  I had the Angel Eyes Eggs Benny.  The eggs were perfectly cooked.  The homefries were crispy.  Didn't find it had oodles of flavour, but of course that has more to do with my choice of order.  My friend had the Moroccan Chicken Club which he really liked.  Will go back, but likely not when it's lined up.
There was a line up outside the door, but luckily it moved fairly quickly. Service was quick, and the portions were huge. The food was delicious, we were very happy with our meals! I would definitely come back for breakfast again.

name: Picnic Too
reviews:
My family and I decided to stop in for brunch and we were all surprised at how delicious the food and coffee was. The staff were very friendly, the atmosphere was nice and they had good music playing too!
Food is good, the burrito was very flavourful and wrapped well. Giving it 4 stars only because they automatically charge you 15% for tips. The only service we got was the staff bringing out our food to the table. Not sure if that warrants a 15% mandatory tip.
My dad and I were visiting Victoria on our way to shop RVs for my parents across the island. Dad ate the Vegan Hash, which he said was so delicious, large portion and very filling, while I shopped a few stores nearby. As I finished, I returned for a Chai Tea Latte with oat milk and it was also well done; flavorful, smooth and creamy. Would visit again next trip!
Came here for breakfast sandwiches and loved the cozy laid back vibes.  The breakfast sandwiches we got were sooooo tasty ü§§  I got the Owen and my partner got the Weekender, both amazing.  The kind of delicious where you zone out while eating it because you're just lost in the flavours.  YUM!
Ordered the congee.

As a biased person being Asian, it was not the congee I expected especially visually. This one was outstanding with colors and textures. The bold ingredients were sitting atop a bed of thick brown rice. The rice was not too viscous and also not as fluid as Asian congee would be generally.  It might be close to the viscosity of oats where it will still fall out of your spoon if you tip it over but not immediately.

The temperature also is quite different.  I'm guessing this was about 50¬∞C / 122¬∞F.

So eating the congee, the ingredients were grouped together and arranged quite thoughtfully. I thought of mixing everything together just like you generally would in an Asian congee, but my senses at this point whispered otherwise.

So I went about my dish picking the ingredients, often combining 2-3 at a time as I was scouring away from the bed of viscous rice underneath. I found that eating it this way gives an easier time to distinguish and appreciate the flavors and textures as compared to having everything mixed together.  This made the dish quite engaging as you try different combinations of the ingredients. It was light yet felt.
Different from Asian congee and unique in it's way.

name: Denny's
reviews:
This Denny's is amazing! The staff are all so kind and helpful and the chefs are really good at getting your order just the way you like it! I normally get the eggs benni and like the eggs poached soft and my hashbrowns very well done - they get the order perfect every time! My partner got the cinnamon Pancake and also highly recommends, says it tastes just like a cinnamon bun! We also really appreciated that all the staff, including the chefs, are all still wearing their masks, makes us feel a lot safer eating out. Can't wait to come back here!
Dinner was very satisfying was very delicious. My whole family was so satisfied. Walter U was an excellent Server. Super friendly fast & efficient with taking our Orders.
üíµ: A bit pricey

üçú: We ordered
ü•õ Oreo and Vanilla Milkshake 4‚≠ê
Probably a little too sweet
ü•©T-Bone Steak 3‚≠ê
I asked for it to be medium rare but it's served done üòÖ
üçó Platter 4‚≠ê
Combination of 2 types of potato, cheese ball, and Chicken strips. Just okay
üêüFish and Chips 4‚≠ê
It tasted okay. But, not really a fan of Fish

üç±: The portion  of the order is for 2pax

‚åõ: The wait time is just right. Around 10-15mins.

üë•: Service is good but they don't accept tips for cash payments. Only through cards.
Ah Denny‚Äôs!  From complimentary birthday Grand Slams (that‚Äôs I went this time), or late night ‚Äúafter the pub closes‚Äù burgers, we all grew up with Denny‚Äôs.  This one in Victoria is friendly and fast with great service!  Enjoy!
The food is good. The service could improve. The atmosphere is ok.
Definitely a place to have an ok breakfast and that's it.

name: Broughton Street Deli - Breakfast, Lunch & Catering
reviews:
Literally my favourite place to get food in Victoria. The staff is extremely friendly and the food is THE BEST there is. Always SUPER FRESH AND TASTY. my favourite things are their Montreal meat sandwich with their homemade sweet and spic.  Plus their chicken noodle soup reminds me of something my mom makes when I‚Äôm sick but even better. ( sorry mom). The chicken strips are like no others you‚Äôve had in the city. They are buttery and taste like the are made fresh as well. The portions are HUGE and I can‚Äôt get over how delicious everything is. I‚Äôve tried quite a few of the deserts and of course they do not disappoint. They taste homemade and so fresh.  The Halong Bay Salad is something I tried new and of course it was exceptional like everything I‚Äôve ever tried. Their food is worth every penny and I promise you won‚Äôt be disappointed. I‚Äôd start with the Montreal meat sandwich with homemade sweet and spicy mustard. You‚Äôll thank me later. I‚Äôve tried so many delis and sandwiches in Victoria since I‚Äôve lived here my whole life and NOTHING EVEN COMES CLOSE TO THEIR INSANELY , DELICIOUS FOOD WHICH WILL HAVE YOU COMING BACK FOR MORE. I ORDER AT LEAST 1-3x a week it‚Äôs that good ( even if I don‚Äôt eat it that day I know it‚Äôs made fresh so I can keep it in my fridge for the next day or 2 and it still tastes phenomenal). Also the customer service is amazing. Tron goes above and beyond to make his customers happy. Trust me when I say it‚Äôs one of Victoria‚Äôs best kept secrets. I promise you‚Äôll be so happy with any food item you choose and they have something for everyone !! Try it ASAP
Cute interior, central location, good service. I got the Montr√©al smoked meat sandwich and squash curry soup - The smoked meat isn't Schwartz or Dunn's quality but it was still good. The soup was delish.
Cute little cafe with some amazing sandwiches and cookies!

Their smoked meat sandwiches are by far their best thing on menu. Pieces were fair and there is a tone of other options as well. They even have some Vietnamese dishes as well, most notably Vietnamese sandwiches.

The atmosphere is beautiful, almost reminding of a classic dinner. Service is extremely quick for how small yet busy it gets! I would most definitely recommend coming for some breakfast!
I got their daily lunch special which I believe is the Montreal beef sandwich. Bread's really soft and fresh and the meat was succulent and fully loaded (ordered the super size). Polished off the coleslaw which tells you something because I usually despise coleslaw in general, and the chips are good sized and crisp. Owners running the shop are very polite and the food was made to order at a very decent speed (wife at the shop slicing away at the mandolin while husband was chatting with me and the work colleague who recommended this place to try)

For those who are griping about pricing of food... seriously, use your thinking caps on. Rent ain't cheap and they're in a prime location. They're not a franchise or a chain, and there is a lot of overhead plus the rising costs of food ingredients in general. It causes me to facepalm when shoddy reviewers make an incredible poor comparison when their education is lower than a 10th grader and have absolute zero business knowledge. The pricing is on par with the value of the entrees.

Anyway, keep up with the good work. I probably can't afford it on a daily basis because I'm usually a glutton with good food nowadays and can easily burn a hole if I'm not careful but definitely worth it as a weekly or monthly treat for me.
Very casual, small local joint but great Montreal smoked meat sandwiches!!!  Very friendly owners who genuinely care that you enjoy whatever you order on their menu. A must experience.

name: Farmhouse Victoria
reviews:
They have really, really good coffee and sandwiches here.  I went  back a couple of times. They have breakfast sandwiches that are popular and also lunch sandwiches. They are delicious and huge!  Everything is really fresh. They also have really good muffins as well, I had a coffee cake one and it was really tasty.
It's 9:30 and there was NO line. Very clean with a view of the harbor. Excellent latte and the banana bread delicious.  Surprisingly, they don't ask for a tip.
Come here.
Delicious korean sandwich and coffee, I really recommend this place. There's an outdoor seated area and public tables.
I had the Farmhouse Classic and an iced hazelnut latte. The sandwich was a good portion, piled with ingredients, super tasty. It was a little spicy from the Serrano Mayo but not in an overpowering way. The ingredients were very fresh and the bun was soft and held up well. The latte was also very good. The coffee was smooth and they offer alternative milks with no additional up charge. Would highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for a good breakfast spot!
Literally the best sandwiches and service around with the kindest/ friendly & welcoming staff. I can't wait to try all the sandwiches on the menu cause they never disappoint and I encourage everyone to go! Generous portions and so fresh and tasty every, single time.

name: Cafe Jumbo
reviews:
My personal favourite cafe in all of Canada! The coffee was aromatic and just the right level of sweetness. The breakfast sandwich was superb as well! Made to order and freshly delivered to your hands :)
We ordered sandwiches and coffee for here and were the only guests. Two ladies were at the counter split tasks: one shared stories with her colleague and the other worked. That led to our us being finished with the sandwiches when the coffee was done - we then took it to go... The sandwiches were okay. I only received the components for mine and had to put those 3 together myself. They didn't have any sides but were good. All in all an average experience.
The breakfast sandwich was amazing ! One of the best I have ever had. The place is a hidden gem in downtown . Will definitely recommend üíØüëçüèº
Just had the best london fog of my life here, and I‚Äôm addicted to london fogs. Also the panini was *chef‚Äôs kiss*. Would happily come back to this cafe any day!
Friendly staff and delicious panini (real chicken)! Can‚Äôt wait for their full launch!!

name: Nourish Kitchen & Cafe
reviews:
Nourish is hands-down the best breakfast spot in Victoria, and in fact one of the best restaurants overall. The food is farm-to-table, and prepared with love and care in delicious and often unexpected ways. The restaurant is dairy-free, gluten-free, and organic, and is loved by us and our kids. We particularly like the eggs Benny, which are prepared with a delicious cashew cream sauce. The seedy bread is also terrific. The coffee drinks are especially creative and are served with beautiful flourishes of design and usually edible flowers. The manager, Amira, is so incredibly kind and attentive. All in all, this is a wonderful restaurant.
Gem of gems in Victoria and probably in BC as a whole. Exquisite presentation all around, both in the beautiful plating of the kitchen selections and the layout of the place. The cafe drinks in particular were stunning, visually speaking.

What truly makes this place stand out is the homemade quality of what seems to be the most fresh ingredients‚Ä¶ both plates we had were delicately crafted: ample sweetness, tasteful seasonings, beautiful pairing of ingredients, humble portions, and a soaring sense of ‚Äúfreshness.‚Äù While prices are justifiably premium, it is more than fair considering the relentless quality of every offering on the menu and sincerity of the staff.

All around, an incredibly memorable and enjoyable dining experience. Quite the standout in what might be one of the best spots on the island!
The cutest heritage house with delicious brunch made with fresh local ingredients. We had the half and half (pancake and half Benny), the golden Benny and their bone broth. Everything was colourful, flavourful, and high quality. Highly recommend you go at least 15min before they open so you can snag the first seating.
Very unique menu! Beautiful location. I got the dandelion beverage with chaga (in photos) and was pleasantly surprised as to how tasty it was! The coffees and broths were also great quality. I had the tartine, my sister had sleeping beauty pancakes, and my dad had the golden Benny with extra bacon. Of the three, our favorite was the Benny (especially the bacon) and the pancakes. You will not be disappointed.
We had an absolutely fantastic experience here!
And will definitely be back.

The food was delicious and super fresh (ps I love how small their menu is! Always better to do a few things, but very well, instead of doing lots and nothing really right‚Ä¶)

The drinks were creative and very good. Perfect temperature to drink them straight away - not too hot, not too cold (we ordered the beet latte and a cappuccino).

Also, how cute and beautiful is this place, which is located in a cute house right in the neighborhood‚Ä¶

Last but not least, they also have a little store/to go area in case you don‚Äôt want to go in for a sit down meal!

name: Miche Cafe & Bar
reviews:
One of my favorites hidden gems in Victoria! ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è The food is outstanding, the portions huge and Michelle and Alan are always so welcoming and friendly.  They make you feel right at home. Make sure you come hungry!  These pictures are all from their "Miche around the world" Friday theme nights.

Lunch menu averages $10-$15 but for supper, I indulge a bit more. I love that desert is included with the Friday nights.
Miche cafe is phenomenal! One of the last genuine mom and pop‚Äôs in the city- and it‚Äôs easy to see how they survived the pandemic (thank goodness!) Cozy and social atmosphere, incredible food and even better service. Michelle and Alan are truly delightful people. Easily my new favourite hidden gem in Victoria! Highly recommended the Coconut Curry Lentil soup and the life-changing Focaccia that comes with. Whether you‚Äôre a local or passing through: you must!
Lovely experience. Very welcoming and such a unique space. We will definitely be back as it gave such a feeling of comfort and joy. The owner made sure we were taken care of. Our son loved his chocolate chip cookie :)
A true precious gem in Greater Victoria. A small family owned and run local business with top-shelf, tasty  homemade creations combined with good, old-fashioned customer service.  When we were there the owners were fully engaged and present and genuinely cared about the food and the needs and desires of customers, checking in to see if anything was needed.  We really appreciated this concern and commitment to service . All food offerings were generous portions of scrumptious dishes presented with an obvious love of food more common in Quebec than western Canada. Will definitely recommend without hesitation.
Lovely hidden place with a relaxing and cozy ambiance. Coffee was good. The server/owner was super friendly and sweet. The food was the only reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 - taste of garlic was a bit too strong for me personally. Overall, I had a great afternoon here and will come back for coffee if I ever pass by the area.

name: Soupa Cafe
reviews:
We won a gift certificate and had never been here. We went in on a wet, cold day and had a bowl of chili and a bowl of chicken stew soup. They were both delicious, you can tell they were homemade. Very pleasant staff. A bit pricey but I think it's like that everywhere now. $13 for a bowl of soup/stew. We were very pleased overall.
I can't say enough AMAZING things about this place! I ordered through skip, had never heard of them and took a chance! I'm so happy I did! One of my new favourite places to add to my list! I order a lot of skip for my picky eater mom in long-term care and she LOVED everything from turkey, brie + spinach sandwich on rye to the coconut chicken soup and even the Cobb Salad! A great way to get her to eat her veggies!

Thank you Soupa team and for double checking the receipt to make sure I had everything for my order! You will definitely hear from me again very soon! Through skip  and hopefully in person sometime in the near future.

Love the real turkey in the sandwich and Cobb salad! Best bacon I have ever had!
I'm going to tell everyone to go here!
I visited for the first time downtown as I was looking for a soup place. I had the veg chilli and it tasted better than I expected. They offer toppings for your soup which I liked a lot.  The bread that came with it was good and moist. I also picked up a vegan brownie which was yummy. I found the price very reasonable. The staff were super friendly. I'd definitely return.
We heard so many great things and were very eager to try out the newer Esquimalt location for our Friday night take out meal. The staff were amazing and friendly,  and the restaurant smelled amazing at time of pickup.

I tried the daily special, a 7 grain chicken soup, and my wife got the creamy mushroom. They both looked and smelled awesome, but after the first bite we were both really disappointed... all we could taste was salt. I've had canned soup with significantly less salt content. I was quite hungry, so despite this I finished it, but my wife could barely eat half. By the end of the night my joints felt swollen and my face was puffy, it was that salty.

I'm glad that so many people enjoy their products, local  businesses deserve that love, but  unfortunately,  we won't be going back.
Let's get to the point: this was the best breakfast bagel I've ever had. The food in this new little restaurant is exquisite, seemingly simple yet beautifully flavoured. As for options, there seem to be a humble yet varied menu of both classics and vegetarian options available, and the staff were more than willing to accommodate me when I mentioned an allergy. I wish I could show you a picture of what I chose, but I ate it too fast! But suffice to say, the breakfast egg'n'bacon bagel is well worth your time.

The staff here are very friendly and helpful. They brought me my breakfast within short order, and checked up on me after to see how I was doing and to make sure i was enjoying myself. I was! The interior is clean and simple as well, nothing dramatic or overstated, although the table art is very fun to look at.  Fairly spacious too. It's a bit like a diner, fresh and to the point, but much less greasy.

In short, don't pass by this little place if you can help it. It's a little startup with a big heart, and it shows in the taste of what you eat.

name: Belleville's Watering Hole & Diner
reviews:
The food was great and it is awesome having a full service bar and restaurant in your hotel only a few steps from the elevator. The food presentation was perfect and the portions were large. I ate both breakfast and dinner here and was not disappointed. Where else can you get both chicken and waffles & red snapper fish and chips under the same roof?
I stopped by on an extremely hot day for lunch with a friend. The patio was great to sit on and has a great view of the inner harbor. You are able to see the sea plane come in and out. The food was also great, I had the falafel sliders, and they were great. Good atmosphere and the wait staff were very friendly and accommodating. Thank you.
Finally decided to come check out Bellevilles for brunch and my god it was delicious. We tried all of the specials they had on and we're not disappointed whatsoever. The food was top notch, the services was friendly, and the atmosphere was delightful. I will definitely be back!!
Bursting with flavour! Beautiful presentation. Pleasant, attentive service. Time and allergy sensitive service. Decor which promotes local artist Paul Archer and takes you on a visual adventure to remember.  An awesome way to start the day.
Some of Victoria's best eggs Benedict and hundy Victoria's best tater tots. Also, breakfast happy hour specials if you're so inclined. Nice large patio overlooking the bay too.

name: The Vic Cafe
reviews:
It's very clean and quiet because it's a cafe in The vic hotel. The staff is kind and the food is reasonable, so you can enjoy your time peacefully.
Staff were superb and very friendly. The coffee was nice and they were very nice about working around the combos for alternative choices. Only problem was the food, I am incredibly disappointed about the avocado bean burrito. I was unimpressed that the beans tasted like they came out of a Heinz beans can and the avocado wasn‚Äôt ripe, it was hard and had no taste as it wasn‚Äôt ready to be used yet. Very small as well
for almost $9, I would have went somewhere else for breakfast if I knew it was going to be like that..
As a proud resident of the Gorge neighbourhood, I am thrilled to see a coffee shop open up. My Americano was delicious and I look forward to trying everything else on the menu. I also saw that they have baby chairs, which is always a bonus as a parent.
Had the eggvacado bean burrito... the beans were from a can and the egg was very dry and the burrito for what you actually got was not worth the price in my opinion. If your in a pinch then this will suffice but if you have options go check out another eatery. The atmosphere is underwhelming and there is only two dining tables to actually eat at, the rest of the seating is couch style with coffee tables for eating. Service was like going to a coffee shop, nothing extra. My husband had a latte and said it was burnt tasting.
Im so happy to have a little coffee place I can walk to with decent hours. The coffee is excellent. The lady at the front is so sweet. The food was awesome, small and simple but very good (and well priced). We will definitely be back! üòÑ My bf says "its a good cuppa mocha"

name: Frank's Honeybun Cafe
reviews:
Frank‚Äôs Honeybun Cofe is a local favourite. They serve delicious breakfast food and American Chinese food that can‚Äôt be beat. Check their window for a daily special!
Okay. Context. This is not a fancy place. But they deserve a 4 because of no frills, straightforward Chinese food that I am familiar with. Savory. Tasty. With all the sauce, noodles, rice and viand combinations. If you‚Äôre in Downtown in looking for a comfort food, this is the place!
Honest Chinese food at a reasonable price.  Consistent and reliable. The menu does not change that I have noticed, but what ever they make, the food is good. Friendly and helpful.
excellent in every way. food. service, price.
Would have liked more clients to be here for breakfast...will be back!
Cute little place, definitely didn't expect breakfast to be as good as what it was. Prices are right, decent portion size, and good service. While maybe not my go to restaurant, I wouldn't complain about having to eat here!

name: West Coast Waffles
reviews:
My husband, son and I, ate at WestCoast Waffles and were delighted with the waffles. Hubby ordered The Canadian, and was pleased that it wasn't too sweet, it had generous portions of fresh strawberries and real whipped cream and the hint of cinnamon and real maple syrup were the perfect match. I had a 'pick your own combination' of bananas, fresh blueberries, generous helpings of real whipped cream and real maple syrup and it was delicious. My son had a sweet choice of the Oreo Waffle, complete with crumbled Oreo cookies, chocolate syrup and whipped cream. The waffles were made fresh to order and were light and not too sweet and the servings of toppings were fresh and generous. The service was also friendly, and efficient. We stopped for a quick bite at this little restaurant¬†and couldn't stop raving about how fresh and tasty it was. Next time, I will go for one of the savoury options. Overall, a great option for breakfast, lunch or tea time in downtown Victoria.
First time visit. Tried the vegetarian options as it was closer to lunch time.
The "Mexican waffle" was great and will highly recommend it. Try it with scrambled eggs.
The vegetarian was decent, but not much too rave about.
Fantastic waffles for a late night treat. The place could be cleaned and fixed up a bit, but let's be honest you're not there for the atmosphere.
Definitely one of the best waffle places in vic by far! The worker who was there was super nice, and definitely made the appearance of my waffle look super pretty and appetizing! It was super yummy and I‚Äôm so glad that this place is open till 4 am on Fridays and Saturday‚Äôs, because it definitely is a great midnight snack.

I‚Äôm just wondering why there‚Äôs only one worker though for the whole restaurant even though it‚Äôs late at night?
I just can't seem to find something decent here. The staff are always nice, and boy can they cook a waffle, but the combos are always justa little off. got the ham and cheese, but it had cinnamon on it (not mentioned on the menu) that totally ruined it. Sure I could get just a waffle and maple syrup, but then whats the point? this place is for a waffle MEAL not a regular ol waffle... All the combos are like this, so maybe just keep your mind open for some odd ingredient choices

name: Marina Dockside Eatery
reviews:
Super friendly service. We got a fabulous peanut butter cookie a bagel, sandwich and some house chips.

My 4 yr old said the cookie was amazing. My husband thoroughly enjoyed his bagel. My salmon sandwich with the arugula was extremely satisfying. And the house chips are a must. I even put them into my sandwich and had no regrets.

And you can‚Äôt beat eating outside by the water.
This caf√© has changed hands over the years, but in its latest iteration it is known as the Marina Dockside Eatery.

I am here on a Thursday morning, just after opening.  There are about ten patrons here, enjoying coffees, pastries, and food.  There is also takeout available.

I‚Äôve spotted a Kindle, a magazine, and the Times Colonist newspaper being read.  Quiet music is being played and only the sounds of conversation, and refreshments being made behind the counter,  are heard.

Outside the entire expanse of windows that wrap around the caf√© are sailboats, other patrons on the terrace, and those who work nearby.

Altogether a lovely spot for this morning‚Äôs cappuccino, which is good, but not quite strong enough for my taste.

Update:  All of my cappuccinos have been superb since.  Well done, baristas!

The caf√© offers breakfast, teas, coffees, wraps, sandwiches, chowder, soups, and other similar fare.

While it has a good ambience, the d√©cor could use a bit of an update.  It is mainly beige walls, fairly modern chairs and tables, though, there is a definite overdraft of beige and brown.  Some pop of colour would be welcomed; even some nautical d√©cor - not the tacky type - but some better pieces.

If you‚Äôre driving, just park at Turkey Head and walk down to the caf√©, or else use the ramp if need be.  Buses also stop at Turkey Head.

The Marina restaurant, just up the ramp,  just recently closed its doors, but the last time I was there for a meal it was far too quiet and the food wasn‚Äôt altogether anything to write home about, so to speak.  It was an icon, certainly, but time moves on.

I will definitely return to this caf√©.  A relaxing place, overall and friendly, chatty, staff.
Breakfast bun was great! Banana bread okay. Service was hands off for amount of people working. This place IS open even tho they don't answer the phone and one of the dockside restaurants says they are closed (its upstairs)
Friendly staff, good London fog, excellent salmon seafood chowder. I would definitely have that chowder again. Perfect comfort food on a chilly afternoon.
We had a lovely breakfast here, very relaxed atmosphere, staff were friendly and beautiful views of the Marina.

name: Red Cedar Cafe
reviews:
What a lovely place with such welcoming staff.  Their mandate is fantastic, and it doesn't hurt that the food is quite delicious.  When you eat at the cafe, part of the proceeds go towards their efforts to feed our community.  I had heard such wonderful things about this place, and it did not disappoint.  Get a caesar, go for the breakfast hash.  My partner got the pancakes and loved them.  I'm pretty sure you can't go wrong.
Thank you so much for your "can't pay" payment option on frozen items! If I could use my Visa Debit Acct, I'd love to donate $ sometime.
Went and did some bread bagging at the Ref Cedar Cafe in order to support our community. The people who work and volunteer here are even better than the delicious food! I highly refined this local joint!
I chose to volunteer here with my stepson to have him see and experience the incredibly wonderful help that comes out of Red Cedar Cafe. He was welcomed by the entire staff and was happy to be put to work to help prepare the nutritious meals prepared there.

If you‚Äôre new to Victoria too it‚Äôs a great place to volunteer doing delivery as it teaches you the layout of the city.
I was injured at work recently and my employer (who also provided housing accommodations) laid me off and essentially evicted me. The Red Cedar Cafe has been my saving grace, allowing me to have access to affordable (and/or free) healthy and filling meals.

I recommend supporting them if you can (with money, or food donations) because they‚Äôve got an unreal meal program that undoubtedly helps a lot of individuals and families in need. I hope to volunteer for them in the future so I can give back!

name: Old Coachman Eatery
reviews:
The prices are good, the food was okay, but the waitstaff was terrible. I had two different girls here who seriously lacked etiquette- but Charlotte took the cake. I have never met a server so rude and callous before. Whether I asked for water, to order, or for the bill I was always met by a grouchy "I'll be with you in a moment."
Food is fantastic and the staff were super friendly
Terrific service and gluten free options available.
Breakfast was wonderful and the service was too!!
Terrible.

name: The Big Spoon
reviews:
It‚Äôs a pleasure to find myself near the Victoria Public Market because I have an excuse to pop into Shatterbox Coffee Company. I‚Äôve always love my coffee order & I‚Äôm never disappointed by whatever I purchase to nibble on. The shop is charming and the staff friendly.
A very welcome addition to the food options in and around the Hudson from the lovely folks from Shatterbox Coffee. Everything I‚Äôve tried here has been fabulous from their soups and sandwiches to other local baked goods and savory snacks. As a bonus there‚Äôs also a small grocery section offering veggies, milk and other essentials. Super handy if you need something in a pinch and don‚Äôt have time to go to the supermarket.

name: Courtyard Cafe
reviews:
Such a cute cozy little place with fresh in house pastries and sandwiches.  Many choices of the and coffee. The nicest and friendliest young lady helped us. Was very impressed with the whole experience.
I needed a coffee place to kill some time as I waited for someone. Walked here with my baby stroller and we were nearly the only customers. The service was great, and the matcha latte was one of the best I've ever had.
As the outdoor staircase in front leads to the entrance, if you're a wheelchair user or have a stroller or otherwise can't use the stairs, you have to go through the lobby, go to the elevator, go to P1 (I had to ask a staff member which level it was as there wasn't a sign), take the left corner door, go through the heavy wood door which isn't automatic and would be difficult to open with a wheelchair, and you'll find the Cafe.

Because most customers grab and go back to their hotel rooms, this is a lovely quiet Cafe if you're looking for some peace and quiet steps away from the hustle and bustle of downtown. It was pricey - $16 for a latte and chia/fruit cup, but I feel like it is probably comparable to other coffee shops right now.
Great staff‚Ä¶but Arcadia Salad $12!!! A small amount of lettuce, 3 small pecans, one cherry tomatoe and 2 slices of carrot with small vinaigrette. I wont be back‚Ä¶
The staff system needs to change, the elder lady emily is very rude. just because she has been there a while does not give her a right to mistreat people and be disrespectful. Train your staff on basic etiquette before hiring them. wouldn't recommend.
Felt warm and thankful taking a hot London Fog and fresh snack here in this remarkable winter afternoon, Dec. 21, 2022. when outside it was -7, and most restaurants were closed due to such a rare cold weather conditions.

name: Uptown Bistro
reviews:
First time going to the Uptown Bistro. Loved it and would return. Ordered their calimari which had a great spice to it (was so good) and no unpleasant fishy taste! Highly recommend you try this. I also got the chicken strips and fries. The strips were good, the fries were great. Waitress was friendly and attentive. Great meal!
Updated: I can no longer recommend breakfast. I don't know what happened. It used to be a great place for a classic breakfast. Now it's like some experimental kitchen serving unrecognizable dishes. I tried the French toast, a simple dish of bread, eggs, and milk, fried and served with butter and maple syrup. What arrived was thin slices of bread absolutely drowning in what I can only describe as thick orange goo of some sort, with a pile of bananas on top (a generous portion at least). It didn't resemble French toast in any way. A good example of "improving" on a simple idea until it becomes a disaster. I really should have photographed it because it was unbelievable. The flavours in this dish are supposed to be simple and delicious. Whatever this was ruined it.

By all means, come for lunch and dinner. The burgers are excellent, the steak pie is amazing, and the server is lovely. One of my favourites. You also can't believe the value. It's still one of the least expensive diners in town. But skip the breakfast as the chef seems bored with it and is trying to overcomplicate it.

Earlier review below:

Returned for dinner and enjoyed a wonderful steak and mushroom pot pie with a lovely flakey pastry crust. The service from Gurneet was friendly and welcoming.
The food was not good. Everything was incredibly bland. I had the salmon sandwich, and it was overcooked, dry, and underseasoned.  My wife had fish and chips that were incredibly underwhelming.  Fries had no seasoning at all. Food was just bad. Low quality ingredients and poorly executed.
My partner asked for a long island iced tea, and our server basically just said no because she didn't know how to make it. Ummm... that's what Google is for.  Look it up! Make it happen. Her response just blew my mind as I could see all the ingredients on the bar shelf. Our server did go off shift before our meals arrived, and the girl that took over was about the only highlight of our entire experience.  The second server was quite pleasant, but it didn't make up for the awful food.
Needless to say we will not be back and I would recommend you just keep driving. Skip this place.
Kid you not Victoria, if you haven't tried their BBQ Bacon Cheeseburger you're missing out! Make sure to go down and get it as it's way better hot and fresh, and cap it off with a $5.50 Blue Buck :)

Whatever they've changed over the past year is working! Way better than most places in town, and the pakoras are absolutely bang on too!
Great service, great portions, and most importantly, great flavours. What more does one need? 10/10 highly recommend

name: Yates Coffee Bar
reviews:
Don‚Äôt be mistaken -this discreet cafe packs a punch! Hands down high quality dishes regardless of what you pick on their diverse menu. Sometimes they are understaffed but the wait is worth it! Bonus their menu is Greta-approved, vegan without compromise. The have a late-day ghost menu with burgers and other dinner options. Amazing baked goods and coffees.
My new favourite place in town to get vegan comfort food! Their chick‚Äôn club sandwich was the best vegan sandwich I‚Äôve had, you could taste how much effort was put into it! All their other menu items I ordered as well were delicious!
I‚Äôve had the double-decker breakfast sandwich (in an English muffin), an oatmeal-raisin cookie and the B.E.L.T. Deluxe, which was really good. Good food! Sometimes available are day-old muffins for half-price. Great place for food and hot drinks. Central location.
OMG I LOVE THIS PLACE!

I don't know where to start. The girl behind the counter was very helpful. Made some great recommendations! We ordered the Spring Fog and Lavender Latte, both were yum üòã, and the Flower Power and Mocha muffin (also delicious!) and lastly the Garlic Cheez Bun and wow! That Garlic cheese bun was so good! So happy I got it
A nice little cafe like this should definitely be commended!

The food feels healthy (as it is!), the atmosphere is relaxing, and the coffee is actually great!

I was pleasantly surprised to find micro-greens here at a VERY reasonable price!

Thank you for helping us to stay healthy when we‚Äôre out and about!

Love this place!!!

name: Macchiato Caffe at The Juliet
reviews:
Very good food . Seriously some of the best sandwiches in Victoria . Very friendly staff. The staff also just seem extremely happy , either they are are world class actors/ actresses , or they are just legitimately really nice and just happy . It seems to natural to be fake. They seem like a really cohesive group that seem happy to work together. Highly recommend this place !
Been here a couple of times during my stay in Victoria. Great vibe and AAA service.
Staff remembers your name and order! What an amazing memory and care! Service is fast and quality is good! Seatings are super comfortable too. Hope they resume regular business hours soon post pandemic. Well done guys!
Exceptional customer service! Went in not knowing what I wanted except that I needed caffeine and tbh I‚Äôm a pretty indecisive person but after a few recommendations I decided to go with the Spanish Coffee and I was not disappointed, probably the best coffee I‚Äôve ever had! Will definitely be going again‚òïÔ∏è
Just had the kindest service here! They recommended a Spanish latte and it‚Äôs ridiculously good! Food was super flavourful. Also appreciated that an employee was wearing a Moose Hide Campaign pin which was great to see :)

name: Tim Hortons
reviews:
Staff aren't very good. They don't understand how to do their job. Ordering your food should be easy, right? No. I had to explain to the staff how to do the simple task of listening for what I want and getting what I want. Shouldn't be that hard, but none of the staff seemed to understand what you do when you work at a Tim Hortons.
Got order wrong multiple times even though it was simple. Very slow and seemingly nonchalant. Not one to write reviews but felt like I had to after that.
For 6 people working behind counter they are very slow,I waited 10-12 min for my order and it wasn't even what i ordered? But took it anyways because i was in a hurry,then there were junkies sleeping at the tables and smoking their crack pipe right outside the door bugging me for change,I'll never go back to that location
Not a great experience at this location. We ordered our drinks and breakfast sandwiches - no complaints there. Then we were sitting and waiting for our order, multiple people also had ordered and were waiting. There was a couple people behind the cash, and then one guy doing something with Timbits. There was no one at the station making food - mind you this was around 9:30am on a Tuesday morning. Finally I asked the girl at the cash, she looked around (don‚Äôt know how she wouldn‚Äôt have realized no one was there) and went to the back to grab someone.

A guy came out (with gloves already on) and proceeded to start quickly making the orders. Who knows what he was doing in the back‚Ä¶ his gloves should‚Äôve been changed as soon as he came out. Didn‚Äôt even get a chance to say anything since he was quickly moving to try and help the backlog of orders. I was definitely turned off‚Ä¶would not return to this location.
Very busy all the time. Washrooms were very dirty not impressed with that. But coffee was hot and had pretty much all of their regular treats and eats. There was a line up to get inside but it went by pretty quick. I was able to find a seat to eat my meal and have my coffee.

name: Selkirk Cafe
reviews:
My favourite place. The nicest and friendliest service. Clean and comfy seating areas. Bright beautiful space. Lots of snack and food options. Nice music. Great for taking a second to yourself or chatting with a friend. Beautiful and cute decor.
Phenomenal cafe. Most delicious Korean lunch options available in the week. Excellent coffee/tea selection and Andrew the owner and the staff are the kindest. This is the cafe to visit while you are in the gorge area!
Great and kind servings, and cozy and comfy atmosphere. The lady owner welcomed me and my wife for our first visit and gave a nice explanation of the menu. And the barista served awesome coffee, soup and Bibimbab which is one of Korean traditional meals.
Taste and service are all perfect!
Nice place and cozy atmosphere. I had Caffe Mocha and spicy chicken wrap. It was really good. I love latte art!
This place is close to my work and has great food and coffee. Their daily specials are amazing, and regular menu items are solid as well. I know they also do catering as well.

name: New Owly Cafe
reviews:
Cute little place with absolutely delicious Bao. So glad I found this place after moving to Victoria from Vancouver! The drink menu is extensive which is great for someone like me who can't have caffeine or dairy. Still lots of options for me! On this visit had their strawberry acai cooler which was great.

While the branding and furnishings are nice, it does feel more like a hole in the wall to get ones food to go rather than sit and eat. Though they do have a few tables it's a bit cramped and cluttered feeling. Maybe a slight redesign of the layout would help? Still, great spot for a breather while shopping, or to stop by and take something to the waterside. And the food more than makes up for the lack of ambience.
The honey glazed pork bao was simply amazing. I‚Äôm the best bao I‚Äôve ever had and definitely loves up to its reputation. Great value for the small price. Packed with pork, cucumber and cilantro. Lattes are delicious as well, will definitely be back!
I had such a wonderful experience at this cafe. Their veggie bao and pork bao tasted absolutely amazing! Also, their pumpkin pie chai latte is phenomenal! The woman working behind the counter was so sweet as well. Definitely a great start to my morning!
The honey-glazed pork bun is a must get! Great iced lattes, they use the best oat milk here(earth‚Äôs own)! Clean and cute owl decor throughout ü•∞
Very nice people, and lots of yummy looking drinks. Lavender London fog was average: couldn‚Äôt taste the lavender or Earl grey, it tasted like steamed milk. Baos look good

name: Shanzee's Old Town
reviews:
Yesterday morning I stopped by here to pick up a couple orders for door dash but upon walking in the door my nose was filled by all the delicious smells. I couldn‚Äôt help myself but to stare at all the baked good they had and settled on the carrot cake. It was absolutely perfect! Taste, consistency, ingredients and the icing! I will certainly be back to try more from their menu soon!
Food and staff was amazing. The place has a  relaxed cozy feeling to it, it's perfect for brunch. Our doggo got its own home-made treat which made us feel even more at home. Definitely becoming a regular here!
I love the location of this little breakfast joint. They are located in old China Town and there is a lot of history in this building. There are photographs and write-ups behind plexiglass in the covered walk paths from one side of the courtyard to the next explaining the history of this area.
The architecture is fascinating as well.
This eatery is walk to the counter, order and pay first...then sit and they bring your food to you. We ordered the gluten free biscuits and gravy and requested extra care, as this food choice is allergy induced, not a lifestyle for us.
They were great about asking clarifying questions and I felt confident they understood our needs.
We both had waters and I appreciated that they left a bottle with us to refill ourselves, as I drink a lot of water. My husband had chai and I had a london fog. My London Fog was delicious and probably in the top two or three I've ever had.

The biscuits and gravy were on the small side, but filling. If you have a big appetite, I suggest a double order or get a side or oatmeal or something to go with it. The gravy was a vegan, mushroom gravy and was a touch too salty for me, but otherwise good. The biscuits are typical gluten free...sandy more than soft like a biscuit could be. I can make them at home that way, but home was a long ways away while we were here, so I'm happy to have the choice. Unfortunately, for someone allergic to gluten and eggs, there is little else to be had on the island that I found.

The cafe interior is cute, with multiple small seating areas. The washroom is tiny, but efficient and ungendered.
Love this place!! Definitely one of my favourite places to have brunch. Food is always delicious! They specialize in making the best biscuits. Worth trying!!

It looks like a family run business as I see the same people working there. And they are the nicest people!

Overall, whenever I come to Shanzee‚Äôs I have this feeling of being at home.
Very comfortable and homey with friendly servers. My wife thinks of herself as an expert on biscuits and gravy and said these were the best she‚Äôs ever had. My omelette and hash browns were excellent and well prepared.

name: Shatterbox Coffee Company
reviews:
Probably the only place I have been able to find with GREAT ESPRESSO and a truly LARGE size that doesn‚Äôt cost over $7-8. Better than Starbucks or Macchiato. Love this place for lunch and coffee runs.
Pretty good coffee! I got the ‚ÄúGraham Cracker‚Äù specialty coffee and it tasted like the pumpkin spice latte from starbucks. Overall, pretty good. The cinnamon is not too overpowering.
Their espressos are really great, but they only had expired coconut milk, which made me question why they even offered it instead of throwing it out and buying fresh? We opted for oat milk both times we went, and it was probably the best dairy-free coffee we had in all of Victoria. It was a shame one cashier in particular was so churlish, but it made for a humorous story back home.
We had come in the store when it was really busy. I was expecting the employees to be a little on edge. But they stayed calm and got everyone drinks ready in fairly short amounts of time considering there were a lot of people there at the time. I would 100% come back again. BTW their London fogs are amazing.
The best half sweet almond mocha!
Friendly staff and a beautiful barista who‚Äôs latte designs are perfect!

name: Bubby Rose's Bakery & Cafe
reviews:
Had a great latte and Salmon Breakfast Sandwich here (the sandwiches are pre-made, but they heated it up for me). The breakfast sandwich is made of buttery, savoury biscuits which are delicious. Took some cinnamon buns to-go: very tasty (almost as good as my mom's... but that's a high bar). Reasonable prices. Solid place - check it out if you're in the area.

*Note: Bubby's bun is the left one in the pic; I did a "cinnabun-off" against the Sally Bun, and I have a slight preference for Bubby's (although both were good).
I‚Äôve been here a dozen times with friends and it‚Äôs always enjoyable. They have amazing mochas and it‚Äôs what I usually get. Their croissants and breakfast sandwiches are definitely worth the try if you‚Äôre looking for something savory. All of their desserts are delicious. They are also open pretty late which can be nice after work/school.
Great little place with indoor and outdoor seating. Good selection of vegan food for a light meal. Terrific coffee as well.  Say hi to Esteban as you walk in. I enjoyed the vegan chili w a gluten free bun.
Absolutely yummy baked goods! Vegan options available too. Our favorite was the caramel apple crumble and chocolate shillings. The chocolate quinoa sandwich was great too.
Decent gluten free sweets. Their gluten free cheesecake is yum, though could be a bit less sweet so I won‚Äôt be back too often for it. The gluten free pizza is great to have as a reasonably priced ready to go meal even if they only have one kind and it‚Äôs veggie. Cute atmosphere and friendly staff. I wish they had more savoury gluten free things.

name: Wannawafel
reviews:
Amazing Belgian waffles out here. They are authentic and served fresh. We got the basic waffle and ice cream scoop and enjoyed every single bite! 10/10 would come back!
Thank you for your feedback. If we visit Victoria again, we will stop by and give it another shot. It must be good because there's always a line. It just wasn't my lucky day.

We were so excited to try this place and in the morning we headed out. The place was late to open and we got there while the tables were being put out. We ordered and the waffle dough wasn‚Äôt ready so we had to go with something else. It was not the best. I make better ones at home. Sadly we were not impressed and I was so excited about going there.
The best Belgian waffle I ever tried in Canada. Tastes very authentic. They are served exactly like in Belgium, fresh, warm, rich and sweet. Amazing!
The best waffle shop in Victoria, almost every one knows about them. The shop is in a very nice location at market square where you can check out other stuff around too. One star off because the staff wasn‚Äôt so friendly when we visited recently but overall, they got delicious treat, even the plain one with no chocolate sauce or whipping cream, quick and nice service most of the time. I will always go back here for waffles
Awesome waffles! Best waffles in have had so far! This was the highlight of our trip to Victoria. Cozy little place in the market square. Looking forward to visiting again!

name: de'lish Fine Foods & Catering
reviews:
This place is a must stop for everyone.
The best food and drinks.
Atmosphere very cozy.
Staff actually call you by your name they make you feel like family here.
And very much on top of cleaning  off tables as soon as customers leave this beautiful little  GEM OF A CAFE.
If you have not been here ,you must I insist
A Quaint and lovely space. Has indoor and outdoor seating. Beautiful looking food! Very appealing and delicious food. Usually I found little bistros/cafes like this don‚Äôt have enough variety or enough meal-type food more-so just snacks, and I‚Äôm left leaving hungry. But they had a great variety of delicious food like polentas, salads, sausage rolls, and incredibly yummy desserts. I will definitely go back.
In July, Mark catered a wedding reception for 140 people in our garden. Where to start with this? well, the planning of this event was complicated - at least from our point of view. For Mark, nothing was a problem - he looked after everything from food to  beverages, ordering of tents and tables and chairs - every detail was thought out and executed perfectly.
The food: fabulous, as the food from De'lish always is, and it just kept coming. The staff was professional, courteous and experienced...and somehow, unobtrusive. In the weeks following we have had many unsolicited comments from friends about the food and service - rave reviews, in fact. Thanks Mark - you were a very important part of this celebration.
The food was great. Now, the customer has to negotiate a very small ordering area to be able to get cream, sugar etc. Not very easy when the place is busy.
