Another cream and sugar station outside, where most people are sitting, would be a good addition. Paper plates instead of paper boxes would be better especially when you stated to be eating on site. Ceramic dishes‚Äìeven better. Wood sticks to stir hot drinks is just not worthy of a fine place like that. Also proper metal cutlery would be welcome.
They would save the earth a bit more efficiently if they would wash the utensils instead of using disposable stuff.
Maybe, it's due to covid measures and if that is the case I hope they go back to proper cutlery. It's a very nice and attractive place with great food apart the inconveniences.
Stumbled on this little gem today. Amazing food and Pastries. The soup was delicious. The staff we're very welcoming and friendly. They also have a great selection of prepared meals to take home. Will definitely be back.

name: Bubby Rose's Downtown
reviews:
Met a colleague for a business meeting here for my first visit last week.The staff are very kind and friendly. The atmosphere is totally not pretentious. Tables are quite small. Makes for a socializing but not the best for sitting down to discuss business, and probably not enough space if you like to work for hours at a coffee shop, plus there is no plug to charge your device. The girl who was working at the time was very nice and help full, she even offered me to charge my laptop behind the bar (in their working area). The other comment I have is the ordering area. t is a little awkward if you have not been before. But hey, it's about the coffee, food, quality of service and ambience and they all definitely score high with me. I would visit again.
Food is tasty, though almost exclusively baked goods and sandwiches. Servers aren‚Äôt terribly helpful in this location and it‚Äôs not kept very clean.
I have to change my rating of Bubby Rose‚Äôs üòü I primarily would go to Bubby's for the espresso, and did really enjoy it. Good crema, shot volume, heat, etc...Alas, recently they decided to change the bean & roast - and it is no good. Why are decisions to change the espresso bean & roast made by people who don't understand(or value), produce, and drink great espresso..?! (I would also mention that Bubby's snack's and location are still great!)
So I continue my search for the best espresso in the land...simple process yet very difficult to produce, both on a 1-off basis as well as over time.
üòî
First off I am sure the owner will jump in and reply to this negative review (see my post below for why) so I‚Äôm just going to be honest and upfront‚Ä¶
This was our first and last visit to Bubbys, we live right across from them in a condo and we are so disappointed in our visit.
They asked if we wanted our sandwiches toasted and our pizza reheated up..
Absolutely we did so we said yes, what happened next shocked us both‚Ä¶
they microwaved our sandwiches and pizza- yes microwaved the sannies with lettuce, tomatoes, onions etc inside.
ü§¢
And the pizza, well holy moly‚Ä¶
What happens when you use a microwave to heat up meat and veggies in a bun with sauce etc‚Ä¶
The pizza, well hello gooey and goopy dough, just inedible.
Absolute mush and disgusting, the staff didn‚Äôt seem to care and said the owner will most likely say something if we posted our review online.
We mentioned how this wasn‚Äôt what we were expecting and they didn‚Äôt know how to reply they just said this is what the owners wanted down.
We threw away our food after one bite each and decided to not go back to any of the locations
The services wasn‚Äôt great but the food was shameful and an embarrassment.
Save your money and go elsewhere, trust me on this one.

Also, there is a post about this company on Reddit, wow, I encourage everyone to look it up on that site, there are over a 100 people complaining about this business ever since it changed hands in 2018.
What a shame.
I always thought the food was good enough, not outstanding but overall tasty!

The management however is unprofessional and sketchy (not paying staff on time or the right amount for example).

Anyone complaining about the service don‚Äôt blame the students working there.

name: Papa Moe's
reviews:
Just went to Papa Moe's. Great selection of vegetarian options üòÅüëç
House cut fries
Mexi fries
Hash browns
Onion rings
The daily soup was also vegetarian when I asked.
Same with the vegetarian chili
Asian coleslaw
Hummus and naan
Caesar salad or house salad
Great tofu hotdogs too
And 2 pasta options available vegetarian.
Also great selection in meat sandwiches for who is interested.
The chef also informed me that infact the fruit salad is also vegetarian friendly. But sadly it is coming off the menu. ‚òπÔ∏è
Love this spot. The gelded steak and the Moe's burger are so good. Everything tastes fresh, lots of flavour. The berry aioli on the burger is interesting and delicious. Multiple glizzys on the menu too, the Shetl is legit.

Not to mention the staff. Very friendly and accommodating. Simple little eating area with funky old timey music. I wish I lived closer

Don't sleep on Papa Moe's!
This place is AMAZING. We got delivery, and the driver got a little turned around so it took a little longer to arrive, but it was still so delicious. The quality and care really comes through. The bread was perfect at holding my loaded Ruben together. 15/10 will go back!
So Good!! Can't wait to go back!  We ordered the Moe's Burger with curly fries, was very delicious and good quality, especially for only $13!  Service was super friendly and professional, place was clean and tidy, great vibes in there. See you guys soon!
I just ordered papa moes cheesesteak sandwich on uber eats. It came hot and packed with flavour! It was so delicious! The serving was more than enough, I even shared a few bites with my girlfriend. Really happy with their food and i‚Äôll be a regular for sure!

name: Bimo Burger Stand
reviews:
Amazing!! My boyfriend recommended this place to me and I had it on my list for a long time to check out while visiting Victoria. He came back in 2012 and he has remembered it since as one of the best burgers he‚Äôs ever had. Definitely lived up to his hype!! Between me and my best friend, we ordered a cheeseburger, mushroom cheeseburger, regular fries and the Montreal smoked meat poutine, which was HUGE! They don‚Äôt cheap out here. The prices are very reasonable and have better quality and taste than the typical $16 burger you grab at a restaurant. I love how this place is literally just a random stand in a parking lot in a slightly commercial/industrial area. The ladies/owners are SO sweet and friendly ‚ù§Ô∏è I will be returning every single time I come to visit here!
Work lunch group wanted to try something new and found this place.  A small hole in the wall good truck.   Really good prices for what you get and I was very impressed with the food.  I also enjoyed getting a cup of gravy.   Made me laugh.   Definitely would eat again.
Place may not look like much, but the burger and fries I had were fantastic. A big menu which I hope to explore over the summer.
Food was okay.  Fries are definitely homemade and peeled before they are cooked. I saw boxes and boxes of potatoes.  That's what made me stop in the first place.  The hamburger, although advertised as homemade, doesn't look like a fresh patty of cooked hamburger.  Both items tasted fine.  Not sure I'd go back unless it was for my mom to taste the fries.  She's always looking for good freshly peeled homemade fries.  The stand had continuous customers.  Some regulars as the owner greeted the people by name.
I have recently visited this gem!
Fast food at incredibly low cost.
So yummy as well.

name: Mom's Kitchen
reviews:
I recently ordered takeout from Mom's Kitchen and had the pleasure of trying their chicken dumplings and chicken teriyaki. The takeout process was seamless and "Mom" was very friendly and nice

As for the food, the chicken dumplings were absolutely delicious. The filling was flavorful and the wrapper was cooked to perfection - not too soft or too chewy with a little bit of crunch. The chicken teriyaki was also cooked to perfection, with a sweet and savory sauce that complemented the tender chicken perfectly, nice to have it on a rainy day

Overall, I had a wonderful experience here. The food was excellent and had the home cooked feel to it. I'd definitely recommend giving this a go, if you're in the area
Amazing and Authentic food. Mom does it all on her own.

My friends and I make this spot a regular go to when we are in town. Great flavours and just the right amount of food.

Teriyaki chicken and teriyaki beef
This was a nice finding inside the shopping alley. A mix of Korean and Japanese cuisine. Not those elaborate menu options but selective items and all for 12$ each was a good option to go for. Served in cardboard boxes with plastic spoins and recyled wooden forks. We ordered fried Dumplings (actually Korean Mandus), Bulgogi, and Chow-mein‚Ä¶ my little daughters loved dumplings and chicken and beef pieces in them. For parents, it was a little bland. More flavors needed. Probably they have adapted dishes to Canadian palate? But I know Canadians love spicy food too. Isn‚Äôt it? I forgot to take pictures of the food we bought, so I don‚Äôt have them in my review. Anyway, it was an okay-okay hot food option on that sunny yet windy-chilly afternoon. So we won‚Äôt whine about anything. All good. Ladies taking orders and cooking were nice and gentle people.
We ordered weekend special. The food is amazing. Quality of food is great. Felt like eating at home. Highly recommend
A cold chill blows through Victoria, it's 11am on a Saturday, and I walk up to Mom's Kitchen. I order the shrimp udon and wait, watching the bustle of market square. I ate my soup under cover, watching the raindrops drip from the dips in the canopy. Steam billowing from my bowl. This was very wonderful udon. Would reccomend to anyone who wants to get food, but also brought their dog and can't go inside. This warmed my soul üíñ

name: Bin 4 Burger Lounge
reviews:
There is no doubt, this was the best decision of my life.  The meal wasn‚Äôt just take-out, it was an experience that just kept happening.  When i felt that urge to tap out, there was more experience to be had.  I eat a lot of burgers, mostly my own concoctions.  THIS was better than my cooking and i gladly admit to that.  Grade-A, top-shelf food.  Fantastic work Bin 4!

Don‚Äôt forget to tip your server or the person taking the payment - most places are tip sharing so it goes to everyone.  TIP at LEAST 20%.
Best gourmet burgers in Victoria! A group of us (around 20 people) went, and had a fantastic time with great burgers. Bin 4 serves quality and quantity. The burger set meals (burger + sides) are worth the money. The meat is well seasoned and well cooked. The meat was moist (not dry at all), and had the juicy succulent flavor.
Recommended:
Bin 19: The big dipper (meal filling enough for a full meal).
As sides, I had fries and Bin 4 house salad. I would prefer fries and onion rings. The house salad is a regular salad, and wasn't the right fit for me.
Overall, a place that serves great gourmet burgers and has a great vibe! Last but not the least, service was awesome, kudos to the ladies for being prompt.
Great place to visit if you love burger and fries.
They has options for both vegetarian and non vegetarian burgers.
Onion rings is must try!
Staff is friendly and service is good.
Recommend to book reservation on weekend evenings.
Good to visit in happy hours as any burgers are usually 11$ if we order alcoholic drink with it.
Large seating options with big heated patio available.
Ample parking available.
One of the best tasting burgers in town. If not THE best. I was surprised with the garden salad. It had a hint of sweetness. Very enjoyable place. Nice seating outside as well. Friendly waitresses. I'd go back ! Baby friendly ! Was a great day in the sun. Lovely just lovely
Late night special of 50% menu-priced burgers (with the purchase of a drink) after 9pm was the main draw!

Plating was a big thumbs up from me, considering it‚Äôs just a burger and fries! That being said, for a restaurant with a primary focus on burgers, the food was mediocre. Definitely better burger stops all over town. A few of the ingredients were over-cooked, including rock-hard bacon and dry onion rings. While the portion size is generous, the quality doesn‚Äôt seem up to par. The beer menu was decent, but the bar classics fell short.

Would come back here just for the late night special and the hangs, but it‚Äôs not to be construed for a premium burger restaurant. Worth mentioning that they were absolutely packed, so although that meant minimal service attention, it‚Äôs definitely a popular spot!

name: Mama Nadia's Kitchen
reviews:
One of my new favourite places! My partner and I just order the Kafta bowl and the lamb shanks. It was SO delicious! So much flavour without being too spicy. Great gluten free options. I ate the rice pudding too quickly to take a picture, and the same was for my partner and the Om Ali. The couple who made our meal were the sweetest people, I felt like we were ordering from family. Will absolutely be going again %100.
We tried Lamb Shank, Kofte, Chicken bowl, and the rice pudding. Everything was great! Lamb shank was so tender. The owner was very polite and helpful.

It is a take away restaurant, we didn‚Äôt know at first and asked the owner if there is dine-in available, the owner went above and beyond to accommodate us and arranged seating for us.

Everything here tastes good! Would try kunafe next time :)
I have never before seen a place on Google Maps with 5 stars; Mama Nadia's wildly deserves this unprecedented rating. You pick up your food from the side door of a community centre, where two eager children saw me circling aimlessly in the parking lot of the Circle K and guided me to the right door. The portions are family-sized. Order food to share with others or eat for lunch at the beach tomorrow. Maybe a few lunches - the portions are very generous for the price. We had lamb shanks, macaroni bechamel, & a very tasty baba ghanuj.

Do whatever it takes to keep this food home business alive - it has a comfortable and lived-in flavour of entrepreneurs sharing their talents that you will want to keep in the community for years to come.
I loved the in-depth flavours of the food. Service was high quality and I‚Äôm definitely coming back for more food every week :)
We were in town visiting/vacation. Took a chance based on the reviews and all the praise is definitely deserved! It was a little hard to find but we were greeted by the some of the friendliest people I've ever met. They helped us decide on meals and threw in a small dessert. I too had the lamb shank and my wife had a pasta type dish and both were exceptional! I can't recommend this couple/Mama Nadia's enough. Give them a try, you won't be disappointed!

name: Brazuca Coffee Shop and Comfort Food
reviews:
Amazing food! Staff is lovely. If you want to try the authentic Brazilian experience, this is the place!

Coxinha is a must try and the pao com lingui√ßa was delicious!!!

10/10
Today was the Grand opening of Brazuca and I COULDN‚ÄôT BE MORE PLEASED! It made me feel right at home. The food was INCREDIBLE. Their coxhina and pastel is to die for! The staff were so friendly and funny. 10/10 Definitely coming back whenever I can :)
The vibe is nice, the food is AMAZING. They could easily be charging 3x as much for some of this stuff in Victoria. I only paid so much because I couldn't stop eating. Please go here, there's nowhere else I can get a pastel de nata.
Awesome food. Had the chicken croquettes and sausage sandwich. Great taste and prices!
Friendly staff, interior nice, nice little decoration and Brazilian music, I took a little bit of time, all the Brazilian specialties to taste as well as a fresh fruit juice which was passion fruit. Really excellent. The small bites were very good too. Too bad it won't be open in the evening, I live nearby but I work from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day, I will never be able to go there on weekdays since the opening hours are quite limited... tables and chairs to make a small terrace would be a plus, too bad there is no caipirinha either üòÖ (you can't find any in town, it seems to me).
I recommend and I will come back when I can... üòéüëçüáßüá∑

name: MeeT on Blanshard
reviews:
I love Meet on Main, so naturally, i should love Meet on Blanchard, which i do. But my first visit was less than stellar. It was during the opening phase, so well, i let that one slide. You know all new staff for a new restaurant, you've gotta wait a bit for them to work out the kinks. I've been back for dinner and brunch a bunch more times, and I've had amazing experiences. The atmosphere is really nice and relaxed. Food is really great as well, lots on the menu, obviously all vegan, diverse comfort food menu. Service has always been great as well. Love the pink painted duct work.
I'm not vegan but always happy to eat vegan. I've eaten at a handful of vegan places and this one has been my favorite so far. I had the ginger beef bowl and cashew mac and cheese and they were both great. Good portion sizes too.

Our server was also very good and we loved the atmosphere. Not too dark and not too light

I will be going back here for sure
Food was pretty good. Only reason not giving a 5 star was because our 'burgers' were a little burnt to a crisp on one side. Not sure if it was meant to be cooked that way or not. Also their cocktails were bit pricey for the size of the drink, but we're tasty none the less! Will definitely come back to try other things on their menu! Everything sounds delicious and we've gotta have a taste. We like the ambiance in there. Cool lighting fixtures. Awesome old school tv in the front playing VHS tapes. They were showing Willowwhen we arrived! Lots of pop culture art work on display also!
I've been three times so far. Large menu! Pesto chikkin sammie - the chikkin curls and fresh focaccia are great. Cronut stuffed with coconut Bavarian creme - decadent! Classic Benny - very good meal with two English-muffin halves, hash-brown potatoes and green salad. Comfort Bowl daily special was good and included a Beyond patty and a vegan ‚Äúfried egg.‚Äù Good spritzers and lemonades. Sometimes I find the music too loud.
Meet is a very interesting place. First off they do not serve any meat products, The food is loaded in flavor and vibrant in color, and alive. My employer said it is the best vegan Burger he has ever had, every place he's been. My meal was spectacular. No words could explain. I ordered the big yum. That's exactly what it was, very delicious. Yum yum yum. I'm definitely gonna go back and I want to bring a date this time There are a lot of people in the city who are missing out Well worth the wait Just stay in line do not leave. You won't regret it.

name: Flying Otter Grill
reviews:
Not sure why I don't come to this restaurant more often; I enjoyed the ambiance, location, food, and menu items.  It's a reasonable place to take someone for a date- however not too intimate, pretty casual for a setting.

Date dinner with the Hubby almost a month ago (haven't reviewed), didn't know it was two for one appetizer Saturdays. OF COURSE we ordered the two-for-one! Why not? It's there, if it wasn't something we enjoyed, we didn't have to order it or come back, so there was nothing to lose.

Had no regrets on the selection; ordered the wings with Apple BBQ flavour, and the calamari. Be warned, the calamari does have some spicy kick to it- and I like spicy. Still delicious. Wings were crispy, even with the sauce- just a personal preference.

For the entrees my husband ordered the Halibut burger - but somehow ended up with the two-piece halibut fish and chips- he went with it, and didn't have any regrets. The batter wasn't overly thick, and the fish was thankfully not dry. My own order was spicy prawn tacos, and they were lovely. nice, light, refreshing. It comes with a side, but thankfully I chose this, because the appetizers were filling enough. The fries were nothing remarkable, but I did enjoy them.

We arrived around 5:30pm, to which dinner was just getting started- the tables were about 90% full, and our food still arrived at a "reasonable time" (we were in and out in an hour, without rushing our order and dinner).  The atmosphere was overall good; didn't feel rushed, didn't feel like we were inconveniencing anyone when we asked for refills of our drinks. I will, of course, come back again. Even for a somewhat price-conscious person, I'm very satisfied with my visit.

Highlights for me:
Accessible washroom
Two-for-one Appetizer Saturdays (excluding a few items)
Easy parking
Good service and food

Take note:
No dog patio
We sat in the patio and had a pilsener and an apple cider while we waited for our Caesar salad and halibut fish and chips. The food was great. some of the best fish and chips I'd had. I'd recommend a bit more dressing on the salad but the fried capers that it came with were a nice touch. Our server was attentive but not over bearing. Would go again.
Loved the food, great place to bring our young kids. We saw a couple otters on the ramp on our way in and out. Service was OK but thinking back, maybe under staffed. Atmosphere was good, next time we will probably request to sit on the flight deck with patio.
Found this place while wandering aimlessly around Victoria. We loved the name and decided to give it a try. It was a little busy, but the hostess gave us the option to sit at the bar. I'm so glad we did. The Otter has an excellent drink selection, including local brews. We split an order of poutine (IYKYK) that was absolutely fantastic! We loved watching the activity on the docks as we ate, including one seagull that liked to look in the windows to see what people were eating.

The staff were amazing and friendly from the jump. They also worked incredibly well together, anticipating what others needed, which increased the level of customer care and service. They elevated the experience tenfold.
Nice harbour side restaurant. It was very busy, so booking is recommended. We were lucky. Does some great fish and chips, you could have halibut or cod. Both were good,the code
a little cheaper.

name: Earls Kitchen + Bar
reviews:
Not the best earls I‚Äôve been to but still good food! There‚Äôs not a lot open late in Victoria so this is a good option for a decent selection. The rare steak was very good, the truffle fries were really good. The rest was just OK.

The new truffle ravioli was disappointing and I got it with the prawns but they were pathetically small and underwhelming (not worth the extra $). The ravioli was good but felt a bit undercooked, the sauce was a bit watery and didn‚Äôt adhere to the pasta well.

The Cajun chicken was tasty and not dry, the ribs were a little dry. It came with potato salad which was kind of bland.

The atmosphere in here is nice and decent service! Good location, but if you‚Äôre driving since it‚Äôs downtown you need to take a bit of time to park.
we did not book a table, but on Saturday evening they found a free place for us. Very attentive waiters. We ordered spring rolls, spinach - very tasty, beautiful serving of the dish. The only downside to this place is that the music is very loud....
First time visit while in Victoria. The main attractive part is the fact that they are open late and serve food late in the night. Tried their Happy Hour menu and everything was great. The drinks (Mojito and Mai Tai) did not disappoint us at all.
We will be back to try their Brunch menu soon.
Everything was great as usual. I just wished they wouldn‚Äôt take away the shrimp spaghetti. It was a personal favourite and alot of other customer‚Äôs too (as I overheard).
We had reserved the private room for a bachelor party however the restaurant double booked it so we could not sit there.  The manager did give us 2 bottles of Prosecco to make up for it.  The food was good but really high price $55 for a steak is crazy for a franchise restaurant.  Service was ok.

name: Good Ovening
reviews:
Good tasting and freshly prepared chicken served in a different/unique style. Generous portions for a good price. I enjoyed the churro to finish off the meal as well. The restaurant is relatively new , nicely decorated, and very clean. Service was also good. The 18-28% tip range option on the POS machine is a joke though; please adjust to a more reasonable range or just increase your prices by $1-2.
Fast, friendly, attentive servers, delicious food. Highly recommend the volcano chicken or the honey mustard. I'm very glad to find an authentic Korean restaurant and I hope that you keep the food the way it is, don't listen to ignorant people who don't understand that different cultures have different foods. Delicious!
Been here several times already! The tastiest and moistest chicken I ever had! I also tried the churros and the k-toast, and they were quite good desserts. I‚Äòll definitely visit again üòÑ
I tried many restaurants in Victoria, but the food here was different. They serve delicious food(especially sauce)at reasonable cost. All staff members are very kind and helpful. Also, the restaurant atmosphere was comfortable and romantic. I highly recommend this restaurant and I will certainly visit again shortly.
This place offers cozy and luxurious vibes. I got a platter of roasted chicken( mix of boneless and traditional) and salad with cocktail. I was enthralled by how flavourful their chicken and salad were.
The cocktails were aesthetically pleasing, beautifully made with variety of colours and delicate flavours.
This place must be a hidden gem in Victoria and recommend to those who have been craving for good chicken plates.

name: 10 Acres Bistro
reviews:
10 acres delivers! the food is delicious, looks great and all from their own farm.
Make sure to make a reservation so you get a great table.
We had the chicken and mussels,  I feel it was a mistake. Should have stuck with one theme. Either seafood. Or no seafood.
The chicken was very very good.
I‚Äôd have it again.
Great location. Cocktails are not worth it although they sound really good on the menu. Service was a miss. Took us about 30 minutes from being seated until we got our orders in and took a bite. Quite loud if seated indoors. Seafood charcuterie was bomb! We were starving and this was THE fix. Humboldt squid appetizer was also very good. Worth trying.
The cocktails are great!! And the fresh onions soup has cheese on it bread in it. The lamb is the best I've ever eatenÔºåvery soft and juicyÔºÅDelicious oysters and pastaÔºÅ Black forest Chocolate cake also üëç
A farm to table restaurant. We walked in on a Saturday night and were seating right away. The restaurant is very big. There was a section with a bar with a younger ground, another sections with larger groups and family and then another area that seemed to be more intimate. Everything that we ordered was delicious- gnocchi, lasagna, and pumpkin cheesecake. Highly recommend the pumpkin cheesecake (without the apple compote and lemon-those flavours didnt go well together for my palate) I would say it‚Äôs the best I‚Äôve had. Service was great. I would definitely go back!
Shared a lovely lunch with my daughter-in-love. The house made pate is a delight and we both had the duck which was crispy perfection!
Desserts are not to be missed - the cheesecake is next level and the tiramisu is outstanding!
Professional relaxed vibe. A perfect lunch - will definitely be back!

name: Uchida Eatery
reviews:
We love this place. Currently only order for pick up. Such a hidden gem! Fish is so fresh! They use fresh ingredient and locally source organic veggies. We order once a week!
This is an authentic shokudo food. You should not compare to a pricey omakase, but you can expect comfort and satisfactory meal. The grilled sockeye collar and the mackerel were wonderful. We are happy to try this place during our visit.

The only complain that I have was the rice, which could be better.
This was hands down our favorite and best find in Victoria. We ordered a tuna and salmon lunch, and picked it up the next day to eat at Philips brewery.

Since they are not doing dine in currently, you have to order the lunch the night before online at ~7PM, and then pick it up the next afternoon. We actually got a little lost looking for it, but loved the experience searching for it.

The food itself was fantastic - loved the shredded egg, thought that was pretty unique touch, and the sashimi was fresh, thick and just all around amazing. Would recommend this place to anyone!
If you miss the pre-COViD uchida and have avoided supporting them or leave a low star rating because there is no dine-in option‚Ä¶ you are missing out on this gem. I was a long time customer who had his early dates (with my now wife) here.. always loved going there for their dine-in experience.  I am guilty of not going in the last couple years because of not wanting to takeout the amazing food in portable packaging.  I ran into the chef socially in the last couple months and kept saying ‚ÄúI‚Äôll see you soon‚Äù.. but today I really pushed myself in using their online ordering system and picking up takeout for a car date with my wife. The number of times I kept saying ‚Äúwow‚Äù as I sat in my car holding the paper box‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs astounding how much care and love the chef puts into this food. For it to taste this good even in a portable form.. I am embarrassed now to feel that I was waiting for them to resume dine-in to go support this amazing eatery.

Please experience Uchida and let this chef express this talents.  As of this review in Nov 2022, you do you have to order online and pickup at their door.  Trust me, it‚Äôs not the same takeout food you are used to. I ate every grain of rice, not to waste a single element of the meal made personally for me.
Yasu is an amazing chef and I love how the fine ingredients are picked from local, sustainable sources. Takeout is still the only option and ordering is online only done in advance. I couldn't grade atmosphere since dining is not an option but the entr√©es are made with lots of care and love. Menu does change periodically so keep an eye out for variety.

Today I lucked out with chicken curry and onsen eggs. I've always heard about onsen eggs but not locally so it was a delight to drink some. Do we even have an onsen in Victoria? üò≠ If there's a legit Japanese one sprouting out somewhere here, let me know because I am game for that!

name: Poke Fresh
reviews:
Packed poke bowl! Lots of options and customization. Also with pre-set bowls available. Great combination of toppings. Ingredients all tasted fresh and staff was also very kind. Best poke bowl in Victoria hands down. Best bang for your buck in my opinion
Such a fresh and delicious spot for a healthy bite to eat! I like that I can build my own bowl and that it‚Äôs a locally owned restaurant.
Not the best poke spot. I found the marinade a bit too heavy and the wasabi mayo was so overpowering I couldn‚Äôt finish my food. Service was friendly and prompt however and the place has a decent amount of seating and a nice vibe.
The rice bowl uses the wrong kind of rice. It should be warm brown sushi rice but it‚Äôs dry long basmati instead. Not enough sauce on the food at all and I had to bring my meal home and put salad dressing on it to eat it. Makes no sense.
We go here often and 90% the staff is really nice and helpful. The gentleman that served us today was still friendly after a long long day at cook st days. thanks again

name: BC Legislative Dining Room
reviews:
Best kept secret in Victoria. Reservation recommended.

The food was excellent, and the service was amazing. Great food and low prices. What more could you ask for.

We went there for lunch one day and breakfast another day. Both meals were perfect and under $20.

Be sure you plan extra time to walk around the building and see all the beautiful stained glass windows.
We really had an amazing experience here. Food is great at amazingly low prices. From entrance to exit all are super organized, really appreciate. Would love to come again. I visited for breakfast and lunch as well on different days, it was fun !! Never expected food to be that good.
To my Mom and I went for a lovely lunch.  We had a lovely server Pilar. We loved our server, the decor, the food was yummy, the setting was very nice , white table cloths, a Christmas tree and Music, white china, heated plates, we enjoyed the fact that we did not feel rushed to leave. The prices were great. We have booked for 2 weeks from today so we can try another menu item.
I had breakfast there a couple of days ago while visiting visiting Victoria. Both the food and service (so professional!) were very good. Prices were extremely reasonable - excellent value!  I wish there were more places like that. It‚Äôs nice to sit at a table with proper tablecloth and special tableware designed specially for them. It was a lovely experience.
As always, today, July 21st, 2022, the experience, the menu selection, the service, not to mention our blueberry pie dessert which we shared,was amazingly good! I‚Äôd highly recommend this breakfast/ lunch restaurant that might be one of Victoria‚Äôs best kept secrets. You are checked in through security, so bring your photo ID. Before you even eat, you wind your way through the basement corridors with painted brick and stone walls, of the Parliament buildings, going out one door and into another before arriving at the beautifully decorated Tudor style restaurant. Servers are prompt and friendly‚Ä¶food is delicious and best of all the prices are very very reasonable. You can check the specials of the day on their website. You will need reservations about 48 hours in advance, especially during the busy tourist times.

name: Rebar
reviews:
The produce was really good but the eggs were over cooked and the had browns were burned. The vegan bowl was too oily and the sauce bland. The atmosphere was really nice.
I got the 3 sisters enchiladas - they were good! Unfortunately our experience was tarnished by the incredibly slow service. It look a half hour to get our drinks alone!
Lots of light and fresh decor. Full range of vegitarian and vegan food selection. The 'Rueben' was made with marinated tempeh and beets - deliciius. 3 Sisters enchiladas very good. Andrea came by to see how the food was. üòÉ
So glad we tried Rebar while in Victoria! The waitress was happy to point out the many gluten free & vegan options. The portion sizes are great. You won‚Äôt leave hungry. Lots of fresh flavours and veggies in the dishes. It would also be worth it to go just for the fresh juice. Delicious - it really hit the spot!
Amazing juices, huge portions
Came in in dire need of vitamins and found everything I wanted. The Lemon Aid juice was delicious and the peanut noodle bowl was huge and very filling. Cheery atmosphere and attentive service - a wonderful find for a vegan visitor!

name: Yummy Truck: Mediterranean and East African Cuisine
reviews:
Terrible experience. I‚Äôm sorry but putting processed rotten tasting chicken and processed cheese slices on you club sandwich Is a joke. People are paying you good money to eat and you offer garbage. I won‚Äôt even start on the fries üòí just bad all around.
Great Flaffle wrap and great customer service
Great shawarma. Best I have ever had actually. It took a few minutes to make but it was so fresh it was worth the wait. Friendly service too. Will definately return. Located behind the museum
This shawarma tastes like heaven! Try the beer shawarma with garlic sauce if you like the garlic taste, it is great!
One of the best wrap kebab of my life.
Service fast and just perfect.

name: Yukatsu&Uburger
reviews:
First time at this place and I was thrilled how great it was. It looks like a Korean type fast food. We had the traditional Korean burger and shared a portion of fries. The burger was simple, tasty and fresh. The fries tho... Prob best fries I ever had. I think they were battered in the katsu breading. They were super crispy on the outside and perfect with everything else.  I'll go back here and can't wait to do it and try other stuff.
Great Place. Love burger here. Will try Kastu next time. They looks very delicious.
Too crispy donkatsu, salad mixed with delicious sauce, and French fries!!
Everything is perfect. üëçüëç
I'll be back soon!!!
Amazing food and Great service.
Everything was really good.
I got the cheese katsu set. Wow. The Katsu was moist and a generous portion for the price. Loved dipping the salt and Wasabi with the cheese.
Probably the best katsu I've had in Canada.
Highly recommended! üíØ
Staff were so friendly and attentive -- felt like they really care about the business and the guest experience. Atmosphere was cute and very casual, we went around 3pm and we were the only ones in there. Cheese katsu was a large portion and perfectly crispy with gooey cheese.  I really liked the cabbage salad it came with. The bulgogi burger was sooooo messy but pretty tasty. It reminded me of a smash burger. One thing I will mention is everything had an element of sweetness (Katsu sauce, salad dressing, burger sauce) and wasn't balance by salt or spice. Would like to see more balance. Will definitely come back for takeout.

name: Banh Mi Ba Le Victoria
reviews:
The only place on the Island that sells authentic Vietnamese Banh Mi (submarine sandwich) like the ones you'll find in Vancouver. I ordered the cold cut special for $8.00 and they actually use the correct butter, pate and meats unlike other places offering Banh Mi on the Island. The subs are a bit shorter than I've seen and inflation raised the prices recently but that's basically everything nowadays. Overall I still consider it well worth it and I'll recommend this place ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
The Banh mi was amazing! Got the vegan chicken one and it is absolutely the best sandwich in Victoria. By far. The veg spring roll was delicious too!
I love the warm meat ball sub. Fresh cilantro marinated daikon. Super good price, super friendly owners. It‚Äôs my favourite Vietnamese sub place in town.
Very good Vietnamese subs,. Friendly people. Got #9 lemongrass chicken, #5 cold cut special, I did find the flavor of both of these exceptional.
Just tried 2 (of the 4 available) vegan bahn mi options at Bahn Mi Ba Le downtown and would 10/10 recommend. We‚Äôve been searching for our go-to place and have experienced a couple flops. Not Ba Le - it was yummmmmmm so good. We had the tofu (#3) and vegan chicken(#11).

name: Superbaba (Victoria)
reviews:
I stopped at Superbaba for lunch, and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. They make fresh pita breads daily, and that‚Äôs key. You can see them baking the bread in a hot oven. The pita bread is soft and slightly chewy. I got the falafel wrap, and it was delicious. The chickpea fritters were crispy. I enjoyed the fresh and crunchy vegetables in the wrap. The flavours are exquisite. I love their aesthetics with modern flair.

Additionally, I also decided to try the turmeric cookie. Along with the turmeric, I appreciated the rose water. The rose water adds a distinct and unique floral which, in my opinion, is very unique. The cookie had a good texture, with a slightly crisp outer shell and a soft and chewy middle. Highly recommend. Next time, I shall order ahead.
Chicken Wrap with two extra falafel balls on the side. Definitely filling a niche that needs filled and I‚Äôm so glad it‚Äôs around whenever I need it! Thanks!
There is a reason this restaurant is always busy. So delicious! I only wish they would ask if you need a fork when getting food to go because I assume it‚Äôs in there & then end up eating my salad/chicken bowl with my fingers @ the park ü§ì tasty tuom, pita chips and ice cream sandwich & also love the lemonade. I will never tire of the sauerkraut pickles & blackened chicken. YUM
I had a chicken wrap last week and it was not awful taste. It was full of cabbage and hardly find chicken inside though it was chicken wrap. Instead chicken I got too much fries.
Hope will take care next time.
Ordered the spicy falafel bowl for lunch. It took a bit of time but was worth the wait. Fantastic flavour and a good slow burn when finished. Add this to the go-to list for lunch! Next time I'll order ahead.

name: Be Love
reviews:
I had ordered takeout so I can't judge the service from inside the restaurants.
On the other hand it is the first time that I receive a boxing so well presented!
The springtide roll is crazy, hearty for the price and perfect balance between flavors and melting and crispy consistency in the mouth!
The mac when to him is a killer! üòÖ it's perfectly rich, exquisite flavors with lots of vegetables and nuts, perfectly seasoned too!
I recommend this restaurant!
Seriously delicious. We were there early and the place was quiet, so the service was excellent. The food was outstanding, especially the gluten free bread on the sandwich and the Mezze in particular. I thought the tacos lacked a little punch and would have liked a touch more flair or flavour in them, but that in no way detracts from a well deserved five star vegan lunch. The roast potatoes were so perfect too. Yum! Excited to take my family when they visit.
Stopped by for some lunchtime soup and was not disappointed!!

This gem of a restaurant in downtown offers extraordinary vegetarian meals‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm not a vegetarian but I‚Äôd gladly eat here any day! The soup of the day on our visit was Potato Leek soup and it was hearty, filling, and so delicious. Definitely a spot worth coming back to!

A worthy mention - lovely staff that prioritize a comfortable dining experience above all. Thanks for the great meal!
Excellent Customer service. Took us in 15 minutes before our 630 appointment. The waitress was very friendly and kind. The food were amazingly plated. The smoothies were a treat. However I didn‚Äôt appreciate the spring burger and the sandwich we ordered. The bread and the veggie patty and tempeh were too dry for our liking. The buns were too crumbly, dry and dense. My excitement for coming back  here went down. Im pretty sure their other menu selections are tasty.
We came here as a date dinner and it was perfect! The tables were really close to each other but it made the atmosphere really cosy and magical. Beautiful restaurant and attentive service. We ordered the soup of the day that was delicious and their tacos, the sauce was good. We also ordered the green bowl which was good but nothing too out of the norm and a little bit bland. Their pickled vegetables are homemade and one of the best I have ever tried. Their cheesecake was to die for. I love the idea of having a seasonal menu as you can tell the produce is fresh.

name: Spice Valley Indian Cuisine
reviews:
Loved their hospitality and absolute friendliness. We are a tourist couple from Winnipeg and they made our visit the best in BC. Main dishes - butter chicken, tandoori chicken were excellent and the spices kicked in as soon as we ate it. The gulab jamun melted in our mouth and the naan‚Äôs texture was really soft and flavourful. We received complimentary mango milkshake and a big pakora platter from the chefs . It was an amazing experience. Must try. Also, everything is halal!
Spicy Valley Indian Cuisine Take Out surpassed our expectations with their amazing food, generous portions, and exceptional customer service. From the moment we entered, we were greeted warmly and treated to a complimentary mango milkshake, setting the stage for a delightful dining experience. The taste of their dishes was extraordinary, showcasing authentic Indian flavors that left us craving more. Each bite reflected the freshness and quality of the ingredients used. The portion sizes were generous, providing excellent value for money. On top of that, we received a complimentary pakora platter, adding an extra touch of generosity. However, what truly stood out was the impeccable customer service. The staff was attentive, knowledgeable, and went above and beyond to accommodate our preferences. It was by far the best customer service we experienced during our trip to British Columbia. Overall, our visit to Spicy Valley Indian Cuisine Take Out was amazing, offering delicious food, ample portions, and top-notch service. We highly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking an authentic Indian culinary adventure in Victoria island, British Columbia.
We ordered for our annual Christmas Staff party catering. Food is amazing and super authentic.Each dish has wonderful flavours and great textures. All of us really enjoyed the food. Thank you so much spice Valley team.‚ù§Ô∏èüôè

Bob
&
Dosa Paragon Team
I have been a regular customer at this restaurant and I've always enjoyed their delicious food and excellent customer service. However, my recent experience left me disappointed. I ordered the beef mango curry but received plain beef curry without any mango. When I returned to the restaurant for a replacement, the cashier claimed it had mango without even checking or tasting the food. I am disappointed with the lack of effort made to amend the mistake. The cashier simply insisted that the dish contained mango, despite my assurance that it did not. I felt that my feedback was not valued, and I was left without the dish I had paid for.
There are over a dozen other Indian restaurants between my home and Spice Valley Esquimalt, but I will make the trip here instead every time! The food is SO flavourful and wonderful, and the best naan I've had!! (I do miss the samosas though!)

name: La Taquisa
reviews:
I usually get the 4-person family meal. But we hadn't ordered from La Taquisa in a while. Lo and behold, a container of crisp, fresh, finely shaved purple cabbage replaced the iceberg lettuce which used to come with this meal. Outstanding change! So crunchy. So good.
Their burritos are delicious...when you get a good one. I've had mostly good luck so my burritos were always pretty good. But unfortunately, sometimes you get a mushy flavourless burrito that just leaks liquid.

I'd give it 3.5/5 but I can't select half a star, so I will give the 4/5 since the owner is cool and friendly.
We had an event catered by La Taquisa and the whole experience was wonderful from start to finish. Food was delicious and Scott was so great to deal with. Really can‚Äôt recommend them enough.
Fantastic tacos, especially the beef ones. Service was fast and friendly. Menu clearly labelled with what contained gluten.
What a hidden gem ‚Äî this place is legit. I popped in for a quick bite just before lunch time and in the time I was there, every single customer that came in was a regular that the owner knew by name. The staff was speaking Spanish to each other which is always promising for a Mexican restaurant, they were all super friendly to me, and sure enough the pork chorizo burrito was mad tasty.

It‚Äôs a bit pricy at $14 for just a burrito, but worth it for a good meal and to support a local business that staffs and serves good people. If I lived in the area I‚Äôd pop in weekly, cause I know I‚Äôd get treated good!

name: Bodega
reviews:
I heard great things and decided finally to treat myself ... I was not disappointed.  The house G & T was beautiful and divine! Paired with the Bay Scallop & Cod Fish Ceviche was amazing. Perfectly balanced, soft, and delicious! I will definitely be coming back!
Excellent food. The soup was super good, pepper and coconut. I took the trio platter to try a little of everything. I did expect more for the price ($15) however, it was very tasty. I would recommend to just go with a full dish instead of the trio, you get more for your money. Finishing touch, a nice espresso. I will be back.
This place is awesome! Fabulous tapas, you can‚Äôt seem to go wrong with anything on the menu! Everything is perfectly curated. Beef carpaccio is love at every bite, same with gambas al ajillo. Even the baguette and the focaccia bread as sides to the meals were fresh and delicious. Portions are fair for the price. Wine list is pretty good, the few wines we had were great. Even the Sherry list is pretty good if you‚Äôre into that. Service is awesome, and finally the atmosphere is really nice. Cool lighting inside, and a beautiful open bar.
Excellent food, creative menu, great service-- what a fun and happy place!  We will definitely be back.
When in Victoria, Bodega is a must! üíØ We walked in around lunch time, and since they weren‚Äôt too busy, the hostess managed to get us a table right away, which was very appreciated. Bodega has cosy, fun, and warm vibes!¬†Our server was friendly, attentive, and provided excellent service. We got some of their house wines to start. Since they adopted the small tapas plates, it‚Äôs great for sharing. We ordered a bunch of food, and it was all high quality, tasty, and phenomenal. We got the patatas bravas, bay scallops, and cod fish ceviche, served with some potato chips, Gambas al Ajillo,¬†and the grilled broccolini. The flavours of each dish were exquisite and well-executed. I highly recommend this place to all if you‚Äôre looking for some great bites, drinks and have a fantastic time!

name: Sol Food Cafe Deli Catering
reviews:
I've been here in the past a few times but the customer service seems to be hit or miss along with the value. Last week my burger was great, but today was not so good. Below is a picture of my "Special" beef dip for $15. Fries were extra for $4 which I didn't read because it was located in the top corner  of the notice board in smaller writing. I believe their other meals (from the grill) come with fries so you just assume it would, as did my coworker. Anyways, my plate comes and the beget bread is super thin and small. The beef dip has no taste and I'm thinking I ordered from the kids menu. My coworkers are amused so I ask the dish person if this came with fries, he said he would go check and never came back. At this point they were not very busy.  I had to ask him again and he said no. As I took a photo of my meal, the person operating the cash register noticed me, that prompted her to ask if everything was ok. I said, for $16 I thought this would have came with fries. She asked if I'd like some, so I accepted her offer which I was thankful for. When my coworker's meal came out, she order the same thing. It appears I received the end peices of the baguette where she received the middle pieces, her portion was twice the size with twice the amount of beef and came with large pickle. I'll be giving this place a break, if I return and the service improves I'll change the rating. Keep away from the specials.
I was tasked with organizing a company function whereas catering was required for approx. 50 people. I reached out to Sol Food Cafe to inquire about catering and the staff were amazing, provided clear details, provided great pricing and were available within a week's notice. The team arrived on time, set up everything outside (looked beautiful) and came back on time to take all the dishes away. The food was amazing, tasty, the salads delish and the vegan focaccia bread was loved by every one that there was none left! I would definitely use them again!
I would have to say this is one of the best restaurants I‚Äôve eaten in and I‚Äôve traveled all over‚Ä¶the lovely owner is fantastic and the food is out of this world! What really gets me is the incredible salads and their specials but I‚Äôll tell you they‚Äôre salads are delicious.  Clubhouse is out of this world and I had a chicken burrito too and it was so good‚Ä¶ Definitely go and visit this remarkable restaurant and if you need any catering, would use this in a heart beat!!!!! I wish I could give her a 10 out of 10 on this score and the people she has working there are so friendly just like her! Everything is made fre!!! Amazing!!!!!. You can tell the difference as soon as you walk thru the door. Great prices too!!!!
Can‚Äôt stress how good this place is.
Seemingly a hidden Gem lurking in the little Gorge waterway area. I was there for brunch on Saturday and the Benny and Chicken a waffles was amazing. The service was 5* from start to finish. The Chef (Mike) came out to greet us, and tell us a bit about the place, the menu, and where the food was sourced which made the whole experience even better. 100% recommend and will return. Do yourself a favor and visit Mike at Sol üëçüèª
Lovely staff who I personally noticed treating each and every table of guests with the same friendliness throughout. Had the Eggs Benedict and tried the Fried Chicken and Waffles, both were excellent. Will definitely be coming back.

name: Foo Asian Street Food
reviews:
Dishes are well served, really nice quantities. We ordered 3 dishes and we had to take 1 in a box (2 adults and 2 kids). This place is delicious. They cook your plate on the spot, pretty fast too. The people there are very friendly and will consider go back on our next visit!
I personally recommend the Caramel Chicken when visiting this place. Good luck!
The crispy ginger pork was an explosion of flavor in my mouth. I would definitely recommend it. The spice level was just right for me.

My wife got the famous caramel chicken which she enjoyed. Both dishes are delicious. The potstickers though were just average fried pork dumplings. Their meat serving  was plentiful that we had to ask for a to go box for some leftovers.

Prices were reasonable considering it already includes taxes. Service was fast.
What a gem! This is what you might call a ‚Äúhole-in-the-wall‚Äù treasure chest of a restaurant, given its humble appearance in proximity to just another liquor store‚Ä¶ but the food was divine! Some of the best spins on Thai classics I‚Äôve seen and tasted and I look forward to trying more. Not the most ‚Äúcozy‚Äù spot given limited space and seating, but perfect for a quick yet quality meal alone or as a pair.
We will be back for more!

Had passed by this place many times, and finally stopped!  Really glad we did.

The s&s pork Belly was really tasty - the green beans were sneaky good!  We also had a daily special - lentil dahlli - which was super good too!  The fry bread was a welcome appy, as it was a unique dish!

Parking is a challenge, but the walk is worth it.
Best food experience on our trip to Victoria!!
We ordered Kung Pao Tofu and Special Fried Rice, both the dishes were delicious. For Kung Pao Tofu, one would imagine that Tofu was the star of the dish (which it was), but for me it was the crispy fried broccoli which took the dish to another level.. chefs kiss !!
Food quantity and the service was pretty good. I can't wait to go back and try other things on their menu.

This place is a must visit if you are in Victoria.

name: L'Authentique Poutine and Burgers
reviews:
Fast and friendly service. We ordered the kids burger and fries which is a steal of a deal. Excellent cheeseburger with fries, juice box and ice cream cup for $9.

We didn‚Äôt get the poutine sadly but we did order another small fry because these fries were arguably the best I have had in my life!

Definitely pop in for a bite!
L'Authentique Poutine and Burgers, Located in the heart of the city, offers a delightful experience that combines the rich flavors of poutine and the classic appeal of a mouthwatering Burgers.  With its inviting outdoor seating and cozy atmosphere, this restaurant provides a memorable dining experience that will leave you craving more.

I ordered the basic poutine, and I indulged.   A delectable combination of crispy golden fries, velvety cheese curds, and a generous smothering of savory gravy. The fries were perfectly cooked, striking the delicate balance between softness and crispiness, and the cheese curds melted in the mouth, imparting a delightful creaminess to each bite. The gravy, rich and flavorful, complemented the other ingredients without overpowering them. It was evident that the restaurant takes pride in the quality of their ingredients, as each component was fresh and well-prepared.

Moving on to the cheeseburger, L'Authentique demonstrated their prowess in crafting a classic favorite. The cheeseburger I savored was a testament to their dedication to flavor and quality. The patty, cooked to perfection, was juicy and flavorful, bursting with the unmistakable taste of quality beef. The cheese, melted to perfection, added a creamy richness that elevated the overall experience. The bun, lightly toasted, provided the ideal vessel for holding together all the delicious components of this burger. The combination of flavors and textures was undeniably satisfying, leaving me thoroughly impressed.

Moreover, the staff members were friendly and attentive, ensuring that each customer received personalized attention and a seamless dining experience. Their knowledge of the menu was evident, as they offered helpful suggestions and answered any questions I had.

In conclusion, L'Authentique Poutine and Burgers is a gem among outdoor restaurants. From their mouthwatering poutine to their flavorful cheeseburgers, every bite is a testament to their commitment to quality and taste. With friendly service and an inviting ambiance, this restaurant is a must-visit for food enthusiasts seeking a memorable dining experience.
I had a stop in Victoria from my cruise and I knew as soon as I stepped foot in Canada I had to get some poutine. Thanks to google maps, I knew just where to go. I made a beeline off the boat and headed here before the lines! Food came relatively fast, they made the poutine with fresh fries and topped it sopping with gravy. The man who handed me my order was so sweet and wished me ‚Äúbon appetite‚Äù.  As I sat there enjoying this plate of heaven the line go super long! As it should, this place was excellent!
Very nice service and knowledgeable about celiac disease. They fry corn dogs in a designated fryer so the french fries are gluten-free. You order at the window and eat outside. Parking is plentiful and you pay easily on your phone. Nice view of wharf.
We visit this little place at least a few times a year while out deck crawling in Downtown Victoria. The big draw is the authentic (it's in the name L'Authentique) Montreal Smoked Meat on the Poutine and Mechant Burgers. Best Montreal Smoked Meat I have had since I last went to Montreal. Very reasonably priced.

name: Bao
reviews:
Have been in Victoria a few times, but hadn‚Äôt gotten the chance to stop at Bao, until the other day. What a disappointment. The bao buns we tried were Taiwanese Classic, Buttermilk Fried Chicken and Mala 5 Mushroom. The classic was the best flavour and it was just okay, the rest were bad. The Tan Tan Men was just bad, could barely eat it. And the Kara Miso Ramen was subpar, something about it was off. The Vietnamese ice coffee on the otherhand was yummy. You seat yourself and pay at the counter when you arrive, so there isn‚Äôt much service. Overall not nearly close to the 4.5 rating it has on google more like a 3.0.
Bao is my favorite place for Japanese fusion disk in Victoria. My favorite dish is Pork Belly Ramen with Extra-Pork Belly.

Pork Belly here are chrispy outside with softly inside during my first bite I feel OMG it great. Ramen soup, I have requirement as spicy as they can do. I love that because environment outside feel cold.

You should be trial if you travelling around Victoria downton, Yummy.
One of the few restaurants open late night on a weekday. Decided to try a couple of their baos during our stay in Victoria. Ordered Buttermilk Fried Chicken, Chinese BBQ, Mala 5 Mushroom, and the Taiwanese Classic (from left to right). It was 4 for $16. They were cute tiny baos, good for an appetizer and the flavors were on point. I wished they were full sized though! The Mala 5 mushroom had a good spicy kick to it.
LOOK NO FURTHER! This is the best place to eat in China Town, hands down! For starters, hubs and I are in our 40's, parents of teenagers, restaurant owners, and brought our large vacationing family to Bao from other blogger recommendations. We couldn't be happier that we tried it out!! Everything we tried was amazing, the 13 year olds loved theirs as well! Small, quaint, clean, fast, friendly, and absolutely delicious! We can't wait to visit Bao next time we go to Victoria!
I have been here a few times already and it‚Äôs a great spot for a really quick meal or snack. There are so many different options you can get when deciding what type of bao you want which is nice when you want to try different flavours! They also have other options like noodle dishes, rice bowls and starters that you can chose from if baos aren‚Äôt your thing. I‚Äôd recommend the Chinese BBQ Bao, it tastes very similar to Peaking Duck! Also the Mala Crispy Fried Chicken Skin is a must! This is what I ordered. For the Baos I got the Pork Meatball Banh Mi, Buttermilk Fried Chicken, Chinese BBQ and Tonkatsu Chicken. I also ordered the Truffle Chashu Ramen and
Mala Crispy Fried Chicken Skin!

name: Nubo Japanese Tapas
reviews:
I rarely provide 5 star reviews due to something always being off. Whether that be the food, service, or the environment. But this was impeccable. Very rarely did you find such fluidity and cooperation between serving staff and the kitchen.

The food was very delicious and surprisingly quick. Having fast service is usually a red flag for me, wondering if the food was fresh or made with quality, but without a doubt, it was made well.

Our waitress was very polite and nice to talk with. She always responded to our "thank you" with a "you're welcome" she had the perfect balance of attention and checkups to not annoy people with constant checks but didn't leave you wondering if you were going to be served. It was the perfect balance.

The restaurant is small, which does make the noise travel quite far, on the louder side, but being at the bar was a saving grace as volume seemed to be lower there.

All in all it was a very nice experience and the next time we are in Victoria we will definitely be returning for another meal.
Went here after a recommendation from a friend. I was happy with what I ordered but my folks were less so. Octopus was good, and the avengers roll was fantastic. The chicken kara-age was a miss. Overall, just okay.
Ordered outside our usual, sushi rolls, and it didn't disappoint one bit. Got some ramen and udon... Delicious! Drinks were also fantastic.  Only thing is, it felt crowded. Seating and table are all so close together. But doesn't take away from the delicious dinner we had.
Everything was perfection. To the rapid service to the quality of the food, thank you! The flavors and presentation are mind blowing üëåüèª‚ú®
Wonderful. Wow. This place comes highly recommended from family, friends, and strangers. It did not disappoint. The nigiri and sashimi was glorious.

Top fan of:
-hocate
-sake
-chutoro
-hamachi

We had the black Pearl roll which was also good.

Omg. It was great! Sashimi cuts were generous for the cuts.

Staff were all very friendly. Top experience here. I went for dinner last night and now debating it the next day for lunch.

Can‚Äôt wait to come back.

name: Cactus Club Cafe
reviews:
Came here with my partner during happy hour, we were really happy with the happy hour menu. The prices were reasonable for what we ordered and the service was great! We ordered the
blackened creole chicken, it was delicious. We loved the mashed potatoes that came with it. We also got the tuna poke bowl, it was fresh and all the ingredients worked super well together. Excited to come again!
The food was absolutely amazing, especially the delicious Avocado salad. I tried Baja Fish Tacos for they very first time and it was a little spicy but incredibly delicious.
Everything was perfect.
One of the only places not short staffed. What a pleasure, the food was amazing and they couldn't do enough for us
First off, Nicci our server was awesome. The drinks, appys and dinner was amazing.
Thank for a nice evening to help celebrate our 29th anniversary. When making our reservations it asked if it was a special occasion l, and it was put in that it was our anniversary, so we were bit disappointed that there was no mention of it.
We celebrated my friend's birthday at Cactus. Our waiter was very friendly and patient, and the service was excellent. The atmosphere in the store is great and it's perfect for a small drink with friends. The food was delicious and we shared several dishes, but we loved Tuna Tatar the most.

name: Tractor Everyday Healthy Foods - Victoria Harbour
reviews:
Best local hidden gem in downtown!! This is a business that I would totally support any time. Best quality of food, fresh; healthy, and hearty! Friendly and knowledgeable staff, always welcoming and give lots of thoughts in preparing the food. Best part - their coffee and pastries. I love the dark chocolate pistachio cookies and the dark chocolate banana bread. come here every week we are in downtown
Exactly what we needed! Tasty, healthy, fulfilling food at a good price plus the location is perfect! I love that they have so many gluten free and vegetarian options that are not necessarily a salad, but full meals. We ordered a cup of lentil soup, chicken sandwich, Thai bowl with tofu and chocolate / pistachio cookies. The staff was really friendly
If your looking for a great healthy place to eat in Victoria this is the place!  They also have several Vegan options available!

We tried the Chicken Avocado Sandwich which was served on a Ciabatta Roll. We also tried the Nourish Bowl which comes with Power Greens & Brown Rice. You get the option to add two Market Sides to it. We chose the Edamame Crunch & Lemon Kale.

Everything was great. Plenty of indoor seating, also a great outdoor area as well that looks towards the harbor.

Pet Friendly Patio.
One of our overall highlights in Victoria. Everything is fresh and really high quality. The menu is a little limited overall, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. It's not a traditional restaurant. It has an upscale cafe setup but the food will leave you feeling very satisfied. The pear and pickled onions were so well incorporated into the chicken sandwich. They are flavor experts, where they can take items you normally wouldn't pair at home and make them extremely tasty. You can tell a proper chef came up with the recipes.
I'm only mad that I've been living in Victoria for 2 years and just now trying this place. I love healthy food, but I know it's hard to make it taste good. I got a yogurt Parfait and an everyday bowl with Quinoa and Blueberries. Every bite was packed with flavor and freshness. Staff were also very friendly and kind.

name: Zambri's
reviews:
Great wait staff. Marcus was great. They care about your experience. Lasagna was superb, but while the sauce was classic Italian, my preference is for a thick, deep red, flavorful sauce.  Very interesting location - you could eat inside of a mall-type setting or in a street view with full-height windows.
Zambris has always been a favourite restaurant. So, when my husband and I were planning our wedding, it was a total fluke that we were ordering takeout and then mentioned events. About a year later, we were hosting our small wedding reception in the atrium of their building. And as always, Zambri‚Äôs delivered on the food. From the antipasto, pizza and amazing cocktails to the drool worthy multi-course tasting menu. They nailed every dishes, each more delicious than the last. The crispy broccoli and panna cotta were especially a hit. Not a single guest went home feeling hungry. In fact, in the months since our wedding, our guests have raved about how amazing the food was. It truly stood out. In addition to the food, I have to mention the staff. They really went above and beyond. I never saw an empty wine glass. We had little ones at the reception, and the staff were so kind and patient. We can‚Äôt wait to celebrate our wedding anniversary for years to come at Zambri‚Äôs. This place truly holds a special place in our hearts.
The food was good, but it‚Äôs overpriced (as are the bottles of wine). They don‚Äôt give you any complimentary bread or butter, which is a little disappointing, although maybe that is standard these days? Finally, be forewarned that the dessert they advertise as a ‚Äúcookie‚Äù is literally a cheap wafer (not a cookie) with a single scoop of ice cream, and it costs $14‚Ä¶
Nice location serving well executed family friendly Italian eats. Dishes are very well portioned and the menu was simple. The fried brocolli was wonderful. Service was good and very unobtrusive. We enjoyed our dinner here.
Set partially in an atrium you have the atmosphere and acoustic, comfortable private setting.  Service and food was great.  The halibut itself was cooked to perfection, but as noted by the waitress it was the only seafood menu option.

name: The Courtney Room
reviews:
Had an amazing dinner here last week! I‚Äôm still dreaming of the chocolate cake almond dipped dessert thingy‚Ä¶ it was to date the best dessert I have ever had ever!

The pricing isn‚Äôt for the faint of heart but the experience makes it more then worth it :)
Memorable experience diving in a beautiful sensorial exploration. Starting with an extraordinary cocktail called MOON + TIDE 18. (Suntory Toki, apricot brandy, lemon, koji syrup, cherry bitters, coniferous smoke) which kissed my senses - the prince in that fairytale style - and I woke up in a sunny fruit garden full of delicate smoke. I love it when food does that, first wakes you up the most wonderful way and invites you for a sensual journey, teleports you somewhere unreal and the only thing you can do is let go and explore: what an incredible melting beef short ribs, crispy outside yet wonderfully moist potatoe‚Äôs rectangle inside- carrot, salsify and kale. A side of duck confit rillettes style. Everything so perfectly baked. For wine pairing, the sommelier‚Äôs advices added to my journey, his second choice was a success. Each sensations in my palate had both more depth and space to develop. I caught myself slow down and focus on my senses. We concluded the journey with a brownie and beets which was very pretty and we loved the pate de fruits. Truly amazing restaurant. Thank you so much for the experience. The journey was exceptional. Very friendly staff. Memorable.
Yeah but the bill went to a little over 200 for 2 all included. Worth spending the money ? YES. ABSOLUTELY.
We ate here every day during our week at the Magnolia. Breakfast, brunch, and late dinner. Food was outstanding. Their hot sauce is l‚Äôade in house and is incredible. The compote was
fresh and delicious. Wonderful spirits and drinks for less than the stuffier Empress. Also quieter. More intimate. We were impressed!
Nice atmosphere, really good drinks provided by the best bartenders, Anton and Eric üëèüèº

From classic cocktails, the best fancy corn dog and one of the most unique cocktails I have ever had, the Mind Hive. Happy hour runs from 2 to 5.

Loved The Cortney Room.
One of the last fine dining establishments in Victoria, BC. By far the best experience I have had dining out here. From the ambiance to the expert gastronomic knowledge of the staff, to the decor and the food and drinks itself. Johnny our waiter, is the star of this place. Perfect for a special occasion to remember.

name: Montana's
reviews:
We went for All-You-Can-Eat-Ribs on Wednesday.
The taste was absolutely delicious, but they were extremely busy at 7 o‚Äôclock, the service was good but slow. You may need to wait for 20 mins for your next ribs.
The first rib will come with a sauce, 2 sides and 1 cake(?). After this, all of your refilled ribs will on its own. But make sure you ask for your next rib when you first rib on the table.
After a very long day, feeling exhausted and hangry we were met by our fantastic happy and enthusiastic server Alex who ensured we got exactly what we wanted to eat and completely lifted our spirits. She was very fast and had excellent customer service. The food was fantastic 10/10 would recommend!
We also went for all you can eat ribs. We arrived at about 7:30. The server was very nice. There were more people than usual, however the food came pretty fast ‚Äîabout ten minutes. Refill ribs took ten minutes as well. The ribs tasted normal, not too dry, a little burnt at the edges. Overall the dinner was pretty worth it.üëç
Great place to dine!!  Tacos are awesome!!!  Stakes are perfect!
And our regular sever is the best!!
Thank You Kathy!!!  She is always full of smiles and great help!!!
Want to give a shout out to our server Emma! She‚Äôs one of the reasons my wife and I come back to Montanas. We don‚Äôt live to far from the restaurant, and it‚Äôs a great place to go on those nights you just don‚Äôt want to cook. Good value for your money, and the food has been consistently good each time we‚Äôre here. But more than that, it‚Äôs servers like Emma who make our dining experience fun and memorable. So from my wife and I‚Ä¶ Emma thank you for your smiles and great energy each time we visit!

name: Lot 1 Pasta Bar
reviews:
Our server was very knowledgeable and friendly and we got there at the beginning of happy hour so it was slow but when we left it got very busy. The food took a little longer as with the bill but the quality of service and food made up for it. The pasta was the best pasta I've ever had hands down. They make it daily, I had to eat it slow to savor every bite. We are visiting from Ontario and if you are in the area and want amazing quality food at good price, visit here during happy hour ( based on the time change it was dinner time for us anyway üòÇ).
A very nice meal at Lot 1. We started with a bottle of red wine and their Lot 1 Roasted Garlic Herb Bread ( March feature ) It wasn't what we were expecting as it's very similar to a deflated focaccia but it was tasty. For main, I ordered the Moroccan Chicken Rigatoni minus the red peppers, added extra cashews. Very flavorful, great portion size and a little bit of an unexpected heat. Finished the night off with the white chocolate cheesecake minus the raspberry sauce, maybe a little to much caramel. An excellent desert paired with a glass of red wine. Overall a great meal. Server was great, very tentative. Will be back.
We went here very famished and it didn‚Äôt disappoint! Our server was very friendly and accommodating. We had some complimentary snack and had my toddler‚Äôs spaghetti custom made! We left feeling full, satisfied and happy. Servings were huge and good for sharing. Good food and great service, highly recommended!
Great find for amazing pasta in Victoria!
I am so so glad that I decided to pop in here one evening. The range and quality of the pasta dishes is excellent - the bacon and mushroom ravioli was just outstanding.
Add to that a great selection of cocktails and the BEST brownies I think I've ever had, and Lot 1 Pasta Bar is an easy recommendation to make.
The venue is clean, tidy and appealing, and the staff are friendly and knowledgeable about their menu.
Thank you to all of the staff for a lovely evening and excellent food!
Very tasty pasta served in nice large portions so you will definitely be full and happy. Good happy hour deals including mussels, baked brie, and giant meatballs. The polenta bites are particularly tasty. All the pasta dishes tasted very fresh and the ravioli was particularly delicious. The downsides are that the pork belly was quite dry and they advertise fresh squeezed orange juice from real oranges but when I got served mine it was most definitely not fresh squeezed orange juice but boxed orange juice. As someone that regularly drinks fresh squeezed orange juice the difference is night and day. You can even see in the picture included that the color of the actual orange slice they added is completely different than the color of the juice they served which was opaque and tasted like a Tropicana variant. If it's not fresh squeezed, they can just be honest and put it in the menu as orange juice instead of "fresh squeezed orange juice" as it's false advertising.

name: Heron Rock Bistro
reviews:
Came here based on Google reviews and we were NOT disappointed. Probably the best tasting Ceasar salad I've had in years. Falafel burger was super tasty as well.
My recent visit to this restaurant left me with some disappointment. The noise level inside the establishment was so high that having a conversation became quite challenging. It created an uncomfortable and chaotic dining experience.

Furthermore, the food did not meet my expectations. Specifically, the chicken in the chicken burger lacked flavor and tasted predominantly like bread. The absence of a distinct chicken taste was disappointing. To enhance the flavor, we had to request hot sauce to dip the chicken in.

While this restaurant has room for improvement, it's important to consider that individual experiences can vary.
We ate here 2 days in a row! It was convenient located in the heart of James Bay. Atmosphere was wonderful, menu items were plentiful and food was over the top! Live music twice a week people! Great little place to visit and will now be our go to place for eats!!!
I absolutely love Heron Rock! Best Chicken and Waffles Eggs Benny in town. Tucked away in James Bay with a warm friendly atmosphere and the loveliest staff, definitely worth a visit! I would highly suggest brunch, they serve all week until 3pm. Chefs Choice Triple Benny is a great way to explore the menu or for people who can't decide and like a surprise. The chef will make you three different Benny's of their choosing and it's been super yummy every time! If you're feeling like a Cesar or Mimosa, Heron Rock has a fantastic list of all kinds of Cesar's to try as well as their "Manmosa".
Friendly attendive staff, popular with the locals. Live music Monday night. Really good home made clam chowder and in-house made bun.

name: Fiamo Pizza & Wine Bar
reviews:
Fiamo is a cozy yet chic Italian restaurant.  Inside the restaurant is romantic, dark, and moody: perfect for a date night, evening cocktails, or having an intimate night to yourself.  They have a closed patio as well as an open-aired one though unfortunately it wasn't open when I visited.

Leah was our server who was methodical in how she went about the steps of service.  Amy also stands out to me in her role as a support staff/host.  Overall, the staff were quality: laid back but also seemed to care for their work.

I came for a Sunday night dinner so regrettably, the pasta dishes weren't available reducing the choices in entree.  However, their rotating specials of the day were a nice addition ensuring greater variety.  This also implies they utilize seasonal ingredients and come up with new dishes in addition to the set menu-- probably more fun for the kitchen staff too!

I ordered their special of the day: Eggplant Parmesan ($26) which was delectable.  I loved the addition of roasted vegetables (including potatoes, broccolini, sweet peppers, and carrots) to brighten up the otherwise heavy dish.

I would recommend this place for those in Victoria and craving a good Italian meal with a charming atmosphere :).
We came here on a Friday night.
With a reservation, we didn't wait to get our table. The table was located on a loft, feel sorry for the servers who need to run up and down every time.
We ordered Arancini for starter. They were rispy but bland that I had to dip them into the vinaigrette that was provided for the buns.
