I ordered full size carbonara. The portion was very generous, but it was very salty. Because it's big portion, I had to finish slowly. It got a bit dry when it got to the end.
My friend ordered a medium rare steak. It came in medium well. The gentleman was nice enough to take it back, replaced the dish, and took it off the bill. The second steak came as medium rare.
We ate dinner outside on a beautiful day. The evening can be chilly but we sat right under the heater. It was perfect! My husband had their beet salad and loved it. We shared some brussel sprouts and they were soooooo good...very crispy on the outside and very flavorful. We shared a pepperoni pizza and the meaty one (can't remember the name) Both were delicious but the meaty one had a nice spice to it. A great dinner to end the day.
A decent, but underwhelming restaurant. Stumbled in here by ‚Äúaccident‚Äù as it was on the way to another destination. Stopped in for a few beverages and some ‚Äúlate‚Äù night snacks and dinner. Overall, the experience was positive regarding the service. The food was a concern. Very underwhelming to put it politely. I‚Äôve certainly had better Italian food and the menu is quite generic, but you‚Äôll have a decent time here as long as your expectations are configured and set for something ‚Äúsafe‚Äù and run-of-the-mill. I‚Äôd say the atmosphere of the restaurant is probably the highlight and not necessarily the food or beverage.
We stumbled upon fiamo accidentally because the restaurant we were gonna go to was at full capacity when we got there. But have to say, it was well worth it! Super fun ambiance, we had the most kindest hostess, she was amazing, and the food OMG the meatballs were divine. We also got the Crab pasta and the roast chicken pasta, I liked the Crab one better out of those two, but both were very good and BIG portions! We even took half of it home. Check them out folks, It's well worth it!

name: Steamship Grill & Bar
reviews:
There was a wait so we asked to sit at the bar. It took about 10 min before the bartender gave us a menu/greeted us.
The drinks and food were super fantastic but the service was EXTREMELY slow at every step of the process. There were lots of hosts hoping around clearing tables and such but we went almost half an hour without anyone checking on us and waiting for the cheque.
Would dine here again but the service could definitely be improved.
Silly us, we overestimated how warm it would be at night. Our food was amazing and the view can't be beat, we were just so cold even when they moved a heater close to us. The seafood platter more than feeds 2 adults. I had the top sirloin steak and it was cooked to perfection at medium rare. We were with friends and the other meals were steamed mussels and clams, fish and chips and pepperoni pizza. Everyone left full and happy. I'd say this was more spendy than many other restaurants in the area but totally worth it.
One of the best happy hour spots in Victoria.
Make reservations for the veranda seating facing the bay.
We went 2 times in a week for some happy hour bites.
Their menu is heavily focused on fresh seafood.  The steamed muscles were delicious, and enough food to keep is full for dinner as well.
In the summer during tourist season, this place can get packed.  Tourist centric.
Parking can be tricky, much easier to just walk if you‚Äôre in Victoria.
Dinner time was busy, be prepared to be waiting.  Beautiful waterfront view and food were delicious and healthy too. We had harvest bowl (V) and mixed seafood.
We had a great dining experience here with friends.  It was a busy Saturday night but we had a table that was off to the side overlooking the deck and it seemed quite there. Good food and good service.  We had the Tuna Poke Bowl, the Chicken Boom Boom Bowl and the Salmon Bowl. All were good!

name: Nubo Kitchen + Bar
reviews:
Came to Nubo for dinner with 2 friends while out from Manitoba on vacation. This was the best all-around meal I've had in a while. The portions were more than expected...looking at you Puff Daddy...and the flavors were on-point. I will have continued dreams about the Japa Roll and the British Fish and Chips roll had a whimsically delicious spin. Our server was absolutely delightful and helpful with any questions we had. Nubo will absolutely be put on the must-go list for next time I'm out.
We were looking forward to our anniversary dinner here. The service was good. The seating was good. And if you like rice with a bit of fish flavoring on top, you'll love this place. We prefer a bit more fish in our sushi dinners. We ordered quite a bit with our tab over $100, and if there was more than 2 oz of fish between our two meals I'd be shocked. Lots and lots of rice, though. Did NOT look like the pictures. (Maybe it was because it was Monday and they ran out of fish from the weekend? Who knows. We won't be back to find out)

Overall experience: Meh.
The restaurant is beautiful, great location, lots of windows and natural light. Our server was awesome! The food was absolutely delicious and was made so quickly. When I visit Victoria again, I will definitely be stopping in here. Oh and the prices were really great too. 5 stars all around.
Had a great Birthday dinner with my friends tonight, friendly staff, perfect service and great food. The cocktails were absolutely amazing, everything was just so fresh and delicious.
THE absolute best Japanese restaurant in Canada. Great service, excellent cocktails and fresh, tasty food. Put it on your list! You won't regret it!

name: Brasserie L'Ecole
reviews:
Got lucky that there happened to be a table and didn‚Äôt have to wait. French onion soup was great for the cold rainy weather out. The duck with Roquefort sauce was a nice combination of flavours, and burger with truffle fries was tasty as well. Restaurant interior was cosy, a lovely place to dine for special occasions.
We waited at 5 and were able to be seated when it opened at 530 on a Saturday. I think we may have been one of the last groups in line that made it in immediately.

I had the burger, olives, asparagus brioche and for drink the Vieux Mot. It was delicious. All of it. One of the best burgers I‚Äôve ever had. The fries were yummy and very French traditional. I‚Äôve never had a salty brioche before but will now be trying them more at home. I loved it.

I can‚Äôt speak enough about how kind the servers were! I travel a lot alone with my daughter (5yo) and we love to go to fancy dinners together. However that usually means we get  turned away or side eye. It was absolutely not the case here and I really appreciated that! We both had a wonderful dinner ‚ù§Ô∏è
A relaxing and welcoming atmosphere. Friendly and professional service. Perfect and mouth-watering food. I had the steak frites with the fancy fries.  The fries had the most amazing texture I have ever experienced, and the steak had this delicious aged butter melted on top?! To die for. My partner had the duck and was very satisfied. 100/10 will be back to try the highly anticipated burger.
I have been dining in this French Bistro for 20 years. The consistency of the food has not changed a bit. Great food , great service  and the owner Mark is a gracious host.  Hands down my favourite restaurent in Victoria. Try the French Onion Soup, and endive salad. You won‚Äôt regret it.
We decided to finally try Brasserie L'Ecole on our anniversary for nice French dinner. 30 minutes waiting out in the cold was not so fun but we heard that's how you get a table so we dressed warm at least. We were seated right away and our server was polite and friendly while answering our questions about the menu. We ordered French onion soup and Tortelloni as appetizers and Rock fish, Duck Confit as main. French onion soup was fabulous. Rich in flavor, plenty of cheese on the top. The rest however was not so impressive. Tortelloni needed a bit more sauce, rock fish was cooked properly but was way salty. Duck confit tasted like a leftover most likely because it's overcooked. Not too long ago we had really nice duck confit at Cafe Brio so we were definitely disappointed. Dessert was alright, nothing impressive. After telling our server the rock fish was too salty, he took care of dessert which was nice. Personally I would prefer getting a great food and paying the right price for it than getting it covered on the house becuase it was not seasoned properly.

name: Tacofino
reviews:
Holy smokes these were delicious tacos!
I got the tuna taco and the yam taco.
The server recommended getting two and said it's the perfect amount, she was right! They were bigger than I expected as well!
The flavors of each taco were so different and amazing in their own way.
The restaurant is small and filled up very quickly for lunchtime and it was on a Tuesday, I can imagine a wait here on the weekends.
Food was quick and so fresh!
I will 100% be back and recommend this place to anyone visiting the area!
Thank you to the manager Kelsey Van Nes and the whole team at Tacofino for perfect delivery of our order and accommodating a food allergy!

These tacos really packed great flavour and the nachos had a great cook! Vegetarians will LOVE the yam tacos. I could eat those all day! Portion sizes were generous and the tacos came loaded just how I love them.

We will return again!
What‚Äôs not to love about Tacofino! This is the third location we‚Äôve eaten at and the experience was consistently top notch. We had the nachos which were a first for me-next time I‚Äôll ask for them to ‚Äúgo easy‚Äù on the beans (just to play it safe) Fish and Yam tacos were a hit as well, nice to see the taste and price come together so exceedingly well. Kudos guys we‚Äôll be back.
This is my first time visiting Victoria and I was recommended to check out Tacofino. I was extremely disappointed and left extremely unhappy. I paid $31.50 and felt like it was all a waste. I will never be going here again.

I ordered 2 Fish Tacos & 2 Crispy Chicken Tacos at 9:37pm. I waited outside for around 35 minutes for my order to be ready.

When I got to the car and looked at the tacos, I tried biting into the chicken tacos and the crispy chicken was literally rock hard batter. I started pulling the chicken pieces apart and it was all crispy batter, chicken skin, and no meat!!!! This is not high quality meat being used.

Is this place run by anyone? Feels like there‚Äôs absolutely no management leading the operations of this restaurant.
We planned part of our Victoria trip around this restaurant from excellent reviews and recommendations and it was so worth it. We ended up ordering way more food than the 2 of us could enjoy in an attempt to try various options. Absolutely left stuff in a food coma of bliss. The crispy chicken burrito, yam burrito, yam taco and fish tacos were just divine. The hard cider to accompany the meal was a perfect combo. Will definitely be back for more. Not a lot of free parking nearby so bare in mind to pay for your spot or expect an unpleasant surprise when you are back. Nothing abnormal for a downtown establishment.

name: Tapas on Oak
reviews:
We hosted a work event with 30 people and it was incredible. Dan and his staff were so attentive, kind, and helpful. The food was delicious, can‚Äôt say enough good things about the steak dish and green beans! Highly recommend this place for happy, hour, dinner, or hosting an event!
We visited for a late dinner and had a lovely experience. The staff were attentive and helpful, the food was delicious and the prices reasonable. We also met the owner who was super friendly and had some delicious suggestions for our meal. We are looking forward to returning soon.
We went to check out Tapas on Oak last week and had a fantastic night. The food offered a wide variety of tastes from around the world - from the Hong Kong dumplings to West Coast crab cakes, amongst other gems like the Karaage Chicken. All delicious. Great hospitality by the owner and excellent service by a fun staff. Nice selection of wines too, with a price point for all. Will definitely plan a return visit!
I have been to Tapas on Oak a couple of times and highly recommend it. Great food, good wine selection, and awesome service! Will definitely be going back.
Have been looking forward to trying this place for awhile and was disappointed. Large, heavy portions and price tags really took away from an authentic ‚Äútapas‚Äù experience. Food was meh. Good deal on wine by the glass for happy hour, but most on the list are from USA - only one option from Spain, few from other countries in Europe. Service was good and it wasn‚Äôt busy when we were there.

name: Saveur Restaurant
reviews:
We went there for the 1st time tonight and were blown away-service was incredible and sadly forgot the receipt to remember her name. Food was absolutely incredible! Most outstanding dish for us was the pork belly appetizer! Everything else was so beautifully presented and all the flavors were on point making it a full on sensory experience -highly recommendüëåüëçüëç
Great food and wonderful service! The flavours were delicate and well balanced, yet super flavourful and unique. The presentation was beautiful. The service was great; We took our time and didn't feel rushed.
Worth the splurge!!!  Yes it's expensive. And yes it was amazing! Good things are worth spending money on and if you've never had a fine dining meal, this should be on your local list to try! Service was attentive and on point. The meals were paired wonderfully with reds and whites appropriately. We started off with a super fun creative chai inspired whiskey sour! If James has it available, order it!!! When they say their tenderloin is like butter, it's true. And yes, you should pair wine with your dessert!
It's a small venue, with small tables but the service keeps on top of your table helping to avoid clutter. Thanks Chef, James, and Ryan for the great time!
Absolutely love this place. Tried nearly every dish on the menu and enjoyed all of them.
Food is not cheap and a little floofy (small portions) but that is expected at this type of place and food.

I tried the scallop and beef entrees, both were fantastic. Our server was one of the best I've ever had as well, very nice guy and oddly decisive in helping us choose meals which was great

The beet salad with the airated goat cheese was quite something. The chocolate cake has a beet white chocolate ganache poured in the middle and was great
We came on a sunday without realizing that there is a set menu on sunday's, I was pretty skeptical going into it as the menu items sounded very unique and I am a tad on the fence when it comes to new foods. I was pleasently surprised by what we ordered, but I thought that everything was so close to perfection, yet not quite there yet because of the small details. Everything was presented beautifully, the cucumber salad and the beef carpaccio were delicious as appitizers. The steak was cooked to perfection and is from Alberta, as a person that grew up in Calgary, this was still proabably one of the best steaks that I've had. Although the fried hash with the steak had a burnt flavour because it was put into overcooked oil and the almond's with the halibut made the flavour of the whole dish bitter.
The desserts were amazing and I loved the sorbet's that were served as pallet cleansers, although it may be helpful if the server's could point that out as I imagine that not everyone would know to eat the dessert that way and the flavour is vastly different if you ate the sorbet with the main items of the dessert.
Service was fantastic, Shane was super attentive and personable. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience here and would definately recommend this resturant.

name: The Palms Restaurant & Lounge
reviews:
One of the best places hands down I had visited in Victoria during my vacation!
The service was impeccable, the food was beyond what my taste buds could handle, and the decor was astonishing!
I felt welcomed and the service was fast, sweet, and they were able to handle our dietary concerns (no seafood).

The drinks are very well made and the flavours were absolutely scrumptious.

I highly recommend this place for your next birthday dinner, or fancy date night!
Went for an early dinner and were very well served. Tried several of the vegan items on the menu, and everything was delicious! Roasted dumplings, spaghetti-squash with seasonal vegetables and veg-stuffed ravioli. The chef was very accommodating, which we really appreciated. The blueberry lemonade and mango-mint soda were very good too. Flavourful blood-orange sorbet to finish off. Vegans will be very happy here.
A great place for cocktails! I had the Empress 75 and it was delicious without being too sweet! I ate the Best Ravioli (not pictured) and it was so good. For dessert I had the pecan pie, and it was really tasty but hard to eat with a spoon; ask your server for a fork :)
ü§§ I love this place! The spaghetti squash is in another level!
We were short of time and wanted to eat something before taking the bus to the ferries‚Ä¶ they brought all our food on a timely manner as well as the drinks!
Service was wonderful
The next time I come to Victoria, will definitely eat at this place!!
One of the nicest restaurants! Beautiful ambiance, friendly staff, and my food was incredible! I had the plant based beet ravioli. It was the best vegan dish I‚Äôve had! It had so many beautifully blended flavours, it was creamy, filling, and satisfying. I also had dumplings for an appetizer and they did a really job cooking them. I paired my meal with the Summerhill sovereign opal and it tasted lovely. I ended the dinner with the blood orange sorbetto and it was sweet and creamy. My mom had the spaghetti squash and said it was really good and my step dad inhaled the burger it was so good. This place is a great place for vegans and non vegans.

name: Fishhook
reviews:
Wasn't terribly impressed with this place. We tried the homemade sodas which were very strange and we couldn't finish either one.

My wife got the fish and chips. It was overly fried and probably below average for your typical bar.

I got the daily khatch. The seasoning was like average Indian food. Like the kind of stuff you'd get at a $14 all you can eat buffet. The one thing I did like was the Humboldt Squid. It tasted different than normal calamari, was super tasty, and made the whole experience worthwhile. If you're into calamari and seafood and never had Humboldt Squid, this is worth going to. Otherwise I'd recommend passing.
Amazing little restaurant we visited three times.
West coast seafood mixed with East Indian. Great combinations of flavors  and textures.
We had the house chowder and a salmon biriani. Both dishes tasted really good.
Great service and atmosphere.
We will be back!!
Fantastic Indian Seafood fusion spot. So much flavor. Chowder is not the creamy kind, which I liked. Seafood pot was super flavorful. Very unique, very tasty
Generous portion of fish and chips, and soup was pretty good with a nice kick of spice. For some reason the online ordering system didn‚Äôt work out for me, but enjoyed the dine in experience nonetheless as restaurant is very relaxed.
The fish chowder is just okay but the toasted bread come with it is the best!

Tuna melt is also highly recommended.

They take the last order 30mins before close- even take out order- be prepared

name: Cafe Brio
reviews:
No surprise that the food and service was amazing. A medium sized menu with a nice variety of choices. Most have the option to get half portions so you try a few different dishes easily enough. I assumed the full portion would be smaller due to being a fancy joint but it was very filling.

I had the pork cutlet which was mouth watering. I tried the beat salad and carbonara pasta as well - both amazing.

The only thing to complain about, and you can probably tell from the photos, is the lighting! If it's so dark your wait staff carry flashlights to read the menu... It's probably too dark.

Would be happy to return!
This place was great. The atmosphere perfect. The bartender was friendly and made my friend a custom drink. The boards are delicious‚Ä¶the duck with the Brie and quince jelly was a 10/10 combo. My only regret was not getting the bartender‚Äôs name to put in the review because he was both authentic and kind.
Absolutely incredible meal - from service, to atmosphere, to quality of the fare. We had the lamb, fish of the day, steak, and cured meats (which are made in house), and cheeses. Everything was fresh, well balanced, and very flavourful. One of our new favourite staples in Victoria
Wonderful food and owner. Had the Beet salad, the Contorni, Tomato Salad, Chanterelle Mushroom Risotto, and Lamb feature (4 types). Superb for 2 people.
Such a beautiful evening!I was met warmly at the door by the owner (I believe) who made me feel like I was coming to visit a good friend. The atmosphere was inviting and comfortable. The lovely young lady serving us was so attentive without hovering. The food was just amazing. Each of our meals were thoughtfully prepared and just the right amount. Desserts were fantastic! Thank you all for a perfect evening!

name: Yalla
reviews:
I go to Victoria often for business and always eat at the usual spots. Today a cab driver recommended this place.

I usually never write reviews, but for this place I had to. What an amazing experience! It‚Äôs a family owned business and you feel like you‚Äôre at someone‚Äôs home. They are friendly and welcoming. Food is outstanding, fresh, great quality, and portions are just right.

I will get back again and again!
I recently had the pleasure of dining at this Middle Eastern/Persian restaurant and was thoroughly impressed by both the food and the hospitality. The maquli bowl, which I ordered, was bursting with flavor and cooked to perfection. The portion size was generous and left me feeling satisfied but not overly full.

What really stood out to me, though, was the warmth and welcoming nature of the staff. From the moment I entered the restaurant, I was greeted with a smile and made to feel like a valued guest. Throughout my meal, the staff checked in on me to ensure that I was enjoying my food and had everything I needed.

Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for delicious Middle Eastern/Persian cuisine and a warm and welcoming dining experience. I will certainly be returning soon!
Absurdly tasty. The lamb schwarma wrap is a cacophony of many elements all individually seasoned and all making a taste symphony. Friendly service and a lovely, if understated, vibe.
The place is nice and the atmosphere is good. Service is good. My problem was the food. The meat was dry and not juicy. In the lafa, not enough salad, no tahini. The portions were kind of small for the price. Limonana is super sweet! Even my kids couldn't drink it. We had big expectations for the flavors and were disappointed.
Over the past few of years I‚Äôve walked pass by this place couple of times, finally today my friend and I finally paid a visit. We came in at the tail end of lunch time and there are still people ahead of us waiting to pick up their orders. From this phenomenon I can tell that over the years the locals have found this place a gem.
My chicken sharwama wrap tasted delicious. I tasted light curry and yogurt amongst the greens and chicken fillings. The wrap towards the end leaked out oil, while that might just be me not eating it fast enough/ in the right way.
Cashier knows the menu and is friendly. Your order gets brought to you when dinning in. Large glass/ plastic jug of water on the side free to fill.
All the staff are in the kitchen prepping food orders. I know I would feel more comfortable if the tables could be wiped down after each use or at set schedule. Marvelous that diners have been decent tiding up after themselves. Nevertheless, the virus is still around and death number still gets published.

name: Browns Socialhouse Victoria BC
reviews:
Super yummy food! I loved the butchers block burger. Crispy and tasty, not too messy. I upgraded to yam fries. We also got the southwest bowl which was good! The desserts were ok but not the best.

The one thing is, it wasn‚Äôt busy or anything but I felt the service was very slow. Took a long time for them to come around to us. But the food is great ! The patio portion is heated and enclosed which is cool.
Browns is always a nice place to go for lunch. My mom enjoys their veggie burgers and I enjoy their selection of drinks. The service at Browns is always good and staff is always friendly. I decided to try their new brunch options and was a little disappointed however they are new and they might need time to perfect brunch.
There are a few Browns in town, we went to the one downtown which has good location, staff are friendly, allow reservation and more importantly it is not too busy as the one uptown.  Highly recommend.
Went looking for a place to have brunch. Had immediate seating which was a bonus on a Sunday morning in Victoria. Food was good and plentiful, but the potatoes were undercooked. Server was very nice and attentive.
Met a friend for happy hour. It would have been nice to have another choice of seating. So busy and plenty of hub-bub noise close to the service area and kitchen. Social white wine, gluten free dry ribs and chips and guacamole. Yummy The server was great. The bathrooms were clean. ‚úîÔ∏è

name: Ugly Duckling Dining & Provisions
reviews:
Ugh, I really wish I could give Ugly Duckling a 5 star for the food as it was phenomenal - beautifully curated, pure and intense flavours, and gorgeous plating. Portions are to be expected for fine dining.

Service was friendly and professional, and it felt like the entire team worked together on service. It was a unique joy to get to meet the kitchen staff.

Unfortunately, despite all this, the wait times between tasting menu courses verged on unbearable, and brought my overall experience down to a max 4 star. We had a reservation for 8pm and left the restaurant at 1130pm, not by choice. It was fairly obvious that other tables had also felt weary, as we all waited on last courses there was more and more silence across the restaurant. A shame because the execution of food was spectacular, the menu well thought out, but time management matters and I truly have never waited so long between courses ü•∫ Sadly this was the main impression I left with rather than the food.

I‚Äôm hopeful that this issue will be mitigated once they change to tasting menu only. The food deserves to be experienced, but I can‚Äôt see myself returning or recommending anyone wait that long for fine dining.
Great little restaurant in Victoria‚Äôs Chinatown with outstanding food and really nice atmosphere.  We had the tasting menu of 7 courses if you count bread and petit fours. The food was absolutely amazing, Chinese milk bread with charred scallion butter, a trio of Chinese street food which include lamb, halibut and a scallop pure beautifully presented to be eaten with chopsticks, then we had cucumber where the water was replaced with champagne, served with thinly sliced albacore tuna, a halibut dish where the halibut was melt in your mouth with a miso buerre blanc, lamb with soybean cassoulet and a delicious dessert with white chocolate toffee sprinkle. Every dish was perfect. The wine list and pairing are also very well done. My only complaint is the timing of the service. A little too long between courses. Service was attentive and the servers were very friendly, but the kitchen needs to tighten up their timing. I love a relaxed pace, but it was just a little too relaxed. Despite that, I highly recommend this restaurant!!! Chef has nailed the food!!
What a wonderful dining experience‚Äîin this historic Chinatown building.  The seven course tasting menu was superlative. Beautifully plated and served at the perfect pace in order to enjoy each imaginative and delicious course. The halibut, the lamb, the tuna were such unique dishes, each cooked and garnished with such interesting combinations of fresh and imaginative ingredients.  Even a delightful presentation before dessert of a palate cleanser. And the dessert was perfect featuring in season strawberries. We especially enjoyed the enthusiastic and detailed explanation of each course as it was served. The staff are a great team, professional and attentive and so creative.  They made our dining experience very enjoyable and memorable. Thank you, too, for the fun presentation of apple juice to 3 year old Kieran !
This may have been the best dinner in my entire life. The tasting menu was inspired. The entire offering was spectacular.
Wow, what an incredible meal! It is hard to find full tasting menus like this in Victoria. I was very impressed by everything I ate.

@Victoria_Foodies

name: Aura Waterfront Restaurant + Patio
reviews:
We chose Aura for this year‚Äôs ‚ÄúVictoria Dine Around Dinner‚Äù.  Wow, simply the best food and experience.  Of course the views and vibes at the restaurant are what you expect‚Ä¶ sitting there makes you appreciate why Victoria is loved.  Service was friendly and welcoming.  Food was on another level, and the wine pairings were thoughtful and enjoyed. There is so much care, technique and experience put into the food.  With that in mind, I think the prices are on the low side.  Everywhere has increased their prices because of current issues surrounding operating restaurants in 2022 - so I feel you get quite a lot of value for their current pricing. It‚Äôs appreciated but understand if prices need to be adjusted.
It was such a peaceful experience eating with a sea view. We had brunch, which was chicken with waffles and eggs. The flavour in all the dishes was unreal, especially the soft texture of the waffles. We didn‚Äôt have a reservation but the staff was super nice and still gave us a view table. Couldn‚Äôt be any better. Big shoutout to Kaitlyn I believe, she was so friendly from saying hi to bye. She told us about the dishes and about places we could visit in Victoria while we were there. Overall, great staff and amazing food. On a side note, patio was closed when we visited so if you‚Äôre going to have a patio experience, just call the restaurant and confirm.
Would definitely give the overall High Tea experience at Aura a high score. The service was on point, the presentation beautiful, and the views are some of the best in the city. I also really loved the Japanese twist on most of the bites - starting with salmon aburi on an onikamiyaki pancake & a chicken katsu sandwich, ending with sesame tarts, matcha opera cake and more. But I did find myself wishing that all flavours were kicked up about two notches. Standouts we‚Äôre the glazed scone and katsu sandwich. Could live withouts include the pork bun, tamago sandwich and beets on a bun.
Great Western omelette and Aura Benedict! We enjoyed our stay in the hotel as well as our breakfast at Aura waterfront restaurant. We were also with 3 toddlers and they were kept busy with the provided drawing supplies which was nice.
The quality of food and service  is pretty good, for sure.
But the portion is smaller than smaller. Also, I‚Äôm not a fan of the coffee (written as espresso but served as normal black coffee), a lot of spaces for improvement.

name: Cecelia Ravine Bike Park
reviews:
Nice park. Weird elementals. Non aggressive though. I had a good rest. Burnside Burms look dope. Would ride a BMX and do some sketchy painful shtuff but broken ankle, so.....
All gender washroom on opposite side of the ravine. Nice well to do children's playground and work out/exercise equipment and or infrastructure or what have you. Locals did not seem bothered by my presence. Some were even friendly.
I chose Cecilia Ravine to be my first experience on this type of thing. I throughly enjoyed myself. My only complaint is how short the trails are and how overall small the park is. It doesn't take long for it to be busy  and you have to watch out for little kids on balance bikes.
The park is poorly maintained and a lot of the features are quite worn. If you live close-by this is a great place to hop into but if you need to drive i recommend North Saanich Bike Park.
Well maintained and great location...perfect track for any age...young or old...big or small...my boys (18 & 14) love it!!
The park is good, up to a certain extent, poorly maintained, water builds up at the bottom of the easy track and 1 spot on the "hardest" track, the difficulty for the tracks aren't the best either because the "harder" track (ranked as blue) is more difficult than "hardest" (ranked as black), I also think adding a few rocks into the trails could make it better  for new people, there are also some issues with the drop into the "hardest" track it has been worn down are the landing making it slightly unstable to land on and there isn't enough of a run up to clear it, there are also some visitor created trails that lead to jumps and one off the side of the park, but the park is good for new people

name: The Pedaler Cycling Tours & Rentals
reviews:
We did a large family bike along the coast, Charles and Jordan at the peddler were awesome! He was very patient getting us all suited up and instructed us on how to use the different styles of bikes suited to everyone's needs. Both were very accommodating when we lost track of time. This was a great activity while visiting the island! Definitely a must to enjoy the beautiful coastline and the lush scenery in the downtown.
We've live in Victoria for more than five years now and mostly driving and walking around. But last weekend decided to try e-bikes with the Pedaler Cycling. It was an amazing experience! Jordan was a huge fun to talk with! He gave us tons of useful tips about the city and places to visit üëå
We did a great ride along the Dallas road and definitely will be back for more rides to the  Galloping goose trail  and to Sidney! Cheers to the Pedaler  üíô ‚ù§ üíú
Amazing customer service! In August, I chose to do a day rental and half way through my trip I unfortunately got into a accident which caused damage to the bike and myself. Not only did the staff not charge me for my abruptly shortened rental or damage but they also took time to patch me up too. They were very kind! They offer multiple bike options are all well kept and in good condition. Moreover, they have various tours, and rental options available to suit all riders and trip durations. My experience has been outstanding so I would definitely recommend them if you're looking to rent a bike or do a city tour.
Wow! What a great experience. So wonderful to get out on the bike in the fresh air with a knowledgeable and personable guide. Ian was great as a tour guide and it was fabulous to get into some of the backstreets of Victoria. Great service. Great quality bikes and equipment. Thank you. I'd highly recommend The Pedaler.
The city gardens tour was fun and educational.   Barbara has amusing stories of their quirky histories and takes you to several very different gardens.  Best to take some snacks; we had just enough time in each garden to have a bite, a few sips and to learn how each garden is unique.  The views were easy to access on the e-bike. We didn‚Äôt spend too long in any one place, and the tour lasted just the right amount of time.  Thanks for a different look at Victoria‚Äôs ‚Äúother‚Äù gardens.

name: Broad Street Cycles
reviews:
This is the type of shop people are imagining when they romanticize about the "local bike shop." The reality rarely matches the vision portrayed in cycling magazines, but it sure does at Broad Street Bikes. I went in a bunch of times during a short stay in Victoria--sometimes because I needed something, but other times just to pop in--and everyone was always welcoming, knowledgeable, and skillful. I made a number of unusual requests for service and goods, and they filled all of them.
Excellent service! I‚Äôve been taking our families bikes here for 4 years and I couldn‚Äôt be happier with the service the shop provides. Also, for you Yeti riders, go see Andrew, he‚Äôs a magician!
Peter and Andrew from BSC took care of me in time of emergency. I broke my handlebar on Thursday before my Ironman70.3 race on Sunday, I‚Äôm from out of town and never been to Victoria before. So I frantically called & sent emails to bike shops around town to get a replacement.
Peter from BSC replied immediately that they might have it. So I immediately went there with the bike, and it was the right one! Andrew installed it in no time and made sure the bike is in proper working order for the race. I finished the race with a personal best thanks to these guys and the staff of BSC. Anytime I‚Äôm back in Victoria, I know for sure I‚Äôll be taken care off by this amazing team. Thanks again guys!
What an amazing team!  This company is absolutely wonderful!  Thanks so much for always taking care of me when i drop in with loose bike parts and need custom orders.
I needed a new tubeless tire for my gravel bike. They had a nice selection and were able to get me riding again. Peter was awesome!

name: Victoria Bike Rentals
reviews:
This was such a great and affordable way to explore Victoria! The city is very cycle-friendly and we were able to see everything we wanted to in the few hours we were there, without paying over the top prices with the cruise excursion packages. The bikes were super great condition and we were provided with helmets and a bike lock, and the employee that helped us (Matt) was so nice and helpful, showed us spots on the map to check out and was available by phone if we wanted any other recommendations. So happy with this experience and if we ever end up in Victoria again we will do it again for sure!
Visited Victoria on the Quantum of the Seas. We had no plans for what to do in Victoria but wanted to explore a bit. This was right at the terminal, and the owner(s) were great about getting us set up and giving us a map with places to go. Beacon Hill Park was absolutely gorgeous, and even riding down the coast line was a view I'll remember for awhile.

I will say that their website needs updating. It says $25 per person but we were charged $40 each. I imagine this is a holdover from when they shut down during the pandemic. That being said, $40 per person seems reasonable to me for what we got. Just keep that in mind if you actually read  look at the website ahead of time unlike we did.

The owner made us feel welcome in Victoria and we had a great time. Great option if you want to see the city and do so at your own pace.
We had an amazing time renting bikes from the Cruise Port in Victoria. VBR made it super easy. Their staff was very friendly and gave us great suggestions on where to ride. They had a nice selection of bikes and even gave us helmets, bike locks and a backpack to carry out stuff. It was a little further to town than we wanted to walk but got there on bike in 10 minutes. Highly recommended!
We had a great experience with Victoria bike rentals! We walked over from our hotel, it was really easy to find and get started biking right away. Price was reasonable and they gave us great ideas of places to bike. I‚Äôm glad they were open for evening biking because the other bike rental place closer to our hotel closed early. Definitely recommend!
Quick and easy bike rental experience. Rented 1 hybrid (non e bike) in April 2023. I walked up and rented a bike with no hassle. Was provided a map and a few suggestions of places to check that suited my interests. Was provided a helmet and a lock for the rental. Highly recommended for those that want to get a little bike ride in and check out all the cool spots around town.

name: North 48 Bicycles
reviews:
Great bikes, even better service. The routes he provides are very thoughtful. I would highly recommend this place for anyone looking to road bike around in Victoria.
Had a great experience renting beautiful gravel bikes from David for a 5 day tour around the area with 2 girlfriends. He was very accommodating in meeting us a locations convenient to us when we started and finished our tour. Thanks for a great trip!
Rented a road bike for the day. Bike was in excellent shape. Drop off and pick up delivery was terrifically convenient. Service was friendly, prompt and overall top notch.
Rented road bikes for Victoria 70.3. Bikes, set-up, delivery and pick-up were fantastic. Thanks, David!
I had an amazing experience renting a bike from North48 for the Victoria IM 70.3. David helped deliver the bike directly to bike Check-In, and he set me up with a real ripper! The bike was exactly setup to my own bike specs and ended up being as comfortable as my own. I highly recommend renting from North48!! Thank you!!!

name: Capital Bike
reviews:
I took the bike skills and safety course for adults  from Capital Bike. Super course. It was very informative and fun. Best thing I could have done for safely riding in the city. I wish motorists had the same information.
The Capital Bike Course is for everyone. Beginner cyclists can learn the rules and etiquette of the road and avid cyclists can get out of bad habits. This cycling course gave me confidence and skills to safely get my family and I around Victoria. We use our bikes significantly more than I did before. Considering the rising cost of gas and food, cycling is saving our family buckets! I'd highly recommend everyone, including drivers, take the Capital Bike course.

Instructors were kind, understanding, and very helpful. They didn't make me feel silly nor talked down to beginners learning to bike. They always made us feel safe and heard. Very great listeners and speakers in the classroom and helpful tips and encouragement for practical riding outdoors.
I  recently attended the all day Ebike skills Course offered by Capital Bike. I found it to be a comprehensive, informative, well paced,  course consisting of  three components -  classroom, hands-on skill building and a group ride. I  highly recommend it!
I took the Bike Skills Course. I hadn't been on a bike in many years. This course was perfect in length and information so I could feel safe to start riding my bike around town. The teachers were enthusiastic and knew the city well for our practice ride around town. I learned a lot about the bike infrastructure.
The bike skills course I did with Jaye is one of the best things I've ever done for myself.  Nervous adult who knows I should bike more and drive less but lacked confidence and experience. After one day I felt a thousand times better and now I know I can bike anywhere!

name: Bike Fixtation at Cedar Hill Recreation Center
Oak Bay Bicycles
reviews:
I have had 2 experiences with the service department of this shop.  In 2022 I took my bike in for a crankset installation and as a "courtesy" they tuned my derailleur.   Not only did I not ask them to touch my derailleur, but it was the worst tune I'd ever seen in my life.  There was nothing wrong with it before and they actually ended up damaging it.  I took it back and they fixed the tune but now it makes a noise over every bump which it never used to do.

Recently I decided to give them a second chance.  I needed a damper service for my shock and they're one of the only shops in town that do it in-house (as opposed to sending it away to the mainland).  Through no fault of their own, the job was not able to be complete, but when I got my bike back they had contaminated my front brake and I had to buy new pads.

I'm sure most people have better luck with them than I did, but even if there's a small chance that they compromise your brakes, do you want to take that risk?  There are plenty of competent shops in town. I strongly recommend avoiding this one when it comes to repair and service.
I dropped my bike off in need of a larger seat for my daughter on the back and I was in a hurry! The staff were so kind, they found me the right seat immediately - It was ready for pick up THE SAME DAY.  This is amazing considering what a busy time of year it is for bike repair etc. I was blown away and won't go anywhere else for bikes in Victoria : )
Went in looking for a screw to replace the ones I lost from my kryptonite lock that I bought from another shop and they found a screw and gave it to me free of charge! A great help and really shows what a great attitude they have at this shop, would definitely come back.
Just about as solid a bike shop as you‚Äôll find. We recently purchased a new FS MTB for our son here and the team that helped us knew their stuff and seemed to provide trustworthy guidance on what we needed for age/weight and riding needs. Parking in the back.
Excellent service and great range of bikes and equipment

name: Bike Valet
reviews:
What a great service. Quick, secure, friendly. We stored our e-bikes there, had lunch in town, did some shopping and realized that coming downtown was once again fun.
This service is a great idea and I appreciate that they have expanded their hours of operation, but it needs to further expand them so that people working downtown outside of 9-5 can truly benefit. It closes when it's needed most (when there's the most theft).

Local businesses should focus on initiatives like this rather than crying over government employees working from home.
Like the security hate the service. I checked my bike Saturday noon June 3rd older lady looking after customers was snippy and had a real attitude. She didn't seem comfortable handling bikes, especially the bigger e-cargo bikes. Didn't instill a lot of confidence that my new bike was in good hands. I offered to help her with it, and that's when she snapped back, " No one's allowed back here." I almost wanted to just ride away. If you can't be courteous to people coming downtown to shop, it's just another reason why not to come downtown.
Just used it today, Sunday March 19, 2023.  Best part is a FREE registration to Project 529 Garage.  Improves your chances at getting your bike back if it stolen.
Overall very efficient and friendly.  You get a bike tag on a ring with a clip.  Easy to connect to your other keys if you are carrying them.
I‚Äôve used it four or five times now and spent more time walking around town and shopping/eating because it. I hope to see this made permanent and expanded. Although the free price is nice, if a modest fee can help it become permanent and expand that would be well worth it. Perhaps this could be the seed for several more locations that would evolve into an access-card controlled system where the access cards double as transit passes‚Ä¶

name: Cycles West
reviews:
Great speedy service from a family owned shop. They clean every inch of your bike by hand after breaking down, deep cleaning, and reassembling the mechanicals. Got a new chain too after a recommendation, and it helped a lot with shifting and running. So smooth after üòéüëç ready for summer!
Awesome staffs and services. If you are looking for a expert local bike shop look no further
Fixed a wheel problem I was having on the spot. Friendly and helpful, bring your bike here for repairs!
We have purchased multiple bikes from Cycles West and are very happy with the service and bikes. Jill and Simon run an amazing shop and have very friendly staff. Thank you for being a genuine small business in our community.
Wonderful friendly and very professional. I just bought a Norco used bike from them and could not be happier. They quickly tuned the bike and installed some components for me. I was so glad I made a trip back to the store to let them know, that they have just become my new best friends. Anyone looking for good quality at reasonable price, than by all means drop in the see them.

name: Cit-E Cycles Electric Bikes - Victoria
reviews:
I just bought a Tern HSD-S8I from Jamie he sourced the bike had it into the store from Vancouver, put together and ready for a test ride in only a few days. He explaineds all the details a new ebike owner should know and suggested accessories for your type of riding.
Got my bike today üôå Jamie is a pretty cool guy üòé knowledgeable and patient üòÄ with me I'm a noob. This will help reduce the time spent on public transit. I Got the milano plus ‚ûïÔ∏è it rips 32 KM HR so far so good thanks again I couldn't be any happier.
Jamie was extremely helpful and knowledgeable when helping me pick out my ebike. He went above and beyond to make sure I was happy with my purchase, and was very helpful in showing me how the bike works. Thanks!
Highly Recommend !!!!! Five Stars..... Jamie is a highly qualified e-bike expert. Absolutely no pressure sales, and first-rate service. Jamie is a one man show, and has incredible patience. If you are even remotely thinking about an e-bike, you should visit Cit-E Cycles. I am thrilled with my Cube Reaction Hybrid Pro 500 Allroad. It has taken me places I would otherwise never get to go. The first day I rode it out of the shop, down to the Blue Bridge, and took the Galloping Goose all the way to Sooke. 55K !!! The next day I rode past the Sooke Potholes, and up to Leechtown. I now have almost 500k on it, and I will never look back !!!
Jamie helped answer my questions, made sure the bike I wanted was the right size and fit correctly. A week later brought it back for an adjustment to smooth out the shifting and he took care of it right on the spot. A great experience overall.

name: Cit-E Cycles Electric Bikes - Victoria Hillside
reviews:
Jonny was extremely helpful when it came to purchasing my eBike. I'd absolutely recommend this shop for anybody looking for one themselves - they have a fantastic combination of knowledgeable, friendly staff and quality brands. What more could you want?
Great service, knowledgeable staff.
Great service and very knowledgeable

name: Oak Bay Bicycles Rentals & Tours
reviews:
Oak Bay Bicycles perfectly catered and facilitated my advanced mountain bike ride in the Victoria Area.  They picked me up at hotel, gave me a great ride within my time window, and returned me to hotel with no issues.
The mountain bike rental and shuttle out to Hartland was great. Super convenient pickup and drop-off downtown, terrific communication, great advice on what trails to ride, and even some advice on the best places to eat after.
We rented bikes for the day from here, the service is excellent, friendly knowledgeable staff, comfortable bikes and pick from our hotel was offered. We highly recommend this company and will use them again when we hopefully return to Vancouver Island next year!

name: North Park Bike Shop
reviews:
This is the place to go to get your bikes and all things bike related! I received the most amazing service from Lucas and John when I purchased my bike almost 3 weeks ago (from Lucas) and when I came back a week or so ago to ask questions about locks and security for my bike (from John). Both men were OUTSTANDING. I truly appreciated the time Lucas spent with me when I was choosing which bike to purchase. I came in knowing how much I wanted to spend, what specifics I was looking for in a bike, and what my concerns were. He went above and beyond explaining everything to me and I am so grateful to him!!! He found me a bike almost instantaneously that was exactly in my price range, helped me understand all the intricate details I didn‚Äôt know about the bike and what I should look for, and his relatable and upbeat, energetic manner is unflappable.  Likewise, John was wonderful! I came in unsure how to properly lock my bike and he gently walked me through all the steps, taught me what to do (in a non-condescending manner), and was hilarious and charismatic. Some of the best service I have ever received. Thank you SO MUCH Lucas and John!!!! I‚Äôll be telling everyone to come and see you gentlemen for all their biking needs! üòÑ
Best bike repair shop in town üëå I had initially tried a different business but they had a waitlist of two weeks. North Park was able to take me in much more quickly, and for a better price. Knowledgeable staff that takes the time to explain the work they'll be doing and why, fair prices, same-day pickup, and a great location (the cafe next door has my favourite lemon cakes in town). My bike now runs smoothly and my breaks are in great shape. Highly recommend!
Needed a rather specific and not too common tire on short notice and they had it in stock! Pleasant, courteous and informative. Their display floor is packed with quality bikes and accessories to meet the needs of your average commuter (who may want above average quality accessories) or those who do touring and bikepacking. I'll be visiting them again.
Ive been there a few times to service my bike now, and every single time they are so thoughtful and friendly when they help out. They put the bike up ok the hoist and actually go steo by step with you as to whats going on. Honestly its the best bike service place ive ever been to. Super transparent about pricing, and super transparent about the work they do. It seems like the work environment is really great for everyone that works there, and it shows in their service
My bike was looooong overdue for a tune up and these guys were so helpful through the entire experience. I felt fully informed throughout the whole experience, from the booking of an appointment, to walking me through the estimate and diagnostic process, up to pick-up and payment day.  I appreciated the communicative staff and mechanics who ensured I was aware of all the things that needed taking care of - and some unexpected, but necessary replacements after thorough inspection. Super excited to riding my bike again, knowing it's had a full once-over with thoughtful attention to detail. Thanks for your hard work!

name: Recyclistas Bike Shop
reviews:
I did their course where they teach you how to repair whatever your bike needs and it was amazing! I learned how to take a deraileur apart, resurface my brakes, install a new drive train and more! My instructor Shayne was an absolute gem. Super patient, enthusiastic and informative. Great shop doing a big service to the cycling community here in Vic.
Hecking great place. Just did did the "learn how to fix your own bike" course and it exceeded my expectations. Folks were super down to earth and so good at teaching and giving space to learn and practice. Being able to buy a variety of used parts downstairs is also really cool!
Had both our bikes repaired/ tuned up
Did a wonderful job. Staff members were wonderful to deal with, so friendly and very helpful answers all questions you may have. Highly recommend them for bike repairs üòÅ‚ù§ We will be back for sure üëç
They have classes that teach you how to fix your own bike. I was really anxious and wasn't super confident but they made it easy and relaxed. You just show up, say your problem, and they help you diagnose the root issue and fix it yourself. They provide all the tools teach you to use them. They're great teachers and really chill. If you need a tune up or fixes, take it here. You'll learn to do it yourself and feel more confident and capable for it.

Also hats off to Shane. A good teacher makes all the difference.
They have helped us multiple times and it has always been a great experience! Great prices on used bikes and AMAZING staff.

name: PitStop Bikes Victoria
reviews:
Great little bike shop! Just brought my 15 year old Giant in for a much-needed overhaul and it came out looking and riding like new! A little pricey but much cheaper than buying a brand new one!
Super helpful and knowledgeable - had a problem making child seats and panniers and bike trailers all work on one platform. Owner took the time to talk through the problem with me and had a fast turnaround with a solution.
Attention. To. Detail.
If you need a used bike that will be your next baby this is the spot‚Ä¶ I am amazed at the level of care that‚Äôs put into the bikes for sale this guy loves fixing bikes and is living his dream in this shop.

Good vibes and great bikes!
Guillermo is really knowledgeable and has done a great job tuning my bike.  He was able to point out a problem area I was then able to address with the part manufacturer to get a replacement.
If you are in victoria this is the place to get your bike repaired. This man loves what he does. My bike felt new after he did some repairs. Highly recommend this small business owner.

name: Trek Bicycle Store
reviews:
Absolutely great service from a great bunch of guys!
Went to get get some small adjustments made to a new bike I had recently purchased which they did no problem and very quickly. Unfortunately, shortly after leaving the shop I had a crash due to a defective part from the manufacturer (not fitted by the guys at the shop) so took my bike straight back to them for some repairs. Despite it not being their fault at all, they replaced the defective part and a few others that had been damaged in the crash completely free of charge!

Cannot recommend these guys enough, absolutely brilliant service and will certainly be going back to them for any future work or bike-related purchases I need!
Had a really good experience today at the GoByBike week tune up station! I had a flat tire and the volunteer from trek replaced my tire tube and walked me through every step! Super patient and kind guy! Thanks again! Learned so much today!
Went in to get my fork and brake overhauled  and was told by the guy at the desk it was up to a month but he brought me over to the head tech and he said I was looking at about a week since they will send my fork to sram and service my brake in house! Shout out to Arron for listening to me when I stated I wanted my fork travel changed and my whole hose changed on my brake and not just trimming the hose to remove the damaged part (I have dot fluid brakes which will eat the liner over time and that hose was over a decade old since I just got the bike on a trade) I would Recommend this shop to anyone who knows how to work on their bike but doesn‚Äôt have the means to do the big stuff. If you need a basic tune up there‚Äôs lots of shops for that in town w a faster turn around but I would definitely recommend them for any major services
To the staff that helped me with a broken crank arm last night and instead of just tightening the arm lile i asked, diagnosed the problem and found me an amazing fix. This is amazing customer service. I'll be back tonight after work to drop off payment.
This is way above and beyond.
Incredible service! I am new to cycling, and I don't know much about bicycles yet. I was at the store for almost 2 hours, as every inner tube I bought kept popping due to my own error. The employees were incredibly patient and helpful. They ended up taking my bicycle into the shop and fixing it up for me.
The way I was treated will certainly make me return for all my cycling needs.

name: Russ Hay's The Bicycle Shop
reviews:
This review is long overdue. I knew when I first met Mike that this was the bike shop for me. Him and Aaron always say "We'll look after you" and it's the truth. I'm always looking for a reason to spend money and Aaron always talks me out of it, even suggesting products from different stores sometimes. I've been to other bike shops in town and none of them offer the value, honesty and customer service that I get from Russ Hays. Ben in service has been an incredible addition to the gang too. They always manage to fit my bike in if I have any issues, and never act annoyed if I have a million questions (yes I'm that guy). Honestly everyone in service really knows their stuff and are happy to talk shop. I could go on and on about these guys. Russ Hays is the GOAT!
Awesome friendly staff! Were wonderful pulling a massive nail out of my tire even letting me watch how they did the repair and answering my questions about prevention. Also bought a lock which I had a rare issue with a sticky key, they exchanged easy and got me set up with a new one quickly, I didn't even have to go through the lock company. Thank y'all!
I went into Russ Hays hoping to get a piece installed in my handle bars to allow me to be more upright on my Specialized Vedo. Aaron was the solutions guy and found and installed exactly what I needed while we chatted. Knowledgeable, efficient, kind. A 5 star experience. Thank you!
My wife wanted to try couple of the Specialized trail/mountain bikes and I had called few days ahead. Very helpful on the phone took the time to look up stock and even called me back to let me know they had the bikes on hand. When we got there Ryan and his team made sure all the bikes were setup to my wife's specs which made a world of difference. We were never rushed and Ryan made sure to answer any questions we had. And also went over the bike in detail.   We ended up purchasing the Specialized Rockhopper Expert and since we didn't have our bike rack he was kind enough to offer to have one of his colleagues who lives near us bring it out to us! And to boot his colleague spent more time to go over few other details with my wife on the bike use. Fantastic service and great and extremely knowledgeable staff all around.
I brought in a new motor to be laced into my existing e-bike wheel, which required all of the spokes to be removed. Needless to say I quickly realized the job was too big for me‚Ä¶ I brought it into (Ben) the pros at Russ Hay‚Äôs, and they fixed it up for me in record time.

Great Service, and even better people.

Thank you.

name: Bishop's Family Cycles
reviews:
I brought my son in who was convinced that the most important thing was the number of gears on his next bike. The owner patiently engaged with my boy to explain how to think about the best bike and they had a great conversation. It changed what had been a frustrating process of going to different shops into something fun. Buying my bike from here tomorrow.
They're amazing. They're friendly and considerate, and incredibly helpful with picking out what's best for your family. And once you have it, they're super helpful with repairs and maintenance.
They also have a good selection of just about everything, so even if you're just looking for a new helmet or bell, they have you covered.
Worth a trip! They're good people.
Amazing team and owner is so helpful. I have purchased gloves, locks and a bike from them as the have European styles / brands.
Incredibly helpful. After hours of being lost in internet research hell, I called and my questions were answered thoughtfully and expertly. I haven't bought a bike yet as I haven't decided, but buying from this shop is absolute no brainer. Thank you!
Can‚Äôt say enough positive things about this place.  The customer service is excellent.  The e-cargo bike inventory is the best in town. Robert is very knowledgeable and worked hard to find us the perfect bike for our family.  Unfortunately, the first bike we bought was recalled and had to be sent back to the manufacturer.  Robert helped us through that and even lent us his own personal e-cargo bike for a few weeks while we were without, which was incredibly generous.  Whether you are an experienced e-cargo cyclist or interested in testing one out for the first time, I would highly recommend that you make Bishop‚Äôs your first stop.

name: Fort Street Cycle
reviews:
I had the best experience getting my new bike from Adam and Mike, they were able to get me set up with everything I needed and then some. Knowledgeable, passionate and helpful, I just took my new bike out for a spin and I could not be happier.
I was biking home and had an issue with my bike, Fort Street Cycle was about to close but they still waited for me to get there after I called and helped me. Ryan and the other workers were amazing! They also have great accessories like bike lights, bells etc. Highly recommend, the service is wonderful and the employees are friendly!
I recently had a custom built bike at this bike shop, and I can honestly say it was a great experience. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. They helped me pick out the best parts for my bike and made sure to answer all my questions. When I received my bike, it was everything I hoped for. The craftsmanship was top notch. I could not be happier with my purchase and will be back for my future bike needs. Shout out to Adam, Rhy, and Mike!
I had my bike fitted by Mike at Fort Cycle and tuned up by the excellent service crew there a week before my first Olympic triathlon.  The advice and expertise that I received from Mike and others at Fort Cycle truly made an enormous difference to my performance on the bike.  The bike was perfectly calbrated for an efficient and comfortable ride!!    I highly recommend for anyone who is cycling a lot to have your bike set up optimized by Mike!  It is 100% worth it!!
I have been a Fort Street client for decades.  I enjoy the location, layout of the store and for many years I have enjoyed the customer service and level of support.  I noticed quite a few changes since the change in ownership a few years ago but found the level of friendliness from the new staff helped make up for any shortcomings.

This summer I brought in my p3 for a full-service overhaul, while the work was done in time, once I got back on the bike, I felt that the level of performance was not what I had experienced in the past for work done, parts replaced and cost.  I brought the bike back and asked them to dial it in.  While they accepted the additional work, I found the chief mechanic to be begrudging and when the bike was retuned it performed a bit better but still was not at the level of quality I expected in terms of performance or cleanliness.

Around the same time, I dropped of my mountain bike and asked them to look to see what work might need to be done.  I asked them to please contact me with a quote depending on what they found.  Instead, when they contacted me, it was to tell me that they had completed a full overhaul to the tune of almost $300.  When I picked up the bike, I noticed that again, the performance was not in line with the level of service and cost.  In fact, when I checked it over it seemed like no work had been done except replacing the chain which was something that I had not asked for and did not need to be done as the bike was only 2 years old and did not have the amount of ride time to account for a new chain.  It also felt that no derailleur adjustments had been made for the new chain.  I also noticed a new sound when I spun my back wheel that had not been present before.  I took the bike back and asked them to look.  This time I found the shop staff (not the sales staff) to be outright hostile.  They made a few minor adjustments and when I asked about the sound, they told me it was a bent disc rotor.  When I told them the issue was not present when I brought the bike in, they told me I was welcome to purchase a replacement part.  Then I had a mechanic friend look at the bike and they advised me that as I suspected some of the work, I had been charged for had not been completed.

It‚Äôs clear that Fort St is no longer interested in offering any level of service, support or customer satisfaction.  They have continued to raise the costs for their labour while the quality has deteriorated.  If you are considering taking your business there, I suggest you find another shop as I now have.

name: Straight Up Cycles
reviews:
One of the best bike shops in BC with a great crew of friendly staff. large supply of gear, great mechanics, and sweet bikes for sale ranging from townies to race bikes.
Wow, I am blown away by the amazing customer service and work these guys do! I brought my well used commuter bike into them for some repairs and a tune and I cannot believe the difference. I feel like it rides better than it did when I first got it! Plus, all the work was completed in a few hours so I did not miss out on my commute. I cannot recommend Straight Up Cycles enough :) Thanks for the amazing work!
Amazing experience. Very knowledgeable guys, gave us straightforward recommendations and fixed my tire in 20-30 mins with us dropping in! Will be back ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Guys took me in on a moments notice, to do a difficult wheel true on a very rare 1980 Kuwahara bmx. They did an amazing job! Way above and beyond expectations. I trust them with any job after seeing them work. Really great price on the bill too I might add. Very reasonable!
Straight Up Cycles delivers amazing mechanics service, and genuine and judgement-free customer service. As someone who has worked in the bike industry in Vancouver in shops, as well as through nonprofit work supporting at-risk youth looking for employment in the bike mechanics industry, I am well-versed in the improvements that are needed in the bike industry. Many people feel like going to bike shops is daunting, because they have experienced sales staff and mechanics essentially making fun of their bikes, acting pretentious towards them, or assuming they don't know something about their bikes because of their gender, or because they aren't a white guy.

I took my mountain bike in for a brake bleed, and the service upon intake and pickup were wonderful. I recently moved to Victoria for school and am not familiar with the mountain biking around here, and after I asked, Tim and Richie took the time to thoroughly recommend me some trails and ways of finding mountain biking community. The price for the blake bleed was also reasonable, and they even wiped down my dirty bike (fresh from some riding on Fromme in vancouver over the break). As I left, Tim went to get the door for me so it was more accessible for me to walk out, with my mountain bike. It's these little but big things that show they care, and it makes the experience for the customer that much more comfortable and happy. My partner and I both own two bikes each, both of which we have built up ourselves, and I will continue to recommend Straight Up cycles to my friends as a safe space that offers high-quality mechanics work, and sincere customer service.

Also, bike mechanics are highly skilled and creative people that need to be able to problem solve effectively and also ideally have great interpersonal skills for customer service (which is hard to find!). and Canada currently does not have a certification system for bike mechanics, which means that they don't have great wage protection (it will vary from shop to shop of course, but this means that there's no systematic way to guarantee that a bike mechanic that has improved their skills through there x amount of years working in the industry, will be able to get a certain set wage increase). So please be kind and patient with bike mechanics, and also if it is within your means, please tip when you can!

name: Macs Cycle Centre
reviews:
I needed to replace the clamp on my bike seat, which other shops had sold out of, and was in a hurry. Service was very friendly, efficient and affordable. Google maps sent me to the back of the shop, so it took a minute for me to find it but it was well worth it - 5 stars for the service and price (its not their fault Google maps can be glitchy) Just make sure you go to the front of the store on Shelbourne :) I‚Äôll definitely be coming back for any cycling needs!
Maintenance less expensive than other places, very friendly staff, fast service (no need to wait 2 weeks until next availble appointment). Not a 5 star rating because of a single thing - the chain looks super dirty while they claim they cleaned it.
I had bought a bike from Mac Cycles back in 2008. I only went to this bike shop to get tune ups, repairs, get new parts, etc.  I like to shop local and support local business if I can.  I returned today with my old bike looking to buy a new one and be rewarded for my loyalty with a deal.  I reviewed their bikes, they told me the price for what I wanted and I asked for a deal for my support to their business after 14 years.  They offered me nothing except two tune-ups.  Very disappointing.  If you're looking for a bike shop that will be loyal to you as you support their business, Don't go to Mac Cycles!.. There are lots of bike shops in Victoria to choose from. Review them carefully.  Happy Bike Shopping!...Elsewhere :)
I brought my son‚Äôs bike in for a front break fix. The guys fixed right there for no charge as it was a simple fix. They were very friendly and helpful, I would highly recommend their shop
Macs Cycle Center sets the bar for outstanding value and service! Look no where else for your cycling needs.

name: Fairfield Bicycle Shop
reviews:
Great shop. Reminds me of some bike shops in southern France. I love the place and the atmosphere in there. Besides my favorite brands like Ortlieb, Tern or Brooks, they also carry recumbent trikes and bikes of different brands incl. AZUB recumbents. The staff know their stuff very well and will help you even with very special needs and requests. Very recommended.
I came in carrying my wheel,  spoke to a counter person and began to look around. Good selection of bikes , electric  and manual  with a wide price range
I left 10 minutes later with a fresh tube and a big smile. Price was 24$
Think about the world but shop where you live
I took the intro to mechanics course with my 11 yr old son over spring break.  It was awesome.  Michael got him interested and held his attention for hours.  I now have a wheel-truing expert and someone who loves to work on his bike.  Highly recommend it if you are interested in learning the fundamentals that you can build upon.
Henry fixed my recurring brake issue in about 5 seconds AND showed me how to address it in the future. I'm super happy and grateful for the great service and will be coming back in the future for sure. Thank you!
Simply the best‚Ä¶and wish they had a shop in Ottawa.

I broke the O-ring on my garmin holder and they helped me out by finding a replacement without a charge.

If you ever create a shirt or hat with your logo, let me know and I will order one online.

name: Pedego Electric Bikes Victoria
reviews:
Rented e-bikes from Pedego twice during our stay in Victoria. What a great way to see the city! We covered so much distance and were able to see so much! The bikes are easy to operate. The staff are lovely and knowledgeable. They provided an overview of the bikes, and gave suggestions on what trails & routes to follow üòä Will definitely be renting e-bikes from Pedego Victoria again!
I was an ebike virgin and you know what they say; the first time can be awkward but I will definitely do it again! The attendant was very helpful and informative, she really settled my nerves. Overall brilliant fun, highly recommended!
Such a great time learning and riding these bikes!  We rode around much of Victoria and saw things we haven‚Äôt seen before plus we could pit as much exercise into it as we wanted to. The staff were very helpful and kind. What an awesome time we had and I highly recommend this experience!
Great service, location (that smoothie/coffee place was great too!) The only thing I‚Äôd say is, my bike wasn‚Äôt a great fit for me - and even though we did a test drive of about a block it took me about 5-10 minutes to realize it was a bit too small and my knees started to hurt. Maybe we looked like bike pros or something (haha) but we could have done with a touch more service at the initial booking to make sure we got helmets and bikes that fit our bodies. Cheers!
We had wanted to rent E Bikes in Victoria and went to Pedego bike rentals. Their location was conveniently located near the inner harbour and also nice, clean and new. The staff were helpful in getting us set up and we were able to enjoy a nice 24km bike ride downtown and on the many trails around Victoria. We recommend Pedego to anyone and will use them again the next time we are in Victoria.

name: Victoria Electric Bikes
reviews:
Had the best experience here! Charles took his time to understand my needs, find me a great bike and all the things I‚Äôd need to get started. Friendly, knowledgeable and building a real community here. LOVE this place can‚Äôt recommend it enough
I had an amazing experience shopping at this store! Charles and the rest of the staff are incredibly kind and friendly. They gave me great information about all the bikes and were accommodating with taking test rides. They made picking out a bike a very relaxed and fun experience. I can't recommend them enough for their expertise and friendliness!
I absolutely love the ebike I bought from this shop a few years ago when they were still in Oak Bay. Its been my main source of transportation and it‚Äôs still going strong. Since purchasing I‚Äôve had some maintenance from them including a tire change, a tune-up and most recently the power switch/computer replaced.  They are always friendly, straight forward, and fair.  I would definitely recommend you buy your bike from this shop.  They have great products and great customer service.
Excellent service and attention to detail! The level of care from Charles, Alexandra and the rest of the team is unmatched - thank you so much for a wonderful experience. Highly recommended!
I can't say enough about the care and customer service Charles provided when I purchased my first e-bike. I am a tall and heavier cyclist and Charles and his team took the time to work with me to find a bike that stands up to a daily trail commute. My initial choice did not fit my daily commuting needs and Charles provided excellent support and allowed me to trade up to a Kona El Kahuna that has proved to be exceptionally reliable and durable.  Charles and team are professional, courteous, knowledgeable and always stand by their product and service.  I  recommend Charles and his team to everyone who needs a bike, service or expert advice.

name: EnergyOne E-Bikes Victoria Mayfair
reviews:
James was great. He checked my e-scooter and made sure the breaks were at their optimal ! Friendly and thorough. Thanks üëçüôÇ!
BEWARE BEFORE YOU BUY MAKE SURE YOU THINK ABOUT IT PROPERLY OR YOU LOSE $40.00. We try their electric scooter 350 display model, we decide to get one and pay. Now, we choose a new one display to bring home. The display has different feeling, the stem of the scooter is not smooth when you turn it. Since it has no warranty and we didn‚Äôt bring it home yet, we decided not to continue it! They won‚Äôt refund us without a charge, they charge us for $40.00 fee.
We were wandering the mall and popped in as the electric folding bikes caught our eye.  Staff was awesome, took us out to test drive before purchasing.  Definitely are ideal for our needs as we can fold up and store in our motorhome. Thank you for the great service  very knowledgeable team.
I walked in, asked alot of questions. Was very pleased how I was treated. They answered all my questions. I didn't feel pressured into buying. But went in for more information about the ebikes, I walked out with all my questions answered. Very professional experience I felt. These are great guys to speak with. Highly recommend if you're looking for an ebike with great prices.
So happy to have bought a Columbus E Bike from Oliver today at Slane Cycles in Mayfair Mall. Great price point, reassurance that they stand behind the warranty and service. Thanks Oliver!! ü§ìüòé

name: Giant Victoria
reviews:
Incredible service! I had a specific part missing on my bike and other shops said it would be six months to get. Brought it in here and they got it fixed or replaced in minutes all while being super nice and friendly.
Purchased a Giant FastRoad SL1on Mar.10 from Dylan while visiting in Victoria. Love the bike. Great service!
