Dylan was extremely knowledgeable, patient with questions, zero sales pressure, helped me to select and quickly install various accessories after a test ride. Even offered to box the bike for shipping on return flight home. Highly recommend.
I bought an Escape 2 Disk model from this store in June 2020. Since then I have ridden this bike for over 3000 KM across British Columbia.
I did the annual service check-up last year, the service was great, and the staff was super friendly.
I usually have ridden it mostly in steep hills and so I had to change the Freehub Body this year and they were super fast in checking the stock availability for the part. I'm so happy with the service at their store and the owner, Tyson, is very supportive.
I'm embarrassed to say I've never owned my own bike.
You'll find me on foot, on a run, or a hike.

I've moved to the island and it's my moment to shine.
Living in Vic, I knew it was time.

On Christmas morning an ornament hung from the tree.
A piece of cardboard with a bike drawn on it....could it be?

I was thrilled to find my bike at the Giant store on Yates.
The fact they had stock, we knew it was fate.

When we walked inside we were greeted by Frankie, a puppy, chillin'.
Quickly the real help came with a man named Dylan.

Long story short, the Liv Alight 2 in slate grey is all mine.
You better believe that im cruising I'm looking fiiiine.

Thank you for your help, I think I'm all set.
But I may stop by to give Frankie some pets.
On Vacation and next trip I will order my bike in advance. They let me demo bikes and will assist in boxing it up to return to Ontario. Excellent service and product knowledge!!

name: Hereward Green, E&N Trail Access Point
Bicycle Repair Station
reviews:
The pump has been removed but few tools are still there (screwdrivers, Alen keys, etc.)
The tools are a bit rusty and warn, but it's a good idea to examine the bike and clean it a bit (use an old sock) before heading to Recyclistas to get your bike tuned up.   A cleaner Bicycle will get you better quality service than a dirty Bicycle (it shows that you care about your bike - and you'll save a bit of money in the long run).

What's missing is a water fountain... (Handy to wash your hands after messing with the bike a bit).
If you are stuck and need some help, then help yourself here.

name: Bungay's Bespoke Bicycle Service
reviews:
I can't speak highly enough of Scott Bungay.  He knows bikes inside and out.  I brought my 26 year-old Klein road bike to him in the hopes that he could bring it back to life.  I had heard through word of mouth that he was the guy to talk to.  As the years passed since the 1990's I replaced various parts - foolishly not sticking with original components.  I wanted the bike restored as close to original condition as possible.  That included just using vintage Dura-Ace components that would match the original hardware. I also needed a ceramic rim for the rear wheel.  The front handlebars started to make a creaking noise some time ago on climbs.  The previous bike mechanic couldn't figure that out.  In any event, Scott looked high and low - worldwide - for replacement parts and found them.  He also suggested blue Ti bolts and blue handlebar tape  to help bring out the blue lettering on the white bike (see pictures).  It looks beautiful now.  It's silent on climbs.  It has all the parts that I hoped to see back on it.
I brought my ebike and road bike for tune up and Scott did not hesitate to help me with my concerns.  Very knowledgeable when it comes to all kinds of bikes.
Approachable and has willingness to attend your needs when it comes to bike. Great job.
Bungay's Bespoke Bicycle Service is first rate.  I read the reviews and booked an appointment for a tune up and servicing of a used MTB I had just purchased. Scott went over the bike with me when I arrived and determined it needed more than just a tune up and the servicing I requested.  He  was able to get all the work done  in the same time frame at a fair price, very impressive.
I am thankful to have discovered him based on Google reviews so I decided I'd write one in case someone else is looking for a reliable, talented professional who gets the job done on time with no upselling. Simply the best.I brought my bike from Nanaimo and will continue to do so in the future. Thank you Scott and thanks to the people who took the time to write these reviews and helped me discover Bungay's Bespoke Bicycle Service.
Had annual service. Scott's  was friendly, professional. He offered opinion /advice when asked, as I wasn't sure what I needed, other than a few obvious things. But he did not make any sales pitches /upsells. He completed the work in the timeframe suggested, and the price was fair. The change in the way my bike runs is astronomical. Thank you for great work, I'm excited to be back on the road!! Will return and would definitely recommend.
I rarely leave reviews, but Scott absolutely deserves the praise you see in these Google reviews. Scott has some impressive machinist skills, too. He even built me some custom e-bike parts out of titanium for a very fair price. Go support this small business.

name: JK's Bicycleitis Inc Bay St
reviews:
Amazing bike shop. Jeremy knows his way around bicycles. It shows in his attention to detail and thorough customer service. He helped me pick out a bike that would best suit my needs, gave me tons of info about the bike, and was very hands on. He had me ride the bike to see how it felt the day I picked it up as well to make sure I was happy with it. I would definitely recommend this bike shop. The 30 years in business really shows. Thanks Bicycleitis! You da best!
I'm grateful I took my bike to Bicycleitis after the last quote I got for my old bike cost the same as a decent used one. I was about to garbage my bike! Bicycleitis worked with me on my budget, repair was quick, and service friendly too. It always feels good helping a small business to boot.
Got in an accident and dropped my bike off an hour before they closed for the weekend. I had it back they day they opened back up. It was so fast and everyone that helped was friendly and helpful. Would not recommend getting hit by a car, but I would definitely recommend coming here if you do.
Great, fast & affordable service, very friendly staff. This shop might be small but they have a ton of hard to find parts on-hand. I also really like that work very hard a breathing new life into older bicycles
100% the shop to use when getting fair deals on donated/used stuff. All the staff are very knowledgable & are super friendly whether you call or just show up. I recently spent $200 & checked everything off my list. they even looked in the back for some certain things that were not out on display. that's top notch service to me.

I always have some laughs when going in there. we all share the excitement of building cool bikes. they even complimented my personal bike!

their used section is smaller, but the parts are in all good working order, as they don't just throw every donated piece in there, aka junk. So I was able build up a bike super quick because of the great service & get it on the road for my buddy. I'll definitely be using the shop again because 1) it's fun going in there, and 2) they're selection of wolftooth narrow-wide chainrings (just randomly notice before I left) is INSANE! so many colours!!!

has Arnold Schwarzenegger would say it;

I'LL BE BACK.

name: Topaz Skate and Bike Parking Lot
Bike Fixtation At Douglas and Yates
Cycle BC Rentals and Tours
reviews:
I love this place and bringing friends here when they are in town for a visit. We usually rent a couple of Honda Ruckus scooters. It's an incredibly fun way to tour with friends and show them around Victoria. Riding up and down Dallas road and checking out all the lookouts, beaches, and cool houses. Also the staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable. You also get a thorough lesson on the ins and outs of the scooters.
Decent value for an e-bike all day at 75$
Nice selection of bikes and friendly staff. Quick in and out service.
One star missing. As we had a reservation , bikes reserved as requested. However not the one pictured.

I will likely rent here again as it‚Äôs convenient location.
Great bikes! Had an amazing ride to Port Renfrew on a CB500X. Well worth the price and some of Canada's best twisty roads nearby. Looking forward to my next trip!
Amazing customer service, great scooter ride along beach drive ‚õ±Ô∏è to mount Douglas, and Uvic Finnerty garden.
We were visiting Victoria for four nights and wanted to cycle a couple of bike routes so we went to Cycle BC to rent an e-bike for my husband.  Marty was super helpful in directing us on the best trails, good turn around points, and other points of interest along the way. I brought my own peddle bike from home, but the rear fender unfortunately got damaged on our way to Victoria from the mainland and Marty went out of his way to help me make my bike rideable still.  Friendly staff, good service, and good location for hopping onto a number of different trails from the harbor area.

name: Bike Rack (Uptown Town Plaza)
reviews:
This review is specific to the spiral shaped bike racks near the entrance to the Uptown Town Plaza.

These stands are attached to paving stones and can be lifted off of the ground making it possible to slide a lock off the end of the rack. I wrote to Uptown about this but have not heard back.

Rating = 0.5 stars for each of the following:

‚úÖ There‚Äôs a rack
‚úÖ Space for more than a few bikes
‚ùå Covered
‚úÖ Good location (close to destination or high traffic area)
‚úÖ Easy to access (open on both sides, not blocked by signs/shopping cards/displays or a curb)
‚ùå Stand design accommodates cargobikes & bikes with baskets/racks (ie, staple rack)
‚ùå EBike charging facilities
‚ùå Includes a bike repair stand
‚ùå Secured location (in a cage/room with security or requiring a key)
‚ùå Stand is properly secured to the ground
